story:
Short Summary

We are a small volunteer based martial arts Dojo for adults. We teach people the benefit of self-empowerment, physical conditioning and protection for self and others.

We teach for voluntarily at a local community building in Bensalem PA, and the money we collect is used to pay for the requisite insurance. As a result we have little money left over to equip the facility. Because of the lack of equipment we struggle to entice new members. We are stuck in a catch 22, and would love some help in getting off the ground.

Getting us new mats for our facility would provide 3 functions.

  1. It would provide a safer and more suitable training environment for everyone
  2. It would be more inviting to new students
  3. It would decrease our setup and take down time

This may seem like a trivial difference but remember we in turn are providing a service to others. This service is helping to develop the health, performance and mental well-being of everyday people. These new mats will be the foundation for growth on all who train upon them.

What We Need

We have researched various options based on the facility, the suitability and the cost effectiveness. We think that roll-up gymnastic mats would be perfect for our situation and have found a supplier. The cost is $686 plus delivery. So we are looking for $500 in contributions and hoping to top up the difference with club funds.

If we do not reach the entire goal, we will buy a smaller amount of mat, so that in the future we can supplement what we have when we obtain more funds.

The Impact

This is a simple small scale drive for help. We are not going to save the world, but if we buy these mats, they will give our students years of development. We expect them to last for many, many years.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not support our cause by financing is, perhaps you can help us shop around for good deals. Do you know someone in the business? Or perhaps you know someone trying to offload mats they no longer need? If so, you can help us.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mary Ellen Bowen and I am the founder and director of Kids To The Country in Tennessee and am asking for your help with this important program. Using direct hands-on experience with nature, Kids To The Country offers urban kids a break from often troubled situations, and a chance to connect, perhaps for the first time, with the Earth and her rhythms . The children come from homeless shelters, low-income neighborhoods, refugee centers, and special needs cases, such as Hurricane Katrina survivors. Over  5,500 children have participated so far since the program's inception in 1986.

Along with its summer sessions, KTC has a winter program with activities that reinforce the skills the kids have learned, and help keep them connected to nature and each other through the year. Before the holiday, we have a gift-making workshop and Kwanzaa celebration, where the children get to make many presents for their friends and families-—and enjoy the feelings of confidence and self-worth that come from giving as well as receiving.  The Kwanzaa Celebration reminds them of good living principles and instructions all year long.

KTC gives these kids experiential education normally unavailable to them. We teach about the value of nonviolent conflict resolution and respect for cultural diversity. They learn about their relationship with their environment and are encouraged to consider themselves truly a resource with answers to our global concerns. They learn skills like gardening and cooking, horse care and riding, mediation, expressive crafts, solar science, and nature arts. Perhaps most importantly, they are listened to and encouraged for the positive contributions that they make.

Plenty International is a not-for-profit charitable organization based in Tennessee, founded by The Farm in 1974 for relief work and development. Kids To The Country originally began in 1978 in the South Bronx in New York, where Plenty operated a free ambulance service. Neighborhood children were regularly invited to  The Farm’s upstate New York branch, where they received obvious great benefit. When the Bronx ambulance project completed its goals in New York, Kids To The Country was re-established back in Tennessee in 1986. Plenty’s intentions have always been to increase local self-sufficiency and improve the quality of life among people, focusing on indigenous communities, children, and vigorous protection of the environment.

Kids To The Country is held on 1750 acres of woodlands, meadows, creeks, and hills belonging to The Farm Community in Lewis County, 75 miles south of Nashville near Summertown. Founded in 1971, The Farm is a nonsectarian intentional community that is currently home to about 200 people. It has its own accredited alternative school, an international Ecovillage Training Center with emphasis on sustainable living, and multiple thriving businesses, as well as Plenty International’s headquarters. Since one of the primary values in KTC’s philosophy is respect for the environment, an important part of the program is learning about the incredible diversity of plant and animal life that abounds in this beautiful location.

KTC Mission
Create a multicultural exchange in a rural setting for at-risk children.
Build a positive sense of community through nonviolent conflict resolution skills.
Promote the growth of healthful relationships with one another.

KTC structures activities to form lasting feelings of accomplishment and self-worth in each child. The nature school curriculum helps every youngster develop a connection with the land and the rhythms of nature through direct experience, providing them with an enriched worldview.

KTC Counselors
There are so many young people who want to be part of the Kids To The Country program. We are always in preparation for our seasonal programs, with the longest  in the summer. Many former KTC kids are returning to train as counselors. Along with trained counselors, the KTC staff is made up of teachers, artists, mediators, storytellers, water-safety experts, horseback riding instructors, solar engineers, and licensed health-care professionals.

Here is some of what kids get to do when you help out with a tax-deductible donation to Kids To The Country.

Study biodiversity
Swim
Canoe   
Ride horses
Learn conflict management   
Make crafts
Hike in the woods
Walk in creeks
Cook
Recycle
Garden   
Stargaze through a telescope   
Perform/talent show
Make music
Tell stories
Bond with new friends

Other Ways You Can Help:

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign to all of your friends.
  • Please check out and use the Indiegogo share tools!
And that's all there is to it.  Let's raise $$ for the KIDS!

story: We are Communities In Schools of New Mexico (CIS). HELP US raise $5,000 in order to provide much needed school supplies to Santa Fe students in need. With your help, we will deliver a backpack of essential supplies (notebooks, pencils, crayons, pens, rulers and more) to every Pre-K - 6th grade student attending the schools we serve on the first day of the new school year.
story_txt: We are Communities In Schools of New Mexico (CIS). HELP US raise $5,000 in order to provide much needed school supplies to Santa Fe students in need. With your help, we will deliver a backpack of essential supplies (notebooks, pencils, crayons, pens, rulers and more) to every Pre-K - 6th grade student attending the schools we serve on the first day of the new school year.

story:
(Version française plus bas)
Hi, I am Vanessa, I'm a working mom and I just got an offer to study medicine starting in September. Three years ago, I decided to stop procrastinating and radically change the course of my life. I decided to follow my deepest desire to become a doctor and help people.

We usually don't receive grants for the first year of medical school ; but on top of that, as a French citizen, I am not entirely sure I will be granted a student loan either, even though I have been living in the UK for at least 5 years. That is why, I am doing a crowdfunding campaign to help me fund my first year. The crowdfunds will top up my savings to pay for:
  • £9,000 of tuitions fees per year
  • £6,000 of accomodation
Feel free to read more about this life adventure on my blog "The Graduate Journey to Medicine". It's been an eventful journey so far, but one that is definitely worth it.

Before I leave you to donate ;-) I would like to share with you my big big big dream for the next 10 years:
as a qualified Bi-Aura (chakra healing) therapist and a soon-to-be kinesiologist
I am aiming at bridging the gap between conventional medicine and complementary medicine to offer to my future patients a space where I will be able to provide both.

Thank you for your support!

(Version française)
Bonjour, je m'appelle Vanessa, je suis maman, jusque là je travaillais, mais je viens d'être admise en faculté de médecine à partir de Septembre. Il y a trois ans, j'ai décidé de cesser de tergiverser et de changer radicalement le cours de ma vie. J'ai décidé de suivre mon plus profond désir de devenir médecin et d'aider les gens.
En Grande Bretagne, le concours d'entrée en médecine se passe avant de rentrer en faculté (et non à la fin de la 1ère année comme en France). Par contre les études coûtent £9 000 l'année (soit environ 12 000€) et en général, nous ne recevons pas de subventions pour la première année de faculté de médecine. En plus de cela, en tant que citoyenne française, je ne suis pas sûre d'obtenir un prêt étudiant, même si j'ai vécu au Royaume-Uni depuis plus de 5 ans. C'est pourquoi, j'organise une campagne de financement participatif (crowdfunding) pour m'aider à financer ma première année. En plus de mes économies, le financement participatif servira à payer:
  • £ 9 000 de frais de scolarité
  • £ 6 000 de logement (soit environ 8 300€)
Si vous voulez en savoir plus sur cette aventure, suivez mon blog "The Graduate Journey to Medicine" (c'est en Anglais). Ca a été un sacré voyage, mais qui en vaut vraiment la peine.
Avant que je vous laisse faire une donation ;-) je voudrais partager avec vous mon grand grand grand rêve pour les 10 prochaines années:
Je suis devenue thérapeute bioenergétique (Bi-Aura) et je suis en passe de devenir kinésiologue d'ici la fin de l'été. Et donc avec médecine, je souhaite combler le fossé entre la médecine conventionnelle et la médecine alternative pour offrir à mes futurs patients un espace où je vais être en mesure de proposer les deux médecines à la fois.

Merci de votre soutien!

Ici se trouve la traduction de la liste des cadeaux:
  • ADN - £25 - votre nom apparaitra sur mon blog en tant que sponsor pour vous remercier
  • Cellule - £75 - ci dessus + je vous envoie une petite histoire inventée et illustrée par moi
  • Organe - £250 - ci dessus + accès à une série de vidéos des meilleurs conseils santé/nutrition qui m'ont été enseigné en cours de kinesiologie
  • Corps - £1 000 - ci dessus + 4 séances à distance de bioénergie
  • Corps & Esprit - £2 500 - ci dessus + je vous construis un site wordpress ou un site de e-commerce

story:
The people of Nepal need your support today

Hi i'm Ben and I am working with the Colchester ex-Ghurka society to ship a huge amount of clothing, outdoor equipment and blankets to Nepal after the crisis this year. Just to add more issues to the disaster, the monsoon season has just begun, so it is crucial and very urgent to distribute aid to the most remote parts of Nepal before. This year's monsoon season is going to cause untold health issues and complications for the worst affected areas of Nepal and the worst hit areas happen to be the most remote, with the least aid! 

''Populations continue to live in temporary shelters with sub-optimal hygiene, sanitation and water conditions'' The World Health Organisation (WHO)

The Colchester ex-Ghurka society and myself we have collected a freight containers (20ft) worth of warm clothing (for babies, children and adults) and outdoor equipment including tents and blankets. We now need your support to ship these goods to Nepal, Kamandu airport from here in the UK. Jet airways have very kindly offered us a huge discount on shipping the goods by plane, which means the equipment will be on the ground within 24 hours and distributed within days.  .  

Your support is directly going to make the difference to someones life and will allow them to live a semi-normal style, while governments and NGO's can rebuild this devastated country. 

What We Need & updates for you

We need to raise £5000 ($8000) in total to ship the equipment to Nepal, We will keep you in the loop every step of the way. We will email all supporters with updates on shipping the goods and the safe arrival in the storage unit in Nepal. We will then send you pictures of the equipment being distributed in the worst hit areas of Nepal.   
''Months after Nepal’s deadliest quake on record, people in this mountainous region about 100 miles northeast of Kathmandu say it is no longer the jolting aftershocks but the steady monsoon rains that present the biggest challenge'' Yahoo News

This is your chance to help

This is your chance to help a nation that are truly in need of our support for the coming years to come. The Nepalese people are some the kindest and honest people, so as soon as I saw the earthquake and devastation, I knew I had to do something and now I am hoping you can find the compassion to help make this project complete. Both Kumar and Samesti have been working tirelessly to collect this huge amount of aid equipement and to bring this project to a close. If you can imagine what it could be like to have nothing and then to be given simple things like clothes and blankets and how they would help, then please support this campaign today and donate something small or large, everything will help.

Extra funds

Any extra funds raised from this campaign will be used to buy simple sanitation equipment such as dysenteries, water purification tablets and basic medicinal equipment.  

Thank you!

Thank you so much for your support in helping our efforts and namaste. 


Links to the monsoon aftermath crisis

http://www.who.int/features/2015/nepal-healthcare-gaps/en/

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-33249184

http://www.cnbc.com/2015/04/28/next-big-risks-for-nepal.html

http://www.shanghaidaily.com/article/article_xinhua.aspx?id=291559

http://news.yahoo.com/nepal-quake-monsoon-hits-foreign-donors-pledge-4-171222586.html

story:
Short Summary

I've received multiple emails asking when RandPaulForums.org will launch, and I've explain that currently I need help making this a reality.

We need a place for just Rand Paul stuff not mixed with other public figures.

Learn more about me here: Facebook.com/LuisAngelesLA apgn.us/aboutus/staff

Please, consider helping us make this a reality. We will use this forum to unite all Rand Paul supporters and help R.P win in 2016.

A place where all RAND PAUL supporters can call home!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Help us by funding this idea
  • Check out the perks!
  • All level's will come with an end of the month expense sheet, so that you can see how your money is being spent!
  • Buy a forum subscription cost: $500
  • Hosting and CloudFlare: $240 (per year)
  • The rest is miscellaneous: plugins, design

The Impact

  • Rand Paul supporters need a dedicated place to unite and plan. 
  • We need grassroots planning

Risks & Challenges

  • I will cover the rest, but please help me as much as you can!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about Rand Paul Forums!
  • Make sure you share us on Facebook, Twitter and anywhere else! Follow u on Twitter.com/RandPaulForum Facebook.com/RandPaulForum

story:
Summary 

Almost four months ago, the country of Nepal was devastated by multiple major earthquakes, taking the lives of nearly 9,000 Nepalis and displacing hundreds of thousands more.The six Marines and two Nepali soldiers aboard "Vengeance 01" gave their lives on 12 May 2015 during a UH-1Y helicopter crash while providing assistance to those hit hardest as part of Operation Sahayogi Haat, or "Helping Hand."

It is in their spirit of giving and steadfast commitment that we are proud to help rebuild the Bal Uddhar Secondary School in Nepal. And part of the school is going to be dedicated to our fallen Marines and the Nepali soldiers! 

Thank you for your contribution and support. 

Please help us spread the word. 

Loss of US Marines and Nepal Army soldiers

Six US Marines and two Nepali soldiers Died in a helicopter crash during a “Mission Of Mercy” humanitarian mission in Nepal. Our school will commemorate their selfless dedication and contribution to those suffering from the earthquake. We will dedicate the school building to these heroes.  Read More here

Media

"Man rebuilds school in Nepal to honor fallen Marines" Marines Corps Times

"Creighton alum, senior aim to honor Marines by rebuilding school in Nepal" Creighton News

"Omahans Pitch In To Build Schools In Nepal"  WOWT NBC Omaha

Story of Nepal

Nepal is a developing country located in South Asia, located between India and China. It is one of the poorest countries in the world, with the majority of the population living below the poverty line. According to UNICEF, "around 1.2 million Nepali children between the ages of five and 16 have either never attended school or have dropped out. UNICEF's experience shows that children who are out of school for extended periods, including during emergencies, become less and less likely to ever return to the classroom."

On April 25, 2015, a massive earthquake of 7.8 magnitude on the Richter scale struck Nepal, followed by a second major tremor, on May 12. The death toll from the two quakes now stands at nearly 9,000, and more than half a million homes, most of them in hard to reach rural areas, are uninhabitable. The full scale of destruction is still being assessed, as search and rescue teams reach remote areas affected by these earthquakes.

Since the first two major quakes, there have been more than a dozen quakes of magnitude 5 or higher, and another two dozen between magnitude 4.5 and 5. U.S. Geological Survey predicts that serious aftershocks could persist for at least a year. Many on the ground in Nepal continue to report aftershocks, and many are still - living in tents and makeshift shelters. 

Education

The current education system of Nepal is one of the youngest in the world. Most of the children in rural areas are not exposed to proper education. The public school infrastructure and curriculum in rural Nepal is in very poor condition.  This has been greatly affected, and magnified, by the recent earthquakes and unstable situation.

The Project in Detail

According to a UNICEF report, at least 950,000 children in Nepal will not be able to return to school. “Almost one million children who were enrolled in school before the earthquake could now find they have no school building to return to,” said Tomoo Hozumi, UNICEF’s Representative in Nepal.  

Kavreplanchock (Kavre) District is one of the hard-hit areas by the earthquake. Panauti-3 is a village in Kavre, and Bal Uddhar Secondary School is the only public school in the village. It has been severely damaged and deemed unsafe, unusable by the government of Nepal.

Before the earthquake there were 300-400 students attending Bal Uddhar Secondary School. After the earthquake, the classes are being held either in donated tents, patios of neighbors, or rooms rented from the neighbors.



Education For Purpose's goal is to rebuild Bal Uddhar Secondary School – a rural public school, which in turn will provide proper education and needed support to local youth.

School Reconstruction

Education For Purpose has received an official approval from the District Education Department granting us permission to reconstruct the school according to approved earthquake-resistant standards. Education For Purpose will have a team of volunteers and representation at the project site. Education For Purpose will leverage additional volunteers, and local residents as necessary. 

The Story of the Students and their Families

All of the students are eager to learn. They are all from poor backgrounds, and mostly from the lower, formerly untouchable caste. Most of their families work on subsistence farms, and others work for landowners for little or no money (for a small share of the crop yield).  Work is not guaranteed on a regular basis, and they earn about $2.50 for a 12-hour day -- barely enough to survive.  

Even though the parents earn very little, their primary goal is their children's education, which is only way to better future - out of extreme poverty. They are willing to make sacrifices, hoping that their children will not have the same future as theirs. They are willing to eat less and buy less, so that they can invest in their children's’ education -- and spend the little money that they earn on books, uniforms and other materials required for school.

Some of the children have to walk almost an hour to get to school everyday. After school is finished, they go home and help their parents in the fields, which makes that time they spent at school even more critical. The majority of their parents are not educated beyond the third grade. Yet the parents know and clearly understand that education is the only way to a better future. It offers the only hope for a way out of extreme poverty.

The earthquake happened on a Saturday. Most of the students were at home with their parents. When we asked them of their initial reaction, they said that they were very scared. They did not know what to do. They ran outside as quickly as possible. Then they camped outside for 2 to 3 weeks in fear of aftershocks. Most of the houses in that area are damaged, some beyond repair.

We asked some of the students what they want to be when they grow up. We were surprised, because no one said they want to be a farmer or help their parents in their local shop. They were extremely optimistic and had bigger life aspirations.   Some said they wanted to be doctors so they can come back to the village and serve others, while others said they wanted to be teachers, so they can teach and help improve the future of their community.  We were glad to see that even in such a dire situation, all the students were willing to leave the past behind and focus on the future. These students inspired us.

This Is Where We Need You 

You have the chance to make a difference. You can give the children the most important gift of their lives, the gift of education. With your help, we have a chance to give these lost children hope, more importantly the hope of education. We will honor the Marines and soldiers by rebuilding the school. We want to make sure  our Marines legacy will live on, forever. 

Your Questions, Answered.

What payment methods do you accept?

We accept all major credit card.

Other ways to donate!

Donate by Check or Money Order

If you choose to mail your donation,
Make your check,money order or cashier's check payable to
EDUCATION FOR PURPOSE.  
Memo: Rebuild School Fund
Include your name, address, daytime phone number, and email address
Mail your payment to
 EDUCATION FOR PURPOSE
 PO Box 24144, Omaha, NE 68124


Check or Money Order is the most preferred way to donate to avoid processing fees. We want to make sure your donations have the highest impact in Nepal.


How much money from the crowd-funding actually goes to the project?

With the exception of the Indiegogo and processing fees, every dollar goes towards the project.

Can I donate from outside the USA?

YES!

Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?

YES! Education For Purpose will provide a charitable donation receipt for tax purposes.

How do I get in touch with you?

Please  email us info@educationforpurpose.org

Besides donating how else can i help?

Go to our social media pages and help us spread the word. Like and share our Facebook page, Tweet us using #Education4Purpose to spread the word.


Education For Purpose is a 501c3, non-profit organization based out of Omaha,NE, USA. We will work closely with the Education Department, Ministry Of Education and relevant governing bodies in Nepal.

hit hardest as part of Operation Sahayogi Haat, or "Helping Hand."

soldiers! 
Thank you for

story:
Children-UA is an NGO based in Basel, Switzerland. We run educational camps for Ukrainian orphans aged 11-15. In these camps, we teach children the importance of education and how to build healthy social relationships.

We believe that teaching the kids basic life skills, like self-awareness or managing personal finances will help them better succeed in life after they graduate from school. None of these are part of their regular school curriculum, and they don't have a family to learn it from. 

People behind Children-UA: 

We are a group of Ukrainian expats, who live all around Europe, and those interested in helping Ukrainian orphans. We run this organization as volunteers. Meet our team and read more about our history.

Camp 2015

This year’s camp is going to be special for both children and us. Most organizers and, naturally, most orphans come from the Ukrainian region of Donetsk, currently a war zone. Taking the kids out - even if just for a few days - seems more important than ever. We are bringing 20 kids from orphanages in the Donetsk region to the camp 2015, this time in Switzerland (6-15 August). Pictures from previous camp are here.

The impact

We know we cannot change the world, but if we can just help one child, it will have been worth all our efforts. Please join us in funding this event!

What we need and what you get

The budget of the event is 14700 Euro:

    • transportation+visa costs: 2700 Euro

    • accommodation: 4000 Euro

    • meals: 7000 Euro

    • other expenses (travel insurance, first aid kit, welcome package, fun activities etc): 1000 Euro

Currently we are 3000 Euro short, which is the goal of this fundraising campaign.

What you get: if you are fundraising too, to express our gratitude for your collaboration, we’ll be happy to share the link to your campaign on our personal FB pages (4000+ followers) and our personal twitter accounts (2500+ followers combined).

Other ways you can help

Please share info about our campaign among your friends and followers!

For more information, check our site: www.children-ua.org and our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/ChildrenUa

story:
Notre objectif - Offrir gratuitement 100,000 livres aux populations qui n’en ont pas les moyens afin de :

  • Faciliter la pratique de la langue française dans le monde

  • Lutter contre l’illettrisme

  • Développer la culture française à l’étranger

Qui en bénéficie?

  • Des pays attachés à la langue française : Europe Centrale et Orientale, Extrême Orient, Maghreb, Afrique Noire, Amérique du Sud et Asie.

  • Des lecteurs particuliers, mais aussi des écoles, collèges, lycées, universités, hôpitaux, bibliothèques, centres de formation.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Nous avons besoin de 20,000 euros afin de financer les frais de conditionnement et de transport de 100,000 livres qui ont été collectés par Le Bouquin Volant.

1 euro donné = 5 livres envoyés = 25 lecteurs heureux

Chaque euro collecté sera utilisé dans le cadre de ce projet. 

L'association en quelques mots

Le Bouquin Volant a été créé en février 2003 par M. Albert-Louis Mathieu, bien trop dynamique pour vivre une retraite tranquille. Il décide de donner une deuxième vie aux livres : en récupérant ceux dont les personnes souhaitent se séparer, pour les offrir à l’étranger afin de lutter contre l’illettrisme et faciliter la pratique de la langue française.

L'association est animée par une équipe de 80 bénévoles en charge de collecter, trier et conditionner les livres offerts par des donateurs.


Une autre façon d'aider - Devenez bénévole

Vous avez un peu de temps libre et vous souhaitez vous engager dans une association à but non lucratif ? Vous avez le sens de la solidarité et de l’accueil mais aussi des qualités d’organisation ? Vous aimez le travail d’équipe ?

Venez rejoindre l’équipe du Bouquin Volant en devenant membre actif. Qu’elle soit ponctuelle ou régulière, votre aide nous sera très précieuse. Vous participerez à un projet exaltant. Vous serez accueilli au sein d’une équipe sympathique, au sein de laquelle il est facile d’échanger et agréable de travailler.

story:
Il nostro sogno: realizzare i loro sogni

Siamo Gloria e Luca, due ragazzi italiani ma con il cuore africano.

Abbiamo avuto la fortuna di conoscere qualche anno fa i 150 bimbi dell'orfanotrofio di Abomey, nel cuore dell'Africa più povera, e ora vogliamo aiutarli nella realizzazione dei loro desideri.

Come?

Il nuovo sogno da realizzare e quello di portare tutti i bimbi sull'Oceano, sulle spiagge di Gand Popo (a sud del Benin): molti di loro infatti non hanno mai avuto la possibilità di apprezzare lo spettacolo delle onde sulle immense spiagge africane.

Per farlo ci servono circa 1000 euro, con cui potremo affittare i furgoncini e preparare un pranzo al sacco per tutti. 

Spargiamo la voce!

La gita è fissata per il 12 Agosto: abbiamo quindi poco più di 2 settimane per organizzarci e..... rendere il sogno realtà!

Mandate quindi il link a tutti i vostri amici, più siamo, meglio è!

story:
Take the $15 Facebook Challenge.

NIA House Montessori School was able to officially open in the fall of 2014 solely on the hard work and support of our team and OUR COMMUNITY! The goal of NIA House Montessori is to offer affordable and exceptional education to the greater Nashville community. Each year, NIA House will add a grade with a desire to become a Primary and Elementary School. 

In 2015-2016, NIA House will add another level - a classroom for 1st-4th grades - on another level - downstairs in our building. Don't let the chandelier fool you, we NEED YOUR HELP to renovate for our lower elementary classrooms. NIA House is challenging all 800 of our Facebook friends to donate $15. It's hard to believe with so little, you can help change the face of education in Nashville. NIA House stands on the shoulders of our community, and WE NEED YOU! 

If you are not our friend on Facebook, simply:

 Like us

 Donate $15

 STAY CONNECTED

We are excited to see who is up for this challenge. #niahouse15.

Risks and challenges

Here's what a few of our parents have to say: 

Absolutely in love with this school! My 4 year old thoroughly enjoys everything about it! I appreciate the staff and their experience, the diversity, the location... etc! Can't wait to enroll my infant! 

- DeLisa Guerrier, Primary Parent 

The school is amazing, my two year old daughter loves everyone at the school. She has learned so much over the school year! Thanks so much! 

-Cody Furlow, Pre Primary Parent 

Wonderful house of learning, growing and exploring! So grateful my son is there. 

-Tremeta Norman, Primary Parent 

My son loves his NIA house family and learning experiences. He has learned so much. He comes home and applies the new work that he did at school that day. Thank you NIA staff for pouring your love and caring spirits into my son. 

-Kat Jones, Pre Primary Parent

story:
And finally I achieved one of my biggest goals.Now I'm on the way to accomplish my dream goal.On July 12 I received call that change my life towards better.Call was from CNiS International school in Singapore which I applied a few months ago.
And there is left little step to become one of 15 successful students from 200 applicants who can study in that school.Only by your hand I can do that little step.I got 75% scholarship and need to pay rest 25% which compose 13000$.
It cover my insurance,application fee,fee of campus and food.It depends on you my flight will be on 12 of August which is my birthday.It will be the best present of my birthday. 


Any help is important. Thank you !
story_txt:
And finally I achieved one of my biggest goals.Now I'm on the way to accomplish my dream goal.On July 12 I received call that change my life towards better.Call was from CNiS International school in Singapore which I applied a few months ago.And there is left little step to become one of 15 successful students from 200 applicants who can study in that school.Only by your hand I can do that little step.I got 75% scholarship and need to pay rest 25% which compose 13000$.It cover my insurance,application fee,fee of campus and food.It depends on you my flight will be on 12 of August which is my birthday.It will be the best present of my birthday.  



Any help is important. Thank you !

story:
Creating an Economic Engine for Paterson Through the Arts

With the federal designation of the Great Falls National Historical Park, Paterson, New Jersey is poised to realize the dream of rejuvenating the historic district. Already there are signs of life along Market Street at the entrance to the National Park, and now we are seeking to raise seed money for a planning and feasibility study to decide the best steps to take in remaking the area.

It’s A Proven Plan

The timing is right to use arts and culture as an economic engine for the City, especially with the planned development of the National Park. Wherever you look, you can see evidence of the importance of arts and culture in cities both around the country. Here in New Jersey, just look at Newark, Morristown, New Brunswick, Asbury Park and Rahway to find examples of arts and culture being used to revive a city.

Why Arts & Culture for a City?

Arts and cultural institutions are major factors in driving an economy, but they also play an important role in the general quality of life for people and businesses in the region. Where cultural institutions flourish, business follows because the arts serve as major magnets for visitors. People will come to see the Great Falls National Historical Park and will stay for the other destinations, whether it is the New Jersey Inventors Hall of Fame, the Negro Leagues Baseball Museum or the New Jersey Hall of Fame. Eventually, visitors will be able to eat and shop in the region and that means the economy improves.

There is no doubt that the arts are a significant force in economic development and neighborhood stabilization. The best example, of course, is Lincoln Center which completely revived New York City’s Upper West Side following its construction in the 1960’s. Closer to home, the construction of NJPAC and the rejuvenation of the Newark Museum have had an impact that has given New Jersey’s largest city something on which to build.

New Attractions Mean Business

Bringing museums such as the New Jersey Inventors  Hall of Fame, the New Jersey Hall of Fame and the Negro Leagues Baseball Museum to Paterson will be an important step in the City’s revival. The Great Falls National Historical Park has just opened a Welcome Center and is planning other improvements. Placing a small theater in one of the museums would add the dimension of the performing arts to the region and, combined with what is already in place, would help create a vital arts district within Paterson’s historic neighborhood.

Show Your Support for Paterson

This campaign will provide the seed money to take these dreams to the next step which is to do a more detailed plan and projected budget for creating several tourist destinations and then to do a preliminary study on where the funds to develop the area would come from. The time for this work is now. Select a perk and join the campaign today!

Donate by Mail

Some people prefer to mail in their donations and we have made arrangements for you to do so. Please make your check payable to N.J.C.D.C. and mail it to: Crowdfunding Campaign, Paterson City Hall, Attention: Councilman Andre Sayegh, 155 Market Street, Paterson, NJ 07505-1414.

story:
Something More Than Art

Carsonic Productions created The Darfur Compromised with three goals in mind —(1), to create a piece of art that was both informative and engaging, (2) to raise awareness of the tragedy that has been and is still happening in Sudan, and (3) to transform that awareness into tangible change for the people of Darfur, Sudan, and South Sudan.

To that end, Carsonic Productions has partnered with Operation Broken Silence, the premiere nonprofit providing aid to Sudan. Beginning in December of 2014, Operation Broken Silence created the Endure Campaign to support overwhelmed schools and get teachers and impressionable, young students back in the classroom. Carsonic Productions is asking for your support to fund and supply a full classroom in a South Sudanese refugee camp for an entire year.


In addition to contributing funds from this campaign and the four staged readings of The Darfur Compromised over the past 9 months, Carsonic Productions will be performing the play in Ethiopia, South Sudan, and London to continue to raise awareness and show the international community that Americans have not forgotten about the region.

But We Need Your Help.


A History

In February of 2015, Rudy Gerson and Trevor Stankiewicz were asked by Professor and UN specialist John Hubbel Weiss to write an original play focused on the genocide in Darfur. Working closely with Weiss and Darfuri Scholar Ahmed Adam, the pair created The Darfur Compromised, an informative, engaging, and bold new text. In April of 2015, the play premiered in Ithaca, NY in front of students, faculty, and local citizens. 

Following this debut performance, Gerson and Stankiewicz were called into the office of Professor Bruce Levitt, who encouraged them to take the play to NYC and to form a professional production company to serve the play. From this meeting, Carsonic Productions was born. After receiving important dramaturgical notes, the play was retooled, strengthened, then performed September 2015 in Ithaca, NY.

In November of 2015, the play had its NYC debut to a full house at the historic Cherry Lane Theater. In 9 short months, the play grew from a school project to a professional work of art that raised thousands of dollars for Operation Broken Silence. 

And that simply would not have been possible without the mentorship of our teachers, the support of our family, and the community of friends who energized us along the way.


We are asking for $15,000.

$6,000 for Operation Broken Silence to fund a classroom for a full year.

$9,000 for Carsonic Productions to produce the play abroad. 


  • For $6,000 Operation Broken Silence can provide a refugee camp with a fully working classroom. They will have the facilities, supplies, and most importantly the paid teachers that make education possible.
  • For $9,000 Carsonic Productions can travel to Ethiopia, South Sudan, and London to cast, rehearse, and stage the play. Included is airfare, housing, food, theater space, actors, and an artist fee for a full translation of the text into Amharic (the official language of Ethiopia). 

We are excited to offer a range of perks to show our gratitude to those who have supported and continue to support this project and all that comes with it. Operation Broken Silence has generously provided copies of their latest film, bracelets, and t-shirts to those who donate, and Carsonic Productions has received an official endorsement from former child soldier turned rapper Emmanuel Jal.  His latest album, as well as signed copies of his book, are available to those who donate.


Risks & Challenges


This project is an ambitious one, and any project worth doing comes with its own unique obstacles. Here are some of the things Carsonic Productions will look to overcome in order to make this vision a reality:

  • $9,000 is a very low figure for the production of three readings of the play as well as the transportation and support of two artists. 
  • Our development as creatives and as citizens is key to this project. We will return to the U.S. to continue pursuing activist art and want to continue earning the respect and building the toolkit that will make us successful and socially-engaged artists. 
  • This number was brought down in order to provide the largest amount to Operation Broken Silence that is possible.
  • Addis Ababa, Ethiopia is a politically charged city where officials from Khartoum frequently travel and conduct business. 
  • By translating the play into Amharic, we are making the play accessible to an audience of policy makers working on the ground in Sudan who have the means to act boldly. 

These obstacles are very real and intimidating. But Carsonic Productions is confident that with the support from you, a thoughtful and giving community, we can overcome them all. Help us make a statement to the children in refugee camps, a statement that says, "You are not forgotten."

Other Ways You Can Help


If you can't contribute financially, please consider helping us in one of these other ways:

    • Help us spread the word by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and by email!

    • Like us on Facebook to get the latest updates on our campaign progress.

    • Coproduce a staged reading of The Darfur Compromised in your city on our return to the states.

story:
Short Summary

Hello,

My name is Dragana. I am the master of communication, public speaking.

I want to set up a school of public appearances and this book would be an essential tool for the work of my students. In my country there is not enough literature on this topic. The book is the result of my research in the field of public communication and includes explanations of the communication process, technology, mass media, the personality of the communicator, overcoming stage fright, audience, verbal and non-verbal communication as well as communication skills in a variety of mass media.

The book is completed and money is required for the disclosure, prepress, design and printing. Publisher's NGO Association of Creators of Nis, of which I am vice-president.

The publication of this book will mean a lot to me in my future work and many people who want to improve these skills.

What We Need & What You Get

For the publication of a book that has 190 pages and is printed in 300 copies it is necessary to do the following:

Payment for cataloging and ISBN number of the agency for publishing - 40 euros

Prepress - which costs about 200 euros,

Cover design - 200 EUR

Print - 460 euros

Review-200 euros

The Impact

Today, the public speech used in all new systems of communication as a tool for achieving better success, greater credibility and higher profits.

Our success largely depends on how well we present it in the first contact with other people.

Are we going to successfully present employer, pupils, students, voters, customers and the general public depends solely on our personality, abilities, verbal and nonverbal communication, knowledge of audience we are addressing and media technology which transmits the message.

A small number of people have a talent for personal presentation, however, communication skills can be mastered learning and good training.

This book was created as a result of my long (17 years) work in public relations and my scientific research public communications. I wish to convey my knowledge and secrets of this craft as wide population to all those in need: youth leaders, employees, associations, unions, public officials and all those who wants to improve their skills.

Risks & Challenges

At this point the only disadvantage would be that not enough money to publish books.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help financially, you can help by making and to expand this campaign to as many friends or do something for the book (technical preparation or design)
  • And please  use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hi everyone,

My name is Bella. I have always been different. I have lawys lived in an utopia, thinking I could change the world. I have come to London from a small coastal city in Bulgaria, where I was studying in a typical state school. I was raised with the fact that British education is the best in the world, and I really wanted to go to King's College London. Fifteen people just from my class applied, maybe thousands from around the world for my place there, but I got accepted. Nevetheless, the fees tripled, life turned out to be very expensive. 

I am about the graduate in July, and just by chance I started researching graduate schools, because entering in a good company although graduating good university and being from a not a really likeable nationality makes the process rather impossible. I decided that my chances are to find a very good graduate school rather than very good job that would start paying off my expenseses and fees. 

I fell in love with a IE Businesss School in Madrid, probably my most favourite city in the world, with three months abroad (probably Russia). Studying is not just about reading books, studying is about experiencing cultures, learingin how business is done, getting the practical knowledge and understanding the thinking of the locals. All of these so important features, I would achieve there, I would transform my charisma and intellect in one of the feature leaders of the world. I have already been studying that languages, I would be fluent after graduation with range of possiblities waiting for me to grasp them.

Why do I need your help? Middle-class is now stuck in a widening gap, I got through a hard admission test, interview and application and I got accepted in less than two-weeks time. A rather surprisingly quick outcome for one of the top 5 Business European Schools. Nonetheless, I talked to my parents and decided that the only way is that I am granted 50% scholarship, that I applied for based on merits- because I though after all the handwork, awards and scholarships, I deserve it.

Nevertheless, my academic and professional merits were not enough, I was told that the funds were very few. I am currently in a dilemma- whether or not or how to pay 32,000 Euro. I have been working part-time along my studies, which will help me save some amount by the end of the year, and then my parents and grandparents will help. I will be applying for other grans and European scholarships but it looks like the recent years they have cut back on funding drastically. The funding I might get from here would go for the first instalment, as well as cover a third of the cost. 

I have started this educational path that is very challenging these days, with pople having the right skills and competencies but not the finances. I have been working every summer, always finished the year with 1st Grade and taken part in various projects to improve our society. Nonetheless, as coming from country with very few resources, and although a European citizen, I was unable to find an institution to support me in this rather normal activity- getting educated and exploring the world.

I would be enormously and sincerely grateful if you could help me. I have also prepared some perks that would come from the bottom of my heart in return to your gesture of kindness.

story:
Short Summary

The number of students pursuing STEM education in tertiary institution in Tanzania has been dropping from 34% in 2004 to 14% in 2012. Due to this, Inspire STEM has decided to organize a STEM Boot Camp for Secondary School Students in Tanzania. 

This boot camp is aimed at increasing participation of students in the STEM field giving them an opportunity to learn about various career paths and develop interest in the field, triggering their creativity and research skills thus developing a well-rounded education essential to country’s development. 

This boot camp is important particularly to students who do not have access to knowledge about opportunities in STEM fields. 

What We Need

  • This funds will cater for costs for secondary students from local communities across Tanzania who can not afford to cater for the camp expenses. 
  • The amount of funds received will determine how many secondary students will be selected to attend the camp. The more the funds, the more the students, the more the impact to the Tanzanian youth. 
  • The total cost per head is 150$. The camp will take place for 5 days, and the funds will cater for accommodation, meals, transportation, STEM tool kits and excursion activities. 

The Impact

These funds will cater for 100 students across Tanzanian mainland particularly in rural areas who can not afford to attend the camp. 

  • We believe this will trigger students’ passion by actively engaging them into research, problem solving and creativity in the science and mathematics fields; 
  • Empower female students to actively participate and engage in STEM subjects, thus improving their overall performance in STEM fields; 
  • Offer career guidance and inspiration to students interested in pursuing higher education in the STEM fields; 
  • And serve as a bridge between the students, faculties and employers in the STEM fields. 

Activities

The Boot Camp will have vast number of activities for students to explore and be part of the initiative. Such activities include, but not limited to: 

  • Introduction to computer science and programming
  • Mobile App Development
  • Building robots and drones
  • Building renewal energy systems
  • Biomedical engineering at a glance
  • Science cafes and science slams
  • Excursion activities and team competitions
  • Career fair and 1:1 mentoring

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share the information with people who will be interested to share the spirit of STEM education to young Tanzanian youth
  • We accept STEM kits donations such as Raspberry Pi Kits, drone kits, etc

story:
(Please find the English version below)


Einer der Abgeordneten steht auf und bittet um eine Abstimmung. Die Abgeordneten der verschiedenen Länder heben auf Ansage der Konferenzleitung ihre Stimmzettel und geben so ihre Meinung kund. Erst auf den zweiten Blick wird ersichtlich, dass alle anwesenden Personen zu jung für UN-Delegierte sind.

So stellen wir uns die Teilnahme an einer MUN vor. MUN bedeutet Model United Nations und ist ein weltweites UN-Planspiel für Schüler und Studenten. Die Teilnehmer versetzen sich dabei in die Position von Abgeordneten und diskutieren auf Englisch in verschiedenen UN-Ausschüssen über aktuelle Themen.

Wir sind 14 junge Frauen, die nach dem Abitur an dem technischen Orientierungs- und Vorbereitungsjahr „Pro Technicale“ teilnehmen (www.protechnicale.de). Unser Interessenschwerpunkt liegt im technischen Bereich. Gleichzeitig sind uns politisches Engagement und politische Bildung wichtig, um in Zukunft die Welt der Technik aus unterschiedlichen Blickwinkeln gestalten zu können.

Das Projekt MUN wird durch uns Teilnehmerinnen eigenständig finanziert. Dabei kommen hohe Kosten auf uns junge Menschen zu, weshalb wir Sie bitten, uns bei dem großartigen Völkerverständigungsprojekt zu unterstützen.


Für Firmen besteht zusätzlich die Möglichkeit, dass wir für Sie werben. Bei Interesse und für nähere Informationen können Sie uns gerne kontaktieren.


_____________________________________________________________________________


A delegate rises and asks for a voting. The delegates of various countries raise their placards when they are called out by the chair to signal their vote. Only on second glance it emerges that all people present are too young to be UN-delegates.

This is how we imagine the participation of a MUN. MUN stands for Model United Nations, which is a global simulation of UN conferences and its committees. Each student participating plays the role of a delegate from a certain country and acts and debates according to its guidelines on current topics.

We are 14 young women who attend an orientation program for engineering studies after graduation called “Pro Technicale“ (www.protechnicale.de). Though our interest focuses on technical areas we recognize the importance of political engagement and education in order to be able to shape the field of engineering from different perspectives in future.

We would like to attend the MUN conference in Heidelberg. The conference will take place from January 9 to 10, 2016. The main topic is the refugee crisis. In different committees, we will debate on the subjects of Forced migration, the prevention of future migrations crises and the situation in the Middle East.

This project will be organized and financed by ourselves and involves great expenses which is why we request your support in this significant project for international understanding.


Additionally we offer the opportunity of advertisement to companies. If this caught your interest feel free to contact us for more detailed information.

story:
Hi, I am  Estella.  Ever since I was in fourth grade, I've wanted to go to Harvard Medical School and become a surgeon.   I am beginning a journey to enhance my educational opportunities by attending boarding school in the fall.  I've learned that whatever I set as a goal with focus, perseverance and determination I can achieve. Going to boarding school has been a goal of mine for a very long time.  I understand completely that there are going to be obstacles in everything we do, but it is learning how to move around, over, under or through those obstacles that makes you a stronger person.

The Beginning

         

My elementary and middle school career was spent at a small public school with intimate class sizes.  My graduating class from middle school had fourteen students. Yes, that is right, the entire 8th grade class had fourteen students. However, there are pros and cons to every situation.  Some of the pros were that we became a close-knit family and knew almost everything about each other.  We shared good and bad adventures together that we will never forget.

During our nine years together we truly became a family.  Each year we had all the same classes and teachers.  Being that close for nearly nine months out of the year, causes you to form something special.  You know each other so well; right down to a favorite outfit or what pictures one will most likely post on Instagram. It’s almost like your minds are synced. We have learned many life lessons growing up together in this small family.

Unfortunately, there are ALWAYS cons.

 I guess when we were younger we were not affected by what social media dictated as “cool,” “pretty,” or “in.”  But, with that, our family started to form cliques. Sadly, I became the odd man out. By the end of 8th grade, I was not welcomed in any group. It actually started in the fifth grade. With there being only five girls in our class, a parent purchased matching outfits for all the girls except me. The girls wore the outfits on the same day and I felt left out. As the years went on, the bullying became more intense and obvious.  They even began to cyber bully.  They would make fun of my height, skin tone, hair, and even my ambitions. This was extremely painful. I knew I would have to go to school and take it, but I kept my head and grades HIGH, and even became class president!


The final attempt at undermining

It is the tradition for the class president to give the commencement speech at the end of 8th grade. Their last attempt at undermining me was to try and rob me of that.  They felt I did not represent the student body despite my efforts all year long of organizing and executing events.  It was the first time in all my years of school that I did not want to go to school.  After a couple of days, with the strong support of my mother and her demanding I be treated fairly, I was able to gather myself and deliver a heartfelt closing speech.



My Bright Future


The challenge I seek and the battles I want to fight are to achieve academic excellence.  I want to be around highly motivated, driven students with big visions for their lives. In fourth grade, I decided that I wanted to go to Harvard Medical School and become a surgeon. With the continued encouragement from my mother, "that you can be anything you want," I made a wish list of eight top tier schools. I called and arranged for the brochures to arrive at my house.  Studying for the various entrance exams and interviews filled my limited free time.  I even figured out how to obtain the highest scores.  My applications were filled out swiftly. My mother was amazed at the footwork I had done.  She was inspired by my motivation. Keep in mind this was done while maintaining straight A’s, organizing events as class president, playing sports: soccer (being the top scorer), basketball, softball, plus my many other extracurricular activities.



Hooray!!!

On March 10th, I discovered I was accepted or wait-listed at five of my eight dream schools!  In my joy, it hadn’t settled in that MY financial aid was almost nil and that my mom’s single parent household budget was already over stretched. This news would affect my boarding school journey.  My mom, said we would figure something out for the four-year commitment.


To date, we are still figuring it out.  I decided to step up and do my part.  While filling out scholarship applications, I stumbled upon crowd funding and this seemed like something I could do on my own.  Here it is, let me know what you think. I am writing to you in hopes that you will BECOME part of my new village. I believe in me and you should too. Let’s see what WE can do.

Sincerely,

Estella

P.S. Just so you know, I showed this to my mom. She was very proud of me and thinks it's a great idea. I also told her about the gifts and she fully supports all of them.

Every donation is welcomed, even if it is one dollar. Also please share my story with your friends.


I hope you like my perks 


$1 - Button "We believe in you, Estella" unlimited


$5 - Shout on social media.

$10 - Video thank you note and button, I will recite the name of all donors at this level and put it in our update section.

$20 - A copy of Estella's report card, a video thank you note, and button.

$30 - A CD of my favorite song that will be sung by yours truly.  I was hand selected and participated in the All County Choral group for NY.  In addition, I also participated in the New York State School Music Association, NYSSMA.

$50 - A CD of my favorite song that will be sung by yours truly and an original song written by me.  I was hand selected and participated in the All County Choral group for NY.  In addition, I have also participated in the NYSSMA.

$100 - Customized t-shirt designed by Estella.  Add your name to the wall of donors, which will be created on the back of the t-shirt.  I was awarded “The Most Artistic Student for the class 2015."  You will also receive a video thank you plus a copy of report card. 

$200 - Become a part of the “We believe in Estella” celebration.  I will have a killer party during the warmer months. It will include : DJ, beverages and appetizers prepared by a Chef and Estella.  No overnight accommodations, no transportation provided. 6-10pm, date to be announced. 

$500 - Access to private weekly blog, Meet and Greet with Estella.  See Garrison through Estella’s eyes. I will take you on a hike with tremendous views. This gift includes light fare. Meet under the 65 year old Japanese maple that was my perfect climbing tree as a child.  We are located within one hour of Manhattan.  This gift is for donor plus one. Spring or summer date to be announced.


$1250 - One night at a house which has been donated for the cause that can accommodate up to 12 people. You will have access to the hot tub, sauna, full gym, pool cabana, outdoor fireplace and pool (if it is open). Excluding peak seasons and holidays.


*

story:
Learn More About The Brasil Live Project Here
portuguese embaixo

Greetings! I am immensely excited to finally share with you my ALBUM and special campaign project that changed my life.

My name is Samuel J I am a musician from Cornwall south England. During a tour to Brazil I discovered some heavy truths with the many street children that I met.  
Despite their courageous and larger than life smiles I found many of the children were being exploited in drug trafficking, arms trade and even sold for sex...

There courage was deeply moving and inspired my music. I wanted to help so I set out on a mission to create a large scale musical project with some of my musical heroes in Brazil. 

THE ALBUM

It took me four years, and now the album is ready and features some of brazils top artists, they include

Gabriel O Pensador
Olodum
Tato Falamansa
Dani Black
  and many more..........

If you want to hear the EP preview of the Album

CLICK HERE.

Our Aim

I am now launching my album and a fund raising campaign world wide. to provide support and change the lives of a whole community of children by raising $100,000 in funds we will be able to completely structure a special school, that I found in the heart of the Rocinha Favela in Rio De Janiero, but we cannot do this alone, to do this we need you…

Get Involved

The album is exclusively available for all those of you that contribute to the campaign. There are an array of amazing prizes for each level of contribution (see below).


We are now ready to release the album !! And myself and the children need your help !!

How The Funds Will Be Used

The funds raised in part or in full from this campaign will be used to provide new equipment, new facilities, an international film doc about the childen, and new classes for the school in dance, music, literature, maths and theater. This will be a massive contribution to children's self-worth and to broadening their horizons. We are going to achieve this through this campaign.


About the School

The Uniao Community School

This is an institution that has been helping educate the youth for over 30 years in dangerous areas where schools and opportunity are very difficult to come by. The school is one of the only institutions currently offering children's education at the heart of Brazil's poorest, most violent community - Rocinha, Rio. It is in a constant struggle to keep its structure and facilities running, hence why we need your help! These classes provide a safe and healthy opportunity for the children, education is literally life changing for them, giving them hope for a better future and new horizons.

We will be working with this school for the long run. This is just the beginning. The hope is that the project will allow the school to develop their own performance groups and garner deserved recognition.

How You Can Help

1. Donations As a token of our gratitude, we have comprised a unique "prize" structure for your donations. In order to be inclusive to all, we have donation packages beginning at $20 upwards Heart felt thank you for your support

2. Share with your network and become a "Brasil Live Project Supporter"

Your voice and is such a powerful tool and simply sharing this message on your networks is immensely helpful. Reposting our announcement post about the campaign will make an impactful difference in the reach of our mission. Join our "Brasil Live Project" event page here (insert link) to get updates about the campaign and its progress!

3. Become a "Brasil Live Project Promotor" 

Social media collaborations are another excellent connection for us to spread this message. Please consider sharing this campaign through your media networks on a consistent basis to keep your audiences informed about progress and how they can help.

4. Join us as our "Brasil Live Project Sponsor"

This level of support is reserved for those that have the ability to donate a large amount and/or companies who would like to feature their brand through our channels. This tier includes a Media Partnership and public recognition of your support. This tier can range in backing from $1K+ onwards. Please contact me directly (sam3tellam@hotmail.com) if you're interested in collaborating with us on a deeper level. Brand inclusion in our future projects and ongoing partnership is welcomed.

We will only publicize your brand and/or your contribution if you tell us to and only in the form that you give us.

Together we will all be able to make a huge difference,

The Impact

We will be working with the Uniao school for the long run! This is just the beginning.The hope is that this project will kick-start the school into long-term prosperity and sustainability. Through this stability, they will be able to develop their own performance groups to get deserved recognition for the children and teachers.
We will update everyone involved with this project by sending out a monthly newsletter with updates from the school.

Through buying this album - you will be supporting the education of these special children, not just here in brazil but worldwide, by drawing attention to the need for education in all of our communities where ever you may be, as only together can we make change happen
The future education of children on the planet affects all of us.
This is one world - One responsibility
Thank you for your support!








Portugese

Saudações e espero que você esteja muito bem. Eu escrevo pra dividir com você meu imenso entusiasmo sobre esse projeto maravilhoso que mudou minha vida e está prestes a ser lançado.

Eu passei grande parte dos últimos 5 anos no Brasil trabalhando para que isso se realizasse. Fui profundamente inspirado pela coragem de tantas crianças de rua que eu conheci, e por elas terem tocado meu coraçao tao profundamente,  resolvi ajudar essas crianças com a missão de criar um grande projeto musical juntamente com alguns dos meus músicos Brasileiros favoritos.

Gabriel O Pensador

Olodum

Tato Falamansa

Dani Black

  e muito mais..........

O meu sonho era que um dia esse projeto pudesse trazer conscientização e prover educação para essa juventude. 

Depois de uma longa e desafiadora jornada, essa visão se manifestou.

Estou agora a lançar o meu álbum e uma angariação de fundos mundo de campanha de largura. Nosso objetivo é prestar apoio e mudar a vida de uma comunidade inteira de crianças, aumentando os fundos para estruturar completamente uma escola especial, que eu achei no coração da Rocinha favela do Rio de Janeiro, mas não posso fazer isso sozinho para fazer esta
Eu preciso de você…

NOSSO GOL 

Nosso gol é levantarmos $100,000, fundos suficientes para providenciar e manter professores profissionalizados e cursos educacionais para essa comunidade de crianças que sem essa oportunidade não receberão educação escolar. 

Todo mundo que doar receberá uma cópia do álbum Brazil Live Project e outras coisinhas mais (veja a lista abaixo).

COMO SE ENVOLVER NO PROJETO

1. Doação

O álbum está disponível exclusivamente para todos aqueles que contribuem para a campanha. Há uma série de prémios fantásticos para cada nível de contribuição. Obrigado pelo suporte

2. Divida com seu network social e se torne um 'Adepto do Brazil Live Project'.

3. Torne-se um dos 'Promotores do Brazil Live Project'.

4. Junte-se a nós como um 'Patrocinador do Brazil Live Project'.

Esse nível de suporte é reservado para aqueles que tiverem a abilidade de doar em grande quantidade e/ou companias que quiserem demonstrar seus produtos através do nosso canal. Esse laço inclui a Parcería de Mídia e o reconhecimento público do seu suporte. Esse vínculo será criado com doações acima do valor de $1,000 dolares. Por favor entre em contato direto comigo se você estiver interessado em colaborar conosco com maiores doaçoes. Inclusão de produtos nos nossos projetos futuros e o patrocínio contínuo também são bem-vindos.

"Nós somente publicaremos o seu produto e/ou a sua contribuição com a sua permissão e somente no formato autorizado.'

Juntos, nós poderemos fazer uma grande diferença.


MAIS SOBRE ESSE PROJETO

ESCOLA DA COMUNIDADE UNIAO

Essa é uma instituiçao que vem tentando ajudar a educar a juventude das favelas por mais de 30 anos, em áreas perigosas aonde a educaçao e qualquer tipo de oportunidade custa a chegar. Essa escola é uma das únicas que atualmente se dedica a oferecer educaçao infantil em uma das áreas mais pobres e mais violentas do Brasil, conhecida como Comunidade da Rocinha. Essa instituiçao está em constante dificuldades para manter-se viva e operante, e é por isso que nós precisamos de sua ajuda! As aulas que as crianças recebem nessa escola, sao literalmente a chave para a mudança de suas vida e comportamentos, recebendo novos horizontes e a esperança de um futuro melhor. 

O Impacto

Nós trabalharemos com essa escola por tempo indeterminado. Isso é apenas o começo. O que nós queremos é que esse projeto siga progredindo permitindo que a escola desenvolva seus artistas e shows e que com isso ganhe seu merecido reconhecimento. 

Esse projeto tem a intençao de guiar as crianças por um  caminho diferente. Um caminho de luz e progresso fazendo que elas tenham ferramentas necessárias para se desviarem do caminho da escuridão. A educaçao de todas as crianças desse planeta tem um efeito direto no futuro da humanidade.

Esse é um mundo único, de uma única responsabilidade

Através de comprar o álbum - você estará apoiando a educação dessas crianças especiais, não só aqui no Brasil, mas em todo o mundo, chamando a atenção para a necessidade de educação em todas as nossas comunidades, onde quer que você pode ser, como só juntos podemos fazer a mudança acontecer
A educação futura das crianças do planeta afeta a todos nós.
Este é um mundo - Uma responsabilidade
Obrigado pelo suporte!

We will be working with this school for the long run. This is just the beginning. The hope is that the project will allow the school to develop their own performance groups and garner deserved recognition.

How You Can Help

1. Donations As a token of our gratitude, we have comprised a unique "prize" 
structure for your donations. In order to be inclusive to all, we have 
donation packages beginning at $20 upwards Heart felt thank you for your support

2. Share with your network and become a "Brasil Live Project Supporter"
Your voice and is such a powerful tool and simply sharing this 
message on your networks is immensely helpful. Reposting our 
announcement post about the campaign will make an impactful difference 
in the reach of our mission. Join our "Brasil Live Project" event page 
here (insert link) to get updates about the campaign and its progress!
3. Become a "Brasil Live Project Promotor" 
Social media collaborations are another excellent connection for 
us to spread this message. Please consider sharing this campaign through
 your media networks on a consistent basis to keep your audiences 
informed about progress and how they can help.
4. Join us as our "Brasil Live Project Sponsor"
This level of support is reserved for those that have the ability to donate a large amount and/or companies who would like to feature their brand
 through our channels. This tier includes a Media Partnership and public
 recognition of your support. This tier can range in backing from $1K+ onwards.
 Please contact me directly (sam3tellam@hotmail.com) if you're 
interested in collaborating with us on a deeper level. Brand inclusion 
in our future projects and ongoing partnership is welcomed.
We will only publicize your brand and/or your contribution if you tell us to and only in the form that you give us.
Together we will all be able to make a huge difference,



The Impact



We will be working with the Uniao school for the long run! This is just the beginning.The hope is that this project will kick-start the school into long-term prosperity and  sustainability. Through this stability, they will be able to develop their own performance groups to get deserved recognition for the children and teachers.

We will update everyone involved with this project by sending out a monthly newsletter with updates from the school.  Through
 buying this album - you will be supporting the education of these 
special children, not just here in brazil but worldwide, by drawing 
attention to the need for education in all of our communities where ever
 you may be, as only together can we make change happenThe future education of children on the planet affects all of us.This is one world - One responsibilityThank you for your support!



   









Portugese


Saudações e espero que você esteja muito bem. Eu escrevo pra dividir com você meu imenso entusiasmo sobre esse projeto maravilhoso que mudou minha vida e está prestes a ser lançado.
Eu passei grande parte dos últimos 5 anos no Brasil trabalhando para que isso se realizasse. Fui profundamente inspirado pela coragem de tantas crianças de rua que eu conheci, e por elas terem tocado meu coraçao tao profundamente,  resolvi ajudar essas crianças com a missão de criar um grande projeto musical juntamente com alguns dos meus músicos Brasileiros favoritos.
Gabriel O Pensador
Olodum
Tato Falamansa
Dani Black
  e muito mais..........
O meu sonho era que um dia esse projeto pudesse trazer conscientização e prover educação para essa juventude. 
Depois de uma longa e desafiadora jornada, essa visão se manifestou.



Estou agora a lançar o meu álbum e uma angariação de fundos mundo de campanha de largura. Nosso objetivo é prestar apoio e mudar a vida de uma comunidade inteira de crianças, aumentando os fundos para estruturar completamente uma escola especial, que eu achei no coração da Rocinha favela do Rio de Janeiro, mas não posso fazer isso sozinho para fazer esta Eu preciso de você…
NOSSO GOL 
Nosso gol é levantarmos $100,000, fundos suficientes para providenciar e manter professores profissionalizados e cursos educacionais para essa comunidade de crianças que sem essa oportunidade não receberão educação escolar. 
Todo mundo que doar receberá uma cópia do álbum Brazil Live Project e outras coisinhas mais (veja a lista abaixo).
COMO SE ENVOLVER NO PROJETO
1. Doação 
O álbum está disponível exclusivamente para todos aqueles que contribuem para a campanha. Há uma série de prémios fantásticos para cada nível de contribuição. Obrigado pelo suporte
2. Divida com seu network social e se torne um 'Adepto do Brazil Live Project'.
3. Torne-se um dos 'Promotores do Brazil Live Project'.
4. Junte-se a nós como um 'Patrocinador do Brazil Live Project'.
Esse nível de suporte é reservado para aqueles que tiverem a abilidade de doar em grande quantidade e/ou companias que quiserem demonstrar seus produtos através do nosso canal. Esse laço inclui a Parcería de Mídia e o reconhecimento público do seu suporte. Esse vínculo será criado com doações acima do valor de $1,000 dolares. Por favor entre em contato direto comigo se você estiver interessado em colaborar conosco com maiores doaçoes. Inclusão de produtos nos nossos projetos futuros e o patrocínio contínuo também são bem-vindos.
"Nós somente publicaremos o seu produto e/ou a sua contribuição com a sua permissão e somente no formato autorizado.'
Juntos, nós poderemos fazer uma grande diferença.


MAIS SOBRE ESSE PROJETO
ESCOLA DA COMUNIDADE UNIAO
Essa é uma instituiçao que vem tentando ajudar a educar a juventude das favelas por mais de 30 anos, em áreas perigosas aonde a educaçao e qualquer tipo de oportunidade custa a chegar. Essa escola é uma das únicas que atualmente se dedica a oferecer educaçao infantil em uma das áreas mais pobres e mais violentas do Brasil, conhecida como Comunidade da Rocinha. Essa instituiçao está em constante dificuldades para manter-se viva e operante, e é por isso que nós precisamos de sua ajuda! As aulas que as crianças recebem nessa escola, sao literalmente a chave para a mudança de suas vida e comportamentos, recebendo novos horizontes e a esperança de um futuro melhor. 



O Impacto 
Nós trabalharemos com essa 
escola por tempo indeterminado. Isso é apenas o começo. O que nós 
queremos é que esse projeto siga progredindo permitindo que a escola 
desenvolva seus artistas e shows e que com isso ganhe seu merecido 
reconhecimento.  
Esse projeto tem a intençao de guiar as crianças por um  caminho diferente. Um caminho de luz e progresso fazendo que elas tenham ferramentas necessárias para se desviarem do caminho da escuridão. A educaçao de todas as crianças desse planeta tem um efeito direto no futuro da humanidade.
Esse é um mundo único, de uma única responsabilidade

 

Através de comprar o álbum - você estará apoiando a educação dessas crianças especiais, não só aqui no Brasil, mas em todo o mundo, chamando a atenção para a necessidade de educação em todas as nossas comunidades, onde quer que você pode ser, como só juntos podemos fazer a mudança acontecer A educação futura das crianças do planeta afeta a todos nós. Este é um mundo - Uma responsabilidade Obrigado pelo suporte!

story:
I am excited to give you a report of WayForward’s progress.  First, I want to thank you for your support of WayForward and thank you if you participated in our fundraising event back in April.  It was a HUGE success and we were able to hit our goal of $50,000.  We cannot thank you enough for your contribution.

Here is an update on how your money has been spent:

·  Developed evidence-based curriculum 

·  Recruited professional special education teachers

·  Identified and moved into classroom and office space

· Developed a strong Board of Directors (see http://www.wayfwd.org/wayforward-board-bios/)

· Developed relationships with other special needs service providers

  • Started student recruitment and started the first class.  Our goal is to enroll a total of 8 students by January of 2016.

    This is a crucial time and additional funding will be needed to fund ongoing compensation for teachers to work with students with intellectual and developmental disabilities, including adults on the autism spectrum.  Also, many of the students may require financial aid.   

    During the next three years Wayforward would like to grow the number of students who we serve to 30 annually.  We expect to evolve, modify and add to our program and grow our funding streams.  For example, by the end of our first year, we hope to purchase a van for student transportation and to provide a socialization day for students on Saturdays.  This will provide a much needed reprieve for caregivers.   

    You are vital to the success of this much needed endeavor.  WayForward appreciates all you have done to ensure the development of this important service.  Please consider making another donation at this critical time.  Even $10 for a year will add up to enough art supplies for a student for a year.  Please help us change lives!

     Visit the Way Forward website for more information and to make a donation.  www.wayfwd.org
