story:
The Story So far... Yoga Makes a Difference Free Education in Yoga has taken place in 3 different countries and graduated over 200+ students. We have been financing all trainings on our own but to be able to continue this phenomenal movement we need your support!

Costs for each event... One event in Europe costs approx 4460 dollar (3900 euro).  It covers travelling expenses for our YogaMakes team, accommodation, and course material for the students.

YogaMakes a difference - is a 10 days FREE Education in Yoga

Our aim is that as many people as possible will have the opportunity to study yoga in depth, and in this way we hope to spread some light into people’s lives.

and these are countries Yoga has made a difference in: 

STOCKHOLM: AUG 2013


BARCELONA: APR 2014


BERLIN: SEP 2014 


You can help us to "Make A Difference with Yoga" to thousands more (and maybe you too if you decide to attend) we have 7 countries on our list with eager people ready to get involved with finding locations and co-creating more spaces to share the gift of Yoga around the world. The countries we would like to attend next are: Peru, Malta, India, London UK, Rome Italy, Tokyo Japan & the city of Amsterdam... To begin with! 


This crowdfunding campaign can make this all happen and then some. 

Together we can spread a ripple of Yoga across the whole globe and can simply make an exponential difference to the well being of millions of people. This loving movement of kindness will naturally support humanities evolution out of fear and into love...

Dali Lama said, “If every 8 year old in the world is taught meditation, we will eliminate violence from the world within one generation.” Isn’t that reason enough for us to start? 

----------

We believe that a Greater, more Tolerant and Peaceful world starts with us.

We believe that you need to “Be the change you wish to see in the world”

Gandhiji also said…

“The only devils that's exist in the world are those that are running around in our own heart and that is where all our battles aught to be fought.”

We believe that through the ancient practice of the yogic wisdom this is possible.

Everyone should have the opportunity to be more balanced, healthy and happy for no reason. To find complete security, complete joy and complete selfless service we believe is to travel into the center of our consciousness. 

This creates a ripple effect and will benefit your family, friends and your community. 

- And thats pretty much how our idea of YogaMakes a Difference FREE Education in Yoga was born.

The course is open for students all over the world who have at least six months of prior regular yoga practice.

There is only one requirement to join, You Want To Give Back! How? Depends on you! Introduce yoga to your friends and family by practicing together. Share breathing awareness at work. Give a relaxation class in your children school, the sky is your limit or not even that...

After the completion of the course you will be able to share a 60 minute Rajayogi sequence based on Hatha and Iyengar tradition as well as simple breathing, focus and relaxation techniques. You will have tools to deepen your own practice and help others enjoy the benefits of yoga. 

------------

What some of our students have said after...

"This training was an amazing experience, one of the most beautiful 10 days in my life, very deep experience. I learned so many things about yoga positions and yoga philosophy. " Dominika, Spain

"There message is clear, solid and truthful. The Asana practice is safe, they know bodies by just looking at them and they help you go further from where you are today" Belén, Spain

The combination of Ratheesh´s and Caroline´s experience and knowledge is truly unbeatable. For many of the students it was their first TT, but also a major step forward on their yoga path." Malin, Sweden

We are the people behind YogaMakes… 


Acharya Ratheesh Mani is a yoga teacher from Kerala, India. Ratheesh has inspired thousands of students all over the world, to embrace Yoga as a way of healthy living. He does this the old fashioned way i.e. by example, and through his character. To date he has educated over 500 people to teach the Yoga traditions in his own teacher trainings. He has taught over 11.000 yoga classes, 25 Teacher Trainings, and provides free teachers trainings all over the world. Please visit Ratheesh personal site if you want to get to know him more  www.ratheeshacharya.com

Caroline Westling has always had a deep philosophical interest in life and as a teenager she was inspired by her grandmother to start dabbling with yoga. She first started practicing Hatha Yoga and later on turned to Ashtanga Yoga in which she took her first Teacher Training. Finally she fell in love with sequencing and proper alignment during her Yoga Works Teacher Training in 2006. Since then she has over 1500 hours of teacher trainings from different parts of the world. She has daily guidance from her Guru Acharaya Ratheesh Mani and has practiced with some of the greatest teachers, including Maty Ezraty in the U.S. Please visit Carolines personal site if you want to get to know her more www.carolinewestling.com

Caroline and Ratheesh lives in Sweden and India with their 4 kids. They offer yoga teacher trainings, hold international workshops, organize retreats and teach at several yoga studios, prisons, schools and businesses.

The schedule for our 10 Days FREE Yoga Education can look like this

8.00 – 9.45am Morning pranayama, asana and dhyana practice

 9.45 – 10.15am Breakfast 

10.15 – 11.15am Philosophy 

11.15 – 12.00 Lunch 

12.00 – 12.30pm Q & A 

12.30 – 2.30pm Technique, alignment, teaching 

2.30 – 3.15pm Sequencing 

Morning practice: You will deepen your own practice and you will practice different kinds of variation on the sequence you will learn to share.

Philosophy: Many traditional texts will be shared and explained - from Ramayana, the Yoga sutra, Vedas...

Q & A : You will have the opportunity to write a question everyday and put it in an answer box. During the Q&A hour Ratheesh will read and answer as many questions as possible. There are only great questions and your friend might have the same question as you so don’t hesitate to ask anything.

Technique, alignment, teaching:  We will share all that you need to know about asanas and alignments, how to safely practice and instruct people. This will be based on demonstrations, lectures and par teaching.

Sequencing: We will breakdown the sequence, modify it to suit the beginners, and boost it up to suit more experienced practitioners. The sequence taught is one that focuses on the spine in order to keep a healthy body and clear mind.

Upcoming events

We get requests almost every day to come and share the light of yoga. With your help we will be able to say yes to more people and in more countries and continue to make a  difference...

These are the first on our list…

India, Japan, Italy, Malta, Peru, UK and Netherlands

Risks and challenges

For each location/country we need a person/host that help us organise the event. Help to find a venue, answer questions from the participants regarding accommodations and other practical things. 
Our challenge is to find someone that we can trust. Luckily we have a big community with fantastic people all over the world and they have friends which have friends which have friends..... you get my point :)

After organising 3 events we are more prepared for the challenges and we have a great team of people with us.

Our final words...

Thank you for taking the time to read and listen to our vision. When we had the idea 10 years ago we did not know how big the impact would be.  To be part of this project is really a privilege.  To witness the light in every person and how their lives change not only as yoga practitioners but as responsible and loving human beings. The journey to understanding more about ourselves, find balance and peace within is indeed a journey worth sharing.  We thank the universe everyday for letting us be part of peoples lives and their journey towards a higher awareness and a better world. 

Help us spread our vision of a better world by sharing our project with others or by helping us fund it. We need your support in any way you can, together we can Make a Difference!

Love

Caroline and Ratheesh
#yogamakesadifference

story: Hello! I am raising money for a internship in the country of South Africa during the summer of 2016. I have always loved sharks and am currently pursuing education to eventually become an elasmobranchologist, or a biologist specializing in sharks. Internships are important for learning from those who have experience, which is something the individuals at the South African Shark Conservancy have. I have a strong passion to sharks, and want to make sure that they stay around and not become extinct. Investing in me is an investment that helps me learn the things I need to to help sharks in the future.

story:
We're proud to announce that over 2000 students have joined the Humanity Rising movement in the three months since we've opened national registration. Our numbers are growing...and fast! Donate now and provide these motivated volunteers with scholarships for their outstanding efforts.



Check out our updates page for all the service stories. Here's another from Grand Rapids, Michigan.

Hanel Yu - Kids' Food Basket (Grand Rapids, Michigan)

“Some people talked about football games. I talked about volunteer experiences.”

These are the candid words of Hanel Yu talking about service work among her high school peers. With an inspiration to help the hungry since her second year of high school, Hanel realized that volunteering was more than a resume-building experience. She soon learned that fighting hunger in her community meant so much more than anything she initially expected.

Hanel joined Kids Food Basket, a local non-profit organization that seeks to eliminate hunger in Grand Rapids, Michigan. Kids Food Basket packs hearty and nutritional meals for children who can’t afford lunch at poverty-stricken public schools. Hanel said she was most concerned about their developing brains. Kids Food Basket operates solely on volunteers, so Hanel was compelled to spread the word.

“It was there that I learned that hunger and poverty were all around me, not beyond me— which led me to vow to raise as much awareness and finances for these hungry children as possible,” she said.

Within the next school year, there were a lot more students from Hanel’s school that applied to be part of the organization. With Hanel’s help and voice, Kids Food Basket raised over $45,000 this year. On top of that accomplishment, Humanity Rising awarded her with a $500 service scholarship for being part of a greater future.

“I can’t eliminate world poverty, but it’s one step towards something better and making a better place for those who are impoverished,” she said.


Announcing our first service story to come from this campaign! Check back here next Thursday to learn more about what our innovative students are doing for the causes that inspire them most.

Johnny Means - The Neighborhouse (Wilmington, Delaware)

Growing up in a low income area filled with crime amongst its youth didn’t stop Johnny Means of Wilmington, Delaware, from taking action and devoting his time to a local service project to help out.  He knew that kids in his community age nine to eleven could be a little rough around the edges, so about a year ago, Johnny started spending time at the Neighborhouse, a local community center, teaching approximately 30 kids how to play chess competitively.

“My goal was to make sure these kids were doing something they would enjoy,” Johnny said.  “Long-term thinking skills developed through chess could be used more and bad decisions would be made less.”

The effect Johnny’s efforts had on his community were tremendous. Johnny always had a knack for chess, but the relationships he built with the kids went far beyond a pair of doubled pawns.  Chess gave Johnny something positive he could bring to his community.  He believed that by teaching kids how to think critically while having fun and being competitive, they’d grow up making better decisions that would have a huge impact on the community.  Johnny said that chess gave him a reason to serve, and in return, he’s been rewarded in ways he never expected. “I just like to see how the kids react. I went into it expecting that the kids wouldn’t like it, being more into sports and videogames, but they got connected and started thinking a lot more.”

Humanity Rising is proud to award Johnny with a $500 Service Scholarship for his outstanding efforts working with youth and inspiring students and citizens alike to get involved in their local communities. Students – you can start your own service project. Visit www.humanityrising.org to learn how you can make a difference in your community and help the cause that inspires you most today.


The George Westinghouse College Prep Story























CEO/Founder

Debbie Ferruzzi

is CEO of Humanity Rising and has been passionately involved in entrepreneurism and socially conscious activities for most of her professional life. She enjoyed a 25-year career working for legendary real estate entrepreneur Sam Zell, and during her role as Executive Vice President of Corporate Strategy at Equity Office, in addition to overseeing strategic planning, Debbie also developed and led the company's philanthropic programs to engage employees across the country in meaningful service projects.  Believing that “one story can change the world,” Debbie steered the BeCause Foundation, a Chicago based nonprofit, as it produced five independent documentary films and related strategic impact campaigns. The theatrically released film “Bully” helped shine national attention on the bullying crisis in America.  Debbie was also the driving force that led to 121help.me , the new North American crisis helpline for at risk children.  A Chicago native, Debbie obtained an MBA with a concentration in finance from the University of Chicago and a BS in business from Eastern Illinois University.

“I am grateful for the opportunity to bring people together through Humanity Rising.  I am inspired daily by the acts of service and volunteerism performed by students who have become part of the Humanity Rising movement, and believe that young people truly have the power to change the world."

Chief Operations Officer

Mark Jacobs

is COO of Humanity Rising and our scholarship / student lending expert. Over his professional career, he has worked for the nonprofit and for profit leaders in education finance including USA Funds, Sallie Mae, and Goal Financial. His past experience also includes volunteer work for College Parents of America and operation of Discus Awards, a national high school recognition and scholarship program that accepted more than 120,000 applications and awarded over $15 million in scholarships during a two year span. Mark derives significant satisfaction knowing his professional work is tightly aligned with his personal passion of making a difference in communities across the country while helping students afford a college education. He received his undergraduate degree from Indiana University and master's degree in management from Indiana Wesleyan University.

“It is an honor to play a small role in the Humanity Rising movement that will mean so much to so many.”

Chief Technology Officer

Nick Landgrebe

is CTO of Humanity Rising. The youngest member of the organization, Nick aims to use his background in technology to change the way nonprofits adapt and thrive in the modern world. He is ready to make Humanity Rising the National Service Scholarship Platform and envisions it taking on many roles as a catalyst for connecting students, sponsors, and causes. Nick has enjoyed a lifelong passion for programming, has worked with and founded multiple startup organizations, and has extensive experience in the field of software engineering. He is currently pursuing a B.S. in Computer Science from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

"Humanity Rising represents a new kind of platform, empowered by the Internet, and I'm both proud and ecstatic to have the privilege of seeing it come to fruition first hand."

Director

Beth Coronelli

is a director of Humanity Rising and Senior Vice President and Chief of Staff at Apollo Education Group, one of the world's largest private education providers. Her experience includes a mix of corporate and non-profit positions, including leading investor relations for publicly-traded companies across a range of industries, serving as the director of the University of Iowa Executive MBA Program, and developing communications and programming for Rotary International. Beth believes education is the cornerstone to building a brighter future and is committed to empowering our future leaders to take the initiative to serve. She has an MBA from the University of Iowa and a bachelor's degree in journalism from Iowa State University.

Director

Allison T. Davis

is a director of Humanity Rising and a vice president of Equity International, with her primary responsibilities in communications. Previously, Allison directed communications and philanthropic programs at Equity Office Properties Trust (EOP) for seven years. During that time she worked with EOP leaders in such major U.S. markets as New York, Washington DC, Boston, Chicago, Seattle, San Francisco, Los Angeles, and Denver to develop volunteer and giving programs that directly involved employees and benefited their local communities. During her time at EOP, the company was regularly recognized as a Best Place to Work in local markets, thanks to high levels of employee engagement fostered by internal communications. She holds an MS in integrated marketing communications from Northwestern University and a BA from Duke University.

 











Humanity Rising is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. We sponsor students who perform meaningful service and reward them with scholarships for school, and there are ways for everyone to get involved. For your donation, you will receive a thank you letter containing our IRS number for tax purposes.

For press inquiry, questions, or feedback regarding the campaign, please email us at info@humanityrising.org

If you or your company would like to sponsor a service challenge, please contact us at scholarship@humanityrising.org

If you are a student and want to join the Humanity Rising movement, visit www.humanityrising.org to learn more about how you can get started.
story_txt:
We're proud to announce that over 2000 students have joined the Humanity Rising movement in the three months since we've opened national registration. Our numbers are growing...and fast! Donate now and provide these motivated volunteers with scholarships for their outstanding efforts.Check out our updates page for all the service stories. Here's another from Grand Rapids, Michigan.



Hanel Yu - Kids' Food Basket (Grand Rapids, Michigan)
“Some people talked about football games. I talked about volunteer experiences.”
These are the candid words of Hanel Yu talking about service work among her high school peers. With an inspiration to help the hungry since her second year of high school, Hanel realized that volunteering was more than a resume-building experience. She soon learned that fighting hunger in her community meant so much more than anything she initially expected.
Hanel joined Kids Food Basket, a local non-profit organization that seeks to eliminate hunger in Grand Rapids, Michigan. Kids Food Basket packs hearty and nutritional meals for children who can’t afford lunch at poverty-stricken public schools. Hanel said she was most concerned about their developing brains. Kids Food Basket operates solely on volunteers, so Hanel was compelled to spread the word.
“It was there that I learned that hunger and poverty were all around me, not beyond me— which led me to vow to raise as much awareness and finances for these hungry children as possible,” she said.
Within the next school year, there were a lot more students from Hanel’s school that applied to be part of the organization. With Hanel’s help and voice, Kids Food Basket raised over $45,000 this year. On top of that accomplishment, Humanity Rising awarded her with a $500 service scholarship for being part of a greater future.
“I can’t eliminate world poverty, but it’s one step towards something better and making a better place for those who are impoverished,” she said.

Announcing our first service story to come from this campaign! Check back here next Thursday to learn more about what our innovative students are doing for the causes that inspire them most.Johnny Means - The Neighborhouse (Wilmington, Delaware)Growing up in a low income area filled with crime amongst its youth didn’t stop Johnny Means of Wilmington, Delaware, from taking action and devoting his time to a local service project to help out.  He knew that kids in his community age nine to eleven could be a little rough around the edges, so about a year ago, Johnny started spending time at the Neighborhouse, a local community center, teaching approximately 30 kids how to play chess competitively.“My goal was to make sure these kids were doing something they would enjoy,” Johnny said.  “Long-term thinking skills developed through chess could be used more and bad decisions would be made less.”The effect Johnny’s efforts had on his community were tremendous. Johnny always had a knack for chess, but the relationships he built with the kids went far beyond a pair of doubled pawns.  Chess gave Johnny something positive he could bring to his community.  He believed that by teaching kids how to think critically while having fun and being competitive, they’d grow up making better decisions that would have a huge impact on the community.  Johnny said that chess gave him a reason to serve, and in return, he’s been rewarded in ways he never expected. “I just like to see how the kids react. I went into it expecting that the kids wouldn’t like it, being more into sports and videogames, but they got connected and started thinking a lot more.”Humanity Rising is proud to award Johnny with a $500 Service Scholarship for his outstanding efforts working with youth and inspiring students and citizens alike to get involved in their local communities. Students – you can start your own service project. Visit www.humanityrising.org to learn how you can make a difference in your community and help the cause that inspires you most today.The George Westinghouse College Prep Story

story:
Casataller

Casataller se encuentra en La Paz, Bolivia. Es un espacio fundado el año 2011 con el objetivo de promover la creación musical y sonora a través de proyectos de formación, producción, investigación y difusión que benefician a artistas, estudiantes, miembros de instituciones, colaboradores y público que asiste a las actividades. Un colectivo de compositoras y compositores bolivianos dirige Casataller y actualmente ha concentrado sus esfuerzos en su proyecto más ambicioso: la creación de una escuela de composición en Bolivia.

Casataller es una asociación sin fines de lucro que se sostiene a través de la colaboración de sus asociados y la autogestión. 

Escuela de Composición

La Escuela de Composición es un proyecto que busca contribuir al desarrollo de la música contemporánea a través de la formación de compositores técnica y artísticamente solventes. Esta experiencia busca un efecto multiplicador y la existencia de un cambio real en el ámbito de la cultura boliviana. La música es una forma de pensamiento y la composición es una forma de producir conocimiento, un lugar sin nuevos creadores está condenado a consumir casi exclusivamente música que tiene muy poco que ver con su propia realidad.

¿Qué necesitamos?

Además del trabajo con profesores estables, hemos organizado trabajo con siete profesores invitados de diferentes procedencias y diversas corrientes estéticas. 

Necesitamos $15.000 parar cubrir los pasajes, estadía y honorarios de todos nuestros invitados.

Profesores invitados

Alberto Villalpando (Bolivia, 1940)

Edgar Alandia (Bolivia, 1950)

Agustín Fernández (Bolivia, 1958)

Rodolfo Acosta (Colombia, 1970)

Daniel Leguizamón (Colombia, 1979)

Alexander Grebtschenko (Bulgaria, 1975)

Alessandro Perini (Italia, 1983)

Los profesores estables de la Escuela de Composición son Canela Palacios, Sebastián Zuleta, Lluvia Bustos y Miguel Llanque, quienes además son los gestores del proyecto. Sin embargo consideramos que el acceso a un amplio abaníco de aproximaciones y experiencias es fundamental para alcanzar un nivel de formación académica óptimo.

Es por esto que tenemos previsto que estos siete profesores invitados ofrezcan clases magistrales y talleres a nuestros estudiantes. Si alcanzamos el objetivo de esta campaña de recaudación de fondos habremos logrado un hecho sin precedentes en la historia de la educación musical en Bolivia. 

Actividades

Los profesores invitados realizarán actividades dirigidas a los estudiantes de la Escuela, a todos los músicos interesados y al público en general:

•  Cursos de composición intensivos dirigidos a estudiantes activos y oyentes.

•  Conciertos didácticos dedicados a su trabajo, interpretados por músicos     bolivianos.

•  Conciertos de fin de curso, con los trabajos realizados por los estudiantes.

•  Charlas sobre su música, abiertas al público en general.


Toda colaboración será bienvenida y muy agradecida, si no puede apoyarnos económicamente puede hacerlo difundiendo esta campaña. Gracias


Para conocer nuestro trabajo:
  https://soundcloud.com/casataller                                                                       https://soundcloud.com/ensamble-maleza                                                        https://soundcloud.com/sebastianzuleta                                                           https://soundcloud.com/ramonaylosparadigm-ticos                                    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0wZgl59q4ao                                       https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z79MP4KoFSg                                     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4iqSy8nkWqw                                       https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YLQF3omipRQ                                     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4w-rzBMFCmA                                     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KeJR7F8W1Ks                            

                                                                             

Casataller

Casataller is located in La Paz, Bolivia. It is a space created in 2011 with the aim of promoting musical and sound creation through educational, production, musical dissemination and research projects that benefit artists, students, members of institutions, collaborators and audience attending the activities. Currently a collective of Bolivian composers directs Casataller and has concentrated its efforts on its most ambitious project: the creation of a Composition School in Bolivia.

Casataller is a non-profit association which is held through self-management and the cooperation of its partners.

Composition School

The Composition School project seeks to contribute to the development of contemporary music through the formation of composers with a solid technical and artistic foundation. This experience seeks a multiplier effect and the existence of a real change in the Bolivian cultural field. Music is a form of thought and Composing is a way of producing knowledge, a place without new creators is bound to consume almost exclusively music that has very little to do with its own reality.

What do we need?

Besides working with tenured faculty, we have organized work with seven guest lecturers from different backgrounds and different aesthetic trends.

We need $ 15,000 to cover airfare, accomodation and fees for all our guests.

Invited Professors

Alberto Villalpando (Bolivia, 1940)

Edgar Alandia (Bolivia, 1950)

Agustín Fernández (Bolivia, 1958)

Rodolfo Acosta (Colombia, 1970)

Daniel Leguizamón (Colombia, 1979)

Alexander Grebtschenko (Bulgaria, 1975)

Alessandro Perini (Italy, 1983)

The permanent professors in the School of Composition are Canela Palacios, Sebastian Zuleta, Lluvia Bustos and Miguel Llanque, who are also the project promoters. However, we believe that access to a wide range of approaches and experiences is essential to achieve an optimal level of education.

That is why these seven invited professors will offer master classes and workshops to our students. If we reach the goal of this fundraising campaign we will have achieved an unprecedented event in the history of bolivian music education.

Activities

The guest lecturers will carry out activities aimed at students of the School, to all interested musicians and general public:

• Intensive composition courses aimed at active and audit students.

• Didactic concerts dedicated to their work, performed by Bolivian musicians.

• Prom concert with the work done by students.

• Talks about their music, open to the public.


Any collaboration will be welcome and appreciated, if you can't support us financially you can do it by spreading this campaign.
Thank you
Some of our work:
 https://soundcloud.com/casataller                                                                     https://soundcloud.com/ensamble-maleza                                                       https://soundcloud.com/sebastianzuleta                                                          https://soundcloud.com/ramonaylosparadigm-ticos                                   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0wZgl59q4ao                                     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z79MP4KoFSg                                   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4iqSy8nkWqw                                     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YLQF3omipRQ                                   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4w-rzBMFCmA                                   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KeJR7F8W1Ks         

Contáctenos / Contact Us

Casataller: casatallercasataller@gmail.com

Miguel Llanque: miguelllanque@gmail.com

Canela Palacios: canelapunto@gmail.com

Sebastián Zuleta: zuleta.sebastian@yahoo.com

Lluvia Bustos: musaguanieve@yahoo.es

by spreading this campaign.Thank youSome of our work: https://soundcloud.com/casataller                                                                     https://soundcloud.com/ensamble-maleza                                                       https://soundcloud.com/sebastianzuleta                                                          https://soundcloud.com/ramonaylosparadigm-ticos                                   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0wZgl59q4ao                                     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z79MP4KoFSg                                   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4iqSy8nkWqw                                     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YLQF3omipRQ                                   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4w-rzBMFCmA                                   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KeJR7F8W1Ks

story:
#1 WHAT this project will accomplish: 

You will bring empowering audio education to parts of the world that need it most but can't access or afford it.

#2 HOW we will do that: 

We will do this by burning podcast into CDs and distributing them for free to people who are longing for education but lack of resources like quick access to Internet 

#3 What the MONEY will be used for: 

  1. The money will be used to buy and burn the CDs, distribute them, keep track of and follow-up with recipients of CDs to gain feedback on the impact of the project. 
  2. The money will also be used to pay a project manager to be in charge of and  manage the project

#4 Who is supporting this: 

10 podcast partners listed below, with links to their websites/podcasts. The podcast episodes from the partners are also available for free listening in the "UPDATES" section of this Campaign 

#5 What you get for supporting the project: 

For supporting the project you get perks at a deep discounts that are not available ANYWHERE else. The partners have made these offers available only in support of this campaign, and they are regularly (in real world value) at LEAST Double the price in most cases, triple.  The perks include eBooks, Coaching, Courses, Sponsorship and many many more.


#6 The impact on people's lives this will have: 

The perks are great, but your real value comes from being part in a project that will make a real difference in people's lives. 

Education is truly the only way to alleviate global poverty, foster to self-reliance and actually change this world for the better. 

We all WISH, AND SAY, that we want to make the world a better place.

You are probably weary and saddened by the news we all see every day about events around the world.

You might even feel helpless, wondering if your individual effort can really make a difference.

What the world needs is inspiration, education and empowerment. People living in lack, poverty and disillusionment need to Believe a better life is possible, and have a path to self reliance and independence.

You are a hero for not just taking about it, instead TAKING ACTION to change the world!!




PODCAST PARTNERS: 

Marc Paxton: Food Marketing Podcast

Jodi Flynn: Women Taking The Lead

Kevin Craine: Everyday MBA

Marc Mawhinney: Natural Born Coaches

Lucy Mwinamo: GiftSmartly

Kent Trabing: Immigrant Entrepreneur

Luis Congdon: Thriving Launch

Manny Wolfe: Steep Side of the Mountain

Matt Mawhinney: www.PodAssist.com

Mercy Kay: Entertain To Educate my child

Tony Woodall: Goal Getting Podcast

Sam Lomeli: Tips of the Scale

Joel Boggess: ReLaunch: Starting over with Confidence


Other links mentioned in the video:

www.500Evolution.com  by  Alex Charfen

Inspiration: Salvo Rubin's Interview on Immigrant Entrepreneur podcast

Kevin Ferguson's interview on Kevin Ferguson's interview on Immigrant Entrepreneur podcast 

Mercy's interview on Immigrant Entrepreneur podcast

Mercy's interview on Women Taking the Lead podcast

story:
Help Fund the Upcoming Exhibit in Downtown Las Vegas

We have a goal! We are trying to reach $10,000 to put on an exhibit. 
We are a 501(C)3 Not-For-Profit. All donations are Tax Deductible


Who are We?
We are the Museum of Gaming History (MoGH), a not-for-profit, 501(C)3, educational institution founded by the Casino Chip and Gaming Token Collectors Club, Inc. The mission of the Museum of Gaming History is to preserve collections, artifacts, and archives for the purpose of educating the public through it’s exhibitions, programs, and information. The MoGH provides a virtual and physical presence of Gaming Collectibles and Memorabilia at our website (www.themogh.org) and displays of such items at various venues in Las Vegas, at this time, with more planned.

Gaming has held a place in traditional and popular culture for centuries worldwide. When motivations, style, and technology change, gaming has adapted to serve the needs and desires of people. Artists represent it, writers discuss it, and destinations are built around it. Gaming can be simultaneously celebrated or criticized, leisurely or addictive, legal or illegal. Learning multiple perspectives helps us understand what drives people to invest time and money in and around gaming. Preserving artifacts provides tangible references to study and enjoy. Engaging in public dialogue about such cultural traditions enables us to think critically about our past, present and future.

What We are Doing?
Building on the recent success with public exhibits at the El Cortez and Mob Museum the Museum of Gaming History wants to expand it’s footprint by looking to raise money via direct donations to fund an upcoming exhibition located at the Plaza Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas Nevada. This project will showcase items from this historic property and will be open to the public free-of-charge. Putting on an exhibition of this complexity costs money - to procure items of historical significance to the property, to procure display cases, to develop a multi-media presentation with the rich history of the property from its time as a railroad stop through becoming an icon of downtown Las Vegas and one of the most photographed hotels in all of downtown.

The exhibition will include gaming memorabilia such as chips, dice, and slot glass and will also include pictures from the different eras and incarnations of the property. The display will start in February 2016. We have a lot of items that were donated or loaned for the exhibition, but we can't do this without your additional financial support. Our website has some of the coverage we received. These can be seen at our website video section.

What Have We Done?
The Museum of Gaming History has already put on two exhibits. The first exhibit was at the Mob Museum located in downtown Las Vegas (in the old post office building). Our second exhibit is becoming a permanent piece at the El Cortez Hotel and Casino and chronicles the life of Jackie Gaughan, one of the pioneers who made Las Vegas what it is today. He owned a number of very influential properties, such as the El Cortez, The Plaza, The Western, The Las Vegas Club, and even held part ownership in the Flamingo, Golden Nugget, and Boulder Club. This exhibit showcases the man through memorabilia such as chips, dice, slot glass, pictures, and a multi-media presentation.

You can keep up with the events through the webpage at our events page.

Other ways you can help
We understand that not everyone is in a position to participate. But the museum has a mission to educate the public and be the keeper of gaming history. But you can still help. Consider doing one of the following:

  • Help us spread the word - Use the links provided below to alert other people of our campaign.

  • Join our mailing list - go to the Museum website at www.themogh.org and select the Mailing List option in the About Us menu. This will let us keep you informed of future exhibits, events, and happenings around the gaming industry.

  • Visit the website often - the new website will be updated often with fresh content. By visiting the website you will be in the know about the museum.

story:
Short Summary

Help us send culinary teachers and professional to developing countries in need of nutritious education and food.

  • A fundraiser operated by Rent Chefs LLC
  • The campaign is crucial due to the fact that culinary professionals is lacking all over the planet
  • You will be part in providing education and food in countries that really need it

What We Need & What You Get

  • Sending one culinary professional were needed around the world is costly. Rent Chefs LLC already donates 2 percent of its yearly revenues, but that's not nearly enough.
  • You and the world will be able to follow exactly were the money goes through our video diaries on globalchefs.org
  • The funds will go to travel expenses, food and a small salary to the culinary professionals 

The Impact

  • Nobody should be lacking nutritious food - our work with local schools and governments and other nonprofit organisations will give a greater understanding of cooking and nutritious food
  • You'll be able to follow our work every step of the way and see the change we'll make

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Besides funding, we are also in need for chefs and other culinary professional that are willing to travel and educate people in remote, and sometimes dangerous, parts of the world.
  • Please share this with friends and family!

story:
The Focus: 

This campaign is about Citizens for Affordable Housing, Inc. (a HUD certified housing counseling agency) raising money for apprenticeships in the housing industry for at-risk kids and providing scholarships to institution of higher learning. 

Citizens for Affordable Housing, Inc has always been a privately owned company and we want to keep from jumping through extensive hoops of going to major investors to fund this campaign. We want to give the world and more specifically the community an opportunity to join us in launching this next phase of home ownership education from hands-on perspective. 

Only 18% of young at-risk adults never get connected to school or work from the ages of 18-24. WE HAVE TO CHANGE THIS!

Our Vision

The New Program: 

This new program from Citizens for Affordable Housing, Inc.  will bring a new perspective to homeownership education . This program will train students, who would not have been able to attend institutions of higher learning, to have the skills to know the housing industry and will seek to get college credits or certifications while doing it. While focusing on this education, the organization will be strengthening the pool of integrity driven Loan Officers, Realtors, Contractors and many other professionals in the housing industry.


The ultimate vision is to build a housing industry university that educates those who believe they are interested in it and propels them forward to pursue higher learning. 

  • The program will Expose the recipients of the program to all components of the housing industry. 
  • Real properties will be used to be a training ground for learning the industry trades.
  • Efforts from this program will create opportunities for Affordable Housing for low-to-moderate income homebuyers to have a piece of the "American Dream"

We seek to provide scholarships for those  wanting to attend 4 year/2 year colleges or trade schools for certifications. We want to be an intricate part to properly educating and setting individuals up for success in a career that means so much to so many.

Why:

The Founder and CEO of a Nashville Housing Counseling Agency only wanted to help homeowners have a smooth and educated experience for homeownership over 28 years ago. Her dream has been fulfilled in many ways, but has been threatened with the change of times and wildly volatile housing markets. The recent threats have almost bankrupt the  organization. Our fundraising mission is to Save the Organization by expanding the company's scope to help more individuals in the process.

Citizens For Affordable Housing, Inc.  has been ahead of the curve  in Housing Counseling maneuvers for 28 years, and in 2015 seeks to transform how the entire Housing Industry is experienced and how people are educated for placement is in the “Housing Servicing Team”. 

What We Need & What You Get


This is how the Fund Raised will be allocated: 
  • Primarily, the funds will be used to insure that the right candidates are awarded the assistance needed to go to the institution that will provide them the degree, certification, or license they need.Next the funds will be used to assemble a team to implement the proposed system for reaching out to those that will benefit most from the program.  Lastly the final third of the funds will be used to continue the program related activities already in place.  
  • Because of you being a part of this ground breaking initiative , we have some amazing Perks that you will want to give attention to! View the Perks Section.
  • We have an amazing relationship with one of the Hotels in the Music City USA and have a Weekend Stay as one of the perks when you join us in this cause.

The Impact and Why it will Be Successful!

This initiative will be successful because there have been so many people who wanted to be the best version of themselves and they didn’t have a pathway to do it until now. We believe in staying in our lane, which is the housing industry. We will seek to find those who seek a career in Mortgage Financing, Housing Counseling, Real Estate, etc. and eliminate the excuse for why they can’t be a success in that area and give them the tools to succeed.
Another reason why this will be a success is because we have effective and prosperous housing professionals that will be serving on the board as well as volunteers to make sure that real life applications are being introduced and experienced by those that come through the program.
Lastly and the ultimate reason why, is because of You. Your donations and your support means the world to this organization and to those that will come through this program for years to come. We will ever keep your names and your contributions to this vision before those long after this program is thriving and touching so many lives. We as an organization believe in being great stewards of funds brought in whether through donations, grants, programs support or sustainable methods.  Many of you have been recipients of our services or partnerships and you know that we provide the most honest and integrity driven service we can render. The statistics in the Nashville and surrounding areas of Tennessee is that 1 in every 60 people have either gone through the program or their family member has. That is longevity and impact.


Risks & Our Plan To Succeed...

With the newest move to salvage and expand the company, new life has been instilled. With a wealth of Knowledge joining us from various areas of the industry, the company is looking for a moving to a more sustainable plan to continue to be a help to as many as the organization can handle without the life support of granted funds and government programs. The organization seeks to be a part of the solutions, while also being Self Sustained.  The organization has gone through a rigorous organizational restructure and has added individuals that will supply instant growth planning and execution.

Our goal has always been to provide “Affordable Housing”, now we can be a bigger player in that process while educating the industry as well.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you see that you can not give monetarily to the campaign at this moment Speak to others  you know with the Biggest Heart like you by Sharing the Link 
  • Tell as many people about this initiative: to Place those in Higher Education for the Housing Industry focus by Sharing the Link
  •  Indiegogo share tools!

Don’t just watch the revolution, but be apart of it. Changing the Housing Industry while changing Lives!

story: My name is Zoey and I am thirteen years old. As an eighth grader, I am required to complete an experiential project. As my project, I have chosen to fundraise in order to send an orphan to secondary school. I really value my education and wish to share this opportunity with another young woman. This project is my chance to change her life and to learn how to fundraise. 100% of the money goes directly to Nomad Charities to sponsor a girl named Doris. Without your help, Doris will not be able to continue school. I am very grateful for your contribution to this cause.

story: The TAMUK French Club has always been a smaller club on campus, we try extremely hard to provide a welcoming environment to any student who just needs a place to fit in. Sadly, with our club being in such a small community we lack the ability to raise proper funding. Currently we are trying to raise money, to send our students on a year end trip and reward them for all their hard work and dedication they have given to the club. Any funding that can be given will be greatly appreciated.

story:
We are pleased to embark on our third scholarship season! The Ascend Educational Fund (AEF) has received a record breaking 491 scholarship applications!  As we embark upon the selection process, we ask for your support in helping these ambitious, accomplished bright students pursue their dreams of higher education. Our goal this year is to award up to $75,000 and to that end, we are raising $25,000 through our Indiegogo campaign.  100% of the funds raised will directly make it possible for an amazing student to pursue higher education! 

The students you will send to college embody the full meaning of achievement, hard work, dedication and perseverance.  These students have not only achieved academic success and given back to their community, but in many cases have overcome difficult circumstances and extreme hardship such as poverty, domestic violence, and medical illness. These students are more than just deserving, they are some of the best examples of young people who are on their way to changing the world!

A CUNY-bound young woman in the Bronx who spent most of her life in Liberia.  Due to a family related predicament, she missed 1.5 years of high school.  Determined to catch up, she frequently stayed late after school for tutoring and achieved a 3.8 GPA. She also established an organization at her high school that helps raise awareness about college, as many of her fellow classmates would be first generation college students like herself who did not have resources readily available.     -2015 AEF applicant's story 

Our 2013 and 2014 Scholars exhibit just the type of students we can send to college in 2015. These students have overcome serious adversity and have gone through great lengths to continue their education. Our Scholars represent Mexico, Bangladesh, West Indies, Burma, South Korea, Dominican Republic and China.  They attend colleges such as Harvard College, Princeton University, Baruch College, and Wellesley College.

Our campaign gives you an opportunity to change a life by helping us provide financial support and mentorship!


The AEF Scholarship Award Provides





The AEF Impact

At AEF, we believe that every young person deserves access to higher education, regardless of their place of birth or immigration status.  The students we seek to help are those that have exhibited qualities traditionally found in the immigrant community: achievement, resourcefulness, perseverance, hard work, dedication and commitment to their community.

Program Accomplishments:

•  Funded 16 AEF Scholars

•  Awarded nearly $100,000 in scholarships

•  Average award was approximately $8,000

•  Average first semester GPA for our 2014 Scholars is 3.6

•  All AEF 2013 and 2014 Scholars have successfully advanced to the second semester of college


AEF Scholar Profiles and Recent Accolades:

•  Scholars are currently on the Dean’s list at Cornell University and Penn State University

•  One of our scholars attended the BardCollege HESP Social Entrepreneurship Conference in Istanbul, Turkey in March, and was one of thirty attendees

•  Our scholars currently attend:  Bard College, Baruch College, Binghamton University, Cornell University, CUNY’s John Jay College of Criminal Justice, Harvard College, Hunter College, Penn State, Princeton University, and Wellesley College.

Help us change someone’s life!


What We Need & How We Will Recognize your Support

Last year, with the help of the Indiegogo community we awarded $63,000 in college scholarships to help nine students attend college; some would not have been able to continue their education without our help.  We have raised nearly $25,000 for 2015, and raising at least $25,000 from our Indiegogo campaign will help us award as much as last year and get us closer to our $75,000 goal.

Together we can make the life changing difference between students going to college or ending their education.

Every dollar you give will go toward funding the higher education of our 2015 Scholars. Whether we raise $1,000 or $25,000, it will make a huge difference in a student’s life.  

*All donations to this campaign are tax-deductible.*

**Check with your employer to see if they'll match your donation!**


To say THANK YOU

All of our perks were carefully selected by our team to highlight your support of higher education.  Of course, the biggest perk of all is knowing that each dollar invested in higher education today is changing a student’s life and will benefit our community for years to come. To say THANK YOU we will:

•  Recognize you on our website and Facebook page

•  Write you a hand-written note expressing our gratitude

•  Send you our first ever, and limited edition tote bag and coffee mug

•  Invite you to our annual picnic where you can meet the students you are sending to college- currently only mentors and the Board of Directors attend the picnic

•  Invite you to our annual charity gala and reserve a table for eight

•  We will even name a scholarship after you!!!


About AEF

 The Ascend Educational Fund (AEF) is an all-volunteer-led non-for-profit organization (501c3) dedicated to providing college scholarships and mentorship to New York City high school seniors of immigrant background, regardless of ethnicity, national origin or immigration status. Our mission is straightforward– to enable and encourage higher education and professional achievement for the immigrant community.

You can read about our eight 2014 Scholars on our AEF website.  Our Selection Committee is now reviewing applications to select our 2015 Scholars and we will be sharing more about our 2015 applicants in the coming weeks!

The Facts and Need

New York City is the epicenter of the immigrant community in the U.S.  60% of New York City students are immigrants or children of immigrants and yet, immigrants occupy lower wage jobs in manufacturing, construction, and service industries.  A lack of English proficiency and education directly correlates with the percentage of immigrant New Yorkers who live in poverty. 49% of the New York City population speaks a language other than English at home. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Your support means the world to us!  You can help us not only by donating your financial resources but also through the following ways:

•  Corporate Sponsor?

 Do you have a company or know of someone who has a company that would like to send high-achieving students to college and help AEF fulfill its mission? Send them our way and we can email them with an information packet with all of our upcoming events and ways they can help AEF and our Scholars!

•  Want to match contributions or sponsor a week on Indiegogo?

Are you part of a company that believes in higher education? Let us know and sponsor a day or a week, where you will match contributions until a certain amount.  We will promote your company and brand by showing your connection to higher education and AEF!

•  Interested in becoming a Mentor?

Please email mentorship@ascendfundny.org for an application.

•  Connected with media outlets?

Help us spread our message to the media and get them involved! The greater the exposure, the more students we can send to college! We will send you an information packet to forward on.

•  Social Networker or Blogger?

Share information about AEF every day during the campaign! Share our posts, tweet about us, or follow us on Facebook and Linkedin.

•  Techie?

 Know other ways to get AEF more exposure using your technical skills? Let us know!

•  Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Spread the word, each share gets us closer to our goal!

story: When 11 year-old Indie Bateman heard that some children in Rwanda don't have the money to go out into the world and buy art supplies, she decided to make difference. If you donate money to the Third World Card Co, we will buy art supplies and then send them to our special school in Rwanda. We have already done this once before, and it was overwhelmingly successful.

story:
Breve reseña

No se justifica la actual prohibición de la marihuana. No sirve a ningún fin social legítimo el meter presas a las personas por la posesión de marihuana. La actual prohibición destruye vidas y nos cuesta demasiado. Además de que es aplicada de manera discriminatoria en contra de las clases marginadas. La marihuana es menos nociva que el alcohol y el cigarrillo por lo que nadie debería ser penalizado por elegirla. Actualmente miles de jóvenes, y ciudadanos son arrestados por el consumo de esta planta medicinal legal es más de 30 estados y países. Sin embargo nuestras cárceles en su mayoría la ocupa personas de bajos recursos mientras las clases más aventajadas nunca cumplen cárcel. La libertad o el trato ante la ley no debe ser diferente según tu posición o nivel económico. Basta ya de está injusta saga en contra de miles de personas  responsables y pacíficas.

Promovemos el auto cultivo y el uso responsable del cannabis. Queremos proveer un espacio de apoyo para todas la víctimas de las actuales leyes, usuarios, familiares y pacientes en cuanto al Cannabis. Pretendemos no tan solo proveer un espacio educativo sino ofrecer servicios como:

1. Educación (charlas, vídeos, documentales, talleres, etc.)

2. Orientación legal gratuita.

3. Representación legal.

4. Yoga y otras actividades. 

5. Terapia  psicológica.

6. Talleres sobre uso responsable.

Ayúdanos a  mejorar nuestro país convirtiéndolo en uno más justo y seguro. Ayúdanos a proteger y educar a miles de jóvenes y ciudadanos. Conviértete en socio o miembro  hoy de la Fundación Free Juana. 

                                                    "Me gusta verte sonreír"

story:
Hello!  My name is Maureen Heil and I need YOUR HELP!

I am a children's yoga teacher, and I do service through Go Give Yoga, a non profit organization that brings the gift of peace, education, & empowerment through yoga.

 I am an  Registerd Childrens Yoga Teacher, Experienced Registered Yoga Teacher 500, Ayurvedic Yoga Therapist & Health Counselor currently. I also am certified in yoga for special needs( Every Kids Yoga) and trauma with Yoga Activist.

 I was the director & lead teacher of a non profit preschool for over 17 years, and then the world flipped over when I became a children's yoga teacher. I found another way to reach children. Children that NEEDED me most. I stumbled upon Go Give Yoga  and their work in Haiti, and found a purpose to my outreach and traveled there in 2012. It changed my life, and my vision of the world. Imagine what it is like to be a child with no HOPE.......I found out that Go Give was  reaching out to help in Appalachia, and decided to take a big step and become coordinator for this beautiful, yet forgotten region. If you need a clearer picture of the plight of these children, PLEASE watch the video link, it will open your eyes to what is going on here in our backyard. I travelled down to Eastern KY and felt such a strong connection, I knew what I had to do. I was hosted by people there in Beattyville that know the needs firsthand and got to know them ...& their plight.  In a place where trust is earned, they opened their hearts and homes.

My program model is simple, to travel to Eastern Kentucky, which has 3x the national poverty rate, an epidemic of prescription drug abuse, cancer, depression, childhood obesity, and is the most disadvantaged region in the country, to  teach yoga & mindfulness to the adults in the community that are trying to become catalysts  for change. By teaching adults how to bring peace and hope by connecting to their strength they can pay it forward in the  community. Yoga reduces stress & anxiety, brings more strength  & flexibility both physically and mentally, and can bring children a connection to the light within them. Statistics show the benefits of Yoga based movement & mindfulness and the impact it has on both mental & physical well being. I have seen the good it does first hand for people in trauma.

The adults that I will be training will be taking the skills taught to them and doing service in their own communities with  empoverished  children  at risk.

Your contribution will help pay for training  manuals, supplies,  & travel. You will also be supporting Go Give Yoga in our  efforts.  The people of Appalachia are proud, strong, and desperately needy. Jobs are virtually non existing, children often go to bed hungry because their parents are jobless and what resources hey have go to drugs, alcohol, or tobacco. They call themselves the "Forgotten." It breaks my heart that this exists in America

Last year was a pilot. Those trainees are beginning to reach out to work with children from Sunday School to high school. We need to do more, to reach every  .  Child.....I dream big, and hope you do to.

By helping the children of Appalachia by funding this program, you will be creating leaders in communittees that need help to create a brighter future. The adults that I will be working with must apply to Go Give Yoga and detail their population. They must agree to teach for free for six months once a week, and document the positive impact of their work. In this way they pay it foward and create awareness for Appalachia's children.

People in Appalachia are rooted deep in their mountains, and they see the mountains as your mothers arms-hey hold you in one place. I have made a heart felt connection  with community leaders Deborah Pennington andd Joan Hall St. Clair, and they have linked  me to a people we need to remember.  Together we have the tools to create strength and healing in a place that so desperately needs help. If you can, PLEASE donate. If you are moved, please share. Visit www.gogiveyoga.org

story:
Tibetan House set up this Indiegogo drive to raise money for our friends, community partners and loved ones living in Kathmandu, Swayambhu, Patan, Boudha and Bhaktapur, to be delivered personally in September. Much of what you have seen in our shop comes from these areas. We will also make donations to smaller relief organizations that we hear are doing good work.

We want to express our appreciation and gratitude for your kind donations!

money for our friends, community partners and loved ones living in 
Kathmandu, Swayambhu, Patan, Boudha and Bhaktapur, to be delivered

story:
The Global Renaissance Change Agent Academy  is a program for underprivileged youth which teaches and instills the skills and values of leadership, entrepreneurship and scholarship.  This is a self and wealth development training offering personal and professional dream fulfillment strategies.  Being here will increase one’s ability for critical thinking and foster a new focus on Global engagement through Entrepreneurial Altruism.  We present opportunities to develop professional competencies in careers that meet the needs of a modern global community while simultaneously fulfills their innermost desires for happiness and personal fulfillment. 

                                                                      MISSION

To prepare youth and those interested for global competitiveness. To increase young American minds ability for critical thinking, conflict resolution, complex problems solving and intercultural diplomacy and negotiation. To inspire, teach and train youth for the rigors of social engagement for the purpose of creating thoughtful and dedicated community change agents. To teach/train young people to become global problem solvers and promoters of peace


The Global Renaissance Change Agent Academy will transform teenage lives by helping them to make integrity based decisions and to fall in love with themselves through the discovery and recognition of their own greatness, power and purpose.  Our staff will aid them in the pursuit of personal and professional development and fulfillment.  They will learn to take decisive action so that they may bring their greatest works into the world and how to monetize their time, talent, ideas and resources; making history in their own right.  We need and ask for your support. 


P.R.O.G.R.E.S.S. is the steady movement toward a goal. Participation, Respect, Optimism, Growth, Responsibility, Energy, Support & Spirituality are our components of this principle of success. Learning and following these steps will allow our students to obtain P.O.W.E.R. Prosperity, Opportunities, Wisdom, Excellence and Resources that we all seek to have. Anything worth having requires much work and if you believe in something, if you want something, something that gives your life special meaning and that you've never had before then you've got to be willing to do some things that you've never done before. New goals are accompanied by new obstacles and require new dedication to ensure our visions are brought to fruition. Being great is not a matter of social status, background, or income bracket. It's a destiny decision. It's deciding that beyond all odds, there is still something great in you & about you. It's about deciding that your destiny is too valuable to waste. Everything you want in life has a cost that is non-refundable. We prepare the youth to pay the price! 

HELP FUND THIS MISSION

July 2016 — August 2016

Week 1: Basic Financial Literacy —Entrepreneurship —Self Development

Week 2: Passionate Purposeful Planning - Professionalism - Academic Mastery

Week 3:  Dressing for Success—Technological Resources  - Global Connectivity

Week 4: Communication— Broadcasting Oneself—Self Discovery—Personal Responsibility

Week 5: Legacy Leaving—Etiquette—Gentlemen Training—Speech & Debate—Proper Dating Behavior

Week 6: Rewriting the Social Contract—Writing is Fundamental—Business Boot Camp—Health & Fitness

Week 7: Washington D.C. Week This week includes Visits to the following but not limited to: (The Smithsonian - The White House - United States Congress - The Maryland Science Center - John Brown Museum in Harpers Ferry West Virginia - Hard Rock Cafe - Vietnam War Memorial - Korean War Memorial - Lincoln Memorial - Washington Monument - Martin Luther King, Jr. Memorial - The Albert Einstein Memorial - The Thomas Jefferson Memorial - The American History Museum - The Civil Rights Museum (Memphis, Tennessee). This listing will expand. 

Week 8-9 Arkansas Ambassador Trek — Malawi, East Africa

buildon.org/take-action/build-a-school/

https://act.buildon.org/fundraise?fcid=310546


What We Need & What You Get

  • The Global Renaissance Change Agent Academy is conducted by the Non-Profit Organization, Good Hope Charities.  We are incorporated as a non profit in the state of Arkansas and are now raising funds to pay the application fee to apply for our IRS tax exemption. For this we need $850.00
  • We are in need of the professional services of a Web Designer - Videographer / Editor - 
  • 15 Passenger Van
  • Classroom Space
  • Technology Equipment (Computers, LCD Projectors, Office Supplies, sewing machine)
  • Charter Bus Service Expense                                                
The Impact

Many important life lessons will be taught all of which are of essential life maintenance subject matter that is not addressed in the public school system. Things that we never learned in high school but should have and will be taught in this course include and are not limited to:

·  How to prepare personal taxes

·  What are personal taxes

·  How to vote

·  How to write a resume & cover letter

·  All about banking and increasing your Financial I.Q.

·  Stocks / Investments / Wealth Building Strategies

·  How to apply for scholarships or loans for college

·  How to purchase a vehicle or a home. 



                       Other Ways You Can Help 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this funding mission throughout your social networks.  
  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • The best ways to gain the support for this youth program is for those whom believe as I believe and who feel as I feel about the critical need for the expansion of sound, quality youth programming to make it a point to help us to get the word out. Without that type of support we simply cannot be successful.  To give our kids the opportunities that they need and deserve requires money and lots of it.  There is no way around that.  I happen to be one who believes that all things truly are possible and that is why at the end of this campaign we will have the 30 grand needed to begin this program in June 2015.Thank you all in advance.
story_txt:
The Global Renaissance Change Agent Academy  is a program for underprivileged youth which teaches and
instills the skills and values of leadership, entrepreneurship and
scholarship.  This is a self and wealth
development training offering personal and professional dream fulfillment strategies.  Being here will increase one’s ability for
critical thinking and foster a new focus on Global engagement through
Entrepreneurial Altruism.  We present opportunities to develop professional
competencies in careers that meet the needs of a modern global community while
simultaneously fulfills their innermost desires for happiness and personal
fulfillment. 

                                                                      MISSION
To prepare youth and those interested for global competitiveness. To increase young American minds ability for critical thinking, conflict resolution, complex problems solving and intercultural diplomacy and negotiation. To inspire, teach and train youth for the rigors of social engagement for the purpose of creating thoughtful and dedicated community change agents. To teach/train young people to become global problem solvers and promoters of peace 
The Global Renaissance Change Agent Academy will transform teenage lives by helping them to make integrity based decisions and to fall in love with themselves through the discovery and recognition of their own greatness, power and purpose.  Our staff will aid them in the pursuit of personal and professional development and fulfillment.  They will learn to take decisive action so that they may bring their greatest works into the world and how to monetize their time, talent, ideas and resources; making history in their own right.  We need and ask for your support.  
P.R.O.G.R.E.S.S. is the steady movement toward a goal. Participation, Respect, Optimism, Growth, Responsibility, Energy, Support & Spirituality are our components of this principle of success. Learning and following these steps will allow our students to obtain P.O.W.E.R. Prosperity, Opportunities, Wisdom, Excellence and Resources that we all seek to have. Anything worth having requires much work and if you believe in something, if you want something, something that gives your life special meaning and that you've never had before then you've got to be willing to do some things that you've never done before. New goals are accompanied by new obstacles and require new dedication to ensure our visions are brought to fruition. Being great is not a matter of social status, background, or income bracket. It's a destiny decision. It's deciding that beyond all odds, there is still something great in you & about you. It's about deciding that your destiny is too valuable to waste. Everything you want in life has a cost that is non-refundable. We prepare the youth to pay the price! 
HELP FUND THIS MISSION
July 2016 — August 2016
Week 1: Basic Financial Literacy —Entrepreneurship —Self Development 
Week 2: Passionate Purposeful Planning - Professionalism - Academic Mastery 
Week 3:  Dressing for Success—Technological Resources  - Global Connectivity 
Week 4: Communication— Broadcasting Oneself—Self Discovery—Personal Responsibility 
Week 5: Legacy Leaving—Etiquette—Gentlemen Training—Speech & Debate—Proper Dating Behavior 
Week 6: Rewriting the Social Contract—Writing is Fundamental—Business Boot Camp—Health & Fitness 
Week 7: Washington D.C. Week This week includes Visits to the following but not limited to: (The Smithsonian - The White House - United States Congress - The Maryland Science Center - John Brown Museum in Harpers Ferry West Virginia - Hard Rock Cafe - Vietnam War Memorial - Korean War Memorial - Lincoln Memorial - Washington Monument - Martin Luther King, Jr. Memorial - The Albert Einstein Memorial - The Thomas Jefferson Memorial - The American History Museum - The Civil Rights Museum (Memphis, Tennessee). This listing will expand. 
Week 8-9 Arkansas Ambassador Trek — Malawi, East Africa 
buildon.org/take-action/build-a-school/
https://act.buildon.org/fundraise?fcid=310546


What We Need & What You Get

 
The Global Renaissance Change Agent Academy is conducted by the Non-Profit Organization, Good Hope Charities.  We are incorporated as a non profit in the state of Arkansas and are now raising funds to pay the application fee to apply for our IRS tax exemption. For this we need $850.00
We are in need of the professional services of a Web Designer - Videographer / Editor - 
15 Passenger Van
Classroom Space
Technology Equipment (Computers, LCD Projectors, Office Supplies, sewing machine)
Charter Bus Service Expense                                                

The Impact
 
Many important life lessons will be taught all of which are
of essential life maintenance subject matter that is not addressed in the
public school system. Things that we never learned in high school but should
have and will be taught in this course include and are not limited to:
· 
How to prepare personal taxes
· 
What are personal taxes 
· 
How to vote 
· 
How to write a resume & cover letter 
· 
All about banking and increasing your Financial
I.Q. 
· 
Stocks / Investments / Wealth Building
Strategies
· 
How to apply for scholarships or loans for
college
· 
How to purchase a vehicle or a home.  


                       Other Ways You Can Help 
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Share this funding mission throughout your social networks.  
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. The best ways to gain the support for this youth program is for those whom believe as I believe and who feel as I feel about the critical need for the expansion of sound, quality youth programming to make it a point to help us to get the word out. Without that type of support we simply cannot be successful.  To give our kids the opportunities that they need and deserve requires money and lots of it.  There is no way around that.  I happen to be one who believes that all things truly are possible and that is why at the end of this campaign we will have the 30 grand needed to begin this program in June 2015.Thank you all in advance.

story:
Als Ob is a high school journalism project which supports every child’s right to culture and arts. The project began in November 2011, when the first Als Ob Edition was published, after a huge effort and a great deal of work and dedication from the Nicolae Iorga High-school students in Negresti, Vaslui County (Romania).

During these four years, the magazine was awarded twice in the national cultural magazines competition. Unfortunately, although the students are working on the 16th edition, the future of the project looks bleak, as funding is harder and harder to obtain.

The initiator of this project is Florin Onica, philosophy teacher, poet and artist, who dedicated his full energy, time and money to help students and the community become sensitive to high level culture and art.

He has published three poetry books and is the main song writer in the Romanian band Nu Acum, winner of over 20 prizes in music festivals throughout Romania, between 1999 and 2012.

Florin is also a leader in the school and in the community, being the initiator of several cultural meetings and music concerts.

The Als Ob project holds the highest priority in Florin’s life, which is proven by the fact that, during the four years of existence, he invested over $3000 from his teacher salary, which, in Romania, is $300 per month.

Keeping this magazine alive is a very high stake: it has a huge cultural influence on the small town of Negresti, as well as on the students’ psychological and cultural development.

If Als Ob finds resources to continue, the outcomes are extraordinary:

  • As mentioned above, the cultural influence on the small town of Negresti, as well as many generations of students will benefit from psychological and cultural development;
  • Als Ob provides a cultural link between Negresti and other cities in the country, as well as a bridge between the local high-school and other high-schools in the main cultural cities in Romania;
  • Als Ob has already been a starting point for young artists (poets, photographers, painters), who will be students in the most prestigious Universities in Romania and Europe;
  • So far, the magazine collaborated with many American Peace Corps Volunteers, who advertised the project in their own American communities;
  • Over 1500 students read each edition of the magazine;
  • Between 2011-2015, over 60 students worked as editors for this magazine.

 Als Ob has four editions per year (one for each season) and it costs $ 6000 to print 150 magazines, which are 170 pages each. If the project receives more money than it needs for printing each edition, the funds will go towards improving and expanding the tools needed for every magazine: voice recorders, cameras, computer, software, magazine collections, etc.

Your involvement in this project can make a huge difference, as:

  • Als Ob is literally the only doorway for the students in Negresti to freely express their creativity and to develop their cultural foundations;
  • You can help revive the printed cultural magazines, which are losing a lot of ground in favor of the electronic ones;
  • Als Ob covers a wide range of arts: literature, social sciences, painting, photography, drama,  film.

Als Ob was faced with many challenges during its existence, but the team managed to maturely overcome any difficulty, becoming ever stronger and experienced. Some of the challenges were:

  • The lack of interest for cultural activities  of the local community (which started to change, by constantly raising awareness and involving people in these activities);
  • The local authorities do not distribute enough funds (if any at all) for cultural activities (but having people invest in this project would provide a good example and a motivational factor for the local authorities to invest, too);
  • Motivating and involving younger generations of students in the project (this has proven to be continuous and successful work, as more experienced students are training and motivating the younger ones).

Other Ways You Can Help. Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
I am asking for your help to Pay Course fees. I want to Study Bookkeeping. I can not afford to pay the course fees out of my income.

I am also looking for work, so please don't believe I am trying to free load you! With my health condition employers are put off.

I also need to learn to drive. There are jobs I can apply for, that mean I have to travel to clients premises.

I am disabled. I also suffer from depression, so studying and work will help alleviate my depression and give me self-respect and help me off disability benefits.

I can with hard work and putting in 40 hours of work and 26 hours of study a week I can gain my level 3 IAB Bookkeeping qualification by Easter 2016!
