story:
Your money will be used to support Mandarin language courses, passport and visa fees, airfare, cultural experience, housing, and ground costs for study abroad in China in summer of 2015.

Who we are: 

Since 2012, we have been providing Mandarin Chinese language courses and study abroad opportunities for students in Title I schools from Birmingham, Selma, and Montgomery, Alabama.

These young scholars have since continued their language study, expanding the impact of this initiative to their classmates. This year, 9 students will be going to China for 30 days- our largest and longest trip yet!

In March 2015, 100 percent of students enrolled in our Chinese after-school program scored proficient on the HSK Level 1 Basic Test for Mandarin Chinese—equivalent to the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) in the United States, with an additional 100 percent passage rate on the HSK Level 2. This shows they've mastered auditory and reading comprehension of basic characters, according to international standards. In order to further impact their learning, we have created a summer language enrichment opportunity for these students that will bring them to Beijing and Shanghai. During these 30 days, students will meet with political and cultural leaders, sites, and experiences to further their study of this critical language through a unique immersion experience. 

Our needs: 

The Impact

Thanks to a partnership with the Corps Member Education Foundation and the Birmingham Sister Cities Commission, national 501(c)3 organizations, all gifts supporting the 2015 Birmingham to Beijing Project are fully tax deductible.

In December 2015, we will be pursuing the opportunity to be one of the first five Confucius Classrooms through Hanban. This opportunity will bring a full-time teacher in as well as allowing students to gain high school and college credit for courses. This institutional addition will be a game changer for our program, and will be key to creating sustainable learning outcomes and a Chinese language curriculum that will support hundreds of more Mandarin language learners in our community.

Finally, we plan on expanding with community partners and critical language leaders to develop a comprehensive critical language study hub for students in Birmingham City Schools. 

Other Ways You Can Help

- Share your stories and experiences in China with our students!

- Pen pal and practice mandarin with them! 

-Skype in for a guest lecture!

story:
Fundraising Note

Anyone wanting a tax receipt for your charitable contribution, please contact Principle Louie Scigliano before making your contribution.  lscigliano@sd61.bc.ca

Build a Playground 

The kids of Glanford Middle School have had their playground condemned and torn down.  They need your help to raise the funds to build a new one.

Fundraising Needs

The kids have chosen a modern, safe, and fun playground design that will help kids to keep fit, social, and out of trouble.

The total build cost is estimated at $80,000.  We are looking to raise $25,000 to complete phase one and get the first stage of playground construction completed quickly.

The kids are selling chocolates, hosting fundraising events, and getting the word out through social media.  The kids are creating videos to tell their story and appeal for help to make their playground dreams come true.

Playground for Kids

These kids use the playground on a regular basis.  The playground that was removed was the one and only playground at Glanford Middle School.

Building a new playground will give the kids in the neighbourhood a safe place to play, and offer the students at the school a safe way to have fun and stay fit while not in class.

How You Can Help

Donate!  Please make a donation to help build this playground.

Spread the word!  Please use Facebook and social media to share this cause with your friends and colleagues.

Come and play!  Once this playground is built, bring the children to Glanford Middle School and play on the new playground.

story:
Historia 

Durante los años 2005, 2006 y 2007  voluntarios Españoles realizaron campamentos lúdico-educativos durante las vacaciones de verano para educar a los y las jóvenes de los Bateyes (los bateyes son comunidades rurales al interior de los ingenios azucareros y sus diferentes divisiones, en las que viven entre 400 y 500 personas, muchas de ellas en una situación de vida muy precaria, vulnerable, sin luz y sin agua en las casas. Viven dominicanos, haitianos y dominico-haitianos. El trabajo desempeñado por los habitantes de estas comunidades se realiza en el cañaveral de caña de azúcar).

A partir del 2008, y dada la necesidad de ampliar la cobertura de los Campamentos y luego de varios años de trabajo sostenido, nace un grupo llamado Jóvenes de la Milagrosa Dispuestos a Superarse (JMDS). Este grupo realiza a partir de entonces cada año los Campamentos Educativos para 500 niños/as de los diferentes bateyes del Municipio de Guaymate. Con ellos llevamos a la comunidad juegos, trucos de malabares, educación en hábitos de higiene y limpieza del medioambiente, y prevención de enfermedades de transmisión sexual. Muchas de las personas de las comunidades la pasan alegremente, compartiendo y divirtiéndose con las actividades que se realizan, en un tiempo en que al estar los/as niños/as de vacaciones, no tienen nada más qué hacer, pues no existen los recursos económicos para que puedan pensar siquiera en tener unas vacaciones.

Nuestro presupuesto es de 5,000 dólares que serán destinado a la compra materiales, combustible, merienda de los participantes, comida grupo JMDS y un viaje de valoración fuera de los bateyes con los monitores.  

OBJETIVO  GENERAL:

“Mejorar la calidad de vida de las comunidades cercana al batey Milagrosa, mediante el trabajo socioeducativo enfocado en la realización de espacio de ocio, disminuir los niveles de violencia y conflicto entre los/as niños/as, jóvenes y adultos de los bateyes”

OBJETIVOS ESPECIFICOS:

1. Educar a los/as niños/as, jóvenes  y adultos de cada batey, mediante la generación de espacios de diversión y cooperatividad.

2. Incentivar a los/as niños/as jóvenes y adultos a compartir de una forma cooperativa y sin violencia.

3. Sensibilizar sobre la importancia de la limpieza en los bateyes (higiene personal y del medio ambiente)

4. Sensibilizar  y capacitar sobre enfermedades de transmisión sexual y otras como el cólera, dengue etc.

El impacto

Niños/as, adolescentes, jóvenes y adultos, comparte alegremente.

Generamos un cambio participativo implicando a la comunidad y a otras instituciones.

Disminuiremos el alto numero de violencias que existe entre los vecinos.

Reducimos la desigualdad dando la oportunidad a los jóvenes y niños a tomar decisiones en el proceso de las actividades.

Fomentaremos las higienes ambientales y personales de forma continua.

Puede colaborar con nosotros a difundir que nuestra campaña  llegue a más persona.

story:
Türk oyuncu adayının eğitimini destekleyin!

(scroll down for English)

Merhaba,benim adım İdil Tekelioğlu,19 yaşındayım ve geçen sene Avni Akyol Güzel Sanatlar Lisesi'nin müzik bölümünden mezun oldum. Oyunculuk, benim çok küçük yaşta sahneye ilk "Pinokyo" olarak çıktığımda keşfettiğim bir tutkuydu. Ben büyüdüm,oyunculuğa olan aşkım büyüdü,hayallerim büyüdü. Gözlerimi kapattığımda gelecekte kendimi gördüğüm tek bir yer,kendimi düşündüğüm tek bir an vardı; Amerika'da çok iyi bir oyuncu olduktan sonra ülkemi elimde altın bir heykelciği tutarak temsil edebilmek... 13 yaşında Amerika'da oyunculuk eğitimi alabilmek için bir üniversiteye gitmek istediğime karar verdim ve engebeli bir yola adım attım. Gerek ben,gerek ailem maddi manevi bir seferberliğin içine girdik. Yemedim,içmedim,uyumadım ve sadece tek bir şey için çalıştım; hayallerim.

Uzun bir zaman sonra hem TOEFL hem SAT sınavına girdim, ve istediğim puanları alınca seçmelerim için oyunculuk derslerine başladım. Bir yıl boyunca grup derslerine katıldığım oyuncu koçu Merve Taşkan, bana monologlarımı hazırlamakta yardım etti. Gel gelelim sınavlarım için New York'a gittim, ve şu an,  neredeyse seçmelerine girdiğim her okuldan, 6 yerden kabulüm var..  Peki ya şimdi?

Gitmek istediğim okul Amerika'nın en iyi drama konservatuarlarından biri;American Academy of Dramatic Arts. Zaferime, hayallerimi gerçekleştirmeye bir adım daha yaklaştım,fakat şimdi en büyük engelim var karşımda, yıkmam gereken son duvarım,son dönemecim; burs bulmak...

Ne yazık ki bütçemiz okulumun masraflarını karşılamaya yetmiyor ve başvurduğum yerlerden henüz bir ses çıkmadı. Bu sebeple ben de kendi kampanyamı başlatıp sesimi,hikayemi duyurmaya karar verdim!

Siz de  bana katkıda bulunarak hayallerime bir adım daha yaklaşmama yardım edebilirsiniz. Ben bir ilk olmak,farklı olmak,imkansiz denileni başarabilmek,gelecekte ülkemi en iyi şekilde temsil edebilmek ve herkesin hayallerine ulaşabileceğini kanıtlamak istiyorum,belki Broadway sahnelerinde, belki de elimde altın bir heykelcikle... Çünkü hayaller gerçek olmak için vardır!

*******


Support a Turkish actress candidate for her education!

Hello, my name is Idil Tekelioglu, I’m 19 years old and graduated from Avni Akyol Fine Arts High School’s music department last year. Acting was a passion that I found out with my very first step to the stage as "Pinochio" at the age of six. I grew up as my passion and love for acting and my dreams got bigger and bigger. When I closed my eyes, I saw one magical moment, one remarkable scene in my head; becoming the “First Turkish actress” who wins an Academy Award… When I was thirteen years old, I decided to get into a drama school in America and took a step towards my intractable path. My parents and I fought really hard both personally and financially. I didn’t eat, didn’t sleep, didn’t go out, but studied only for one thing; my dreams.

After two years of struggle to improve my low English skills, I took really high scores from TOEFL and SAT and started to take acting lessons from an acting coach, Merve Taskan. We prepared three monologues in a month and I went to my dream city, New York for my auditions. I have 6 acceptances, from almost every school which I’ve auditioned for. And now?

The school I want to go is one of the most prestigious conservatories in America, American Academy of Dramatic Arts. I’m so close to embrace my dreams and my victory, but I have my last, and probably the biggest obstacle on my path; finding a scholarship.

Unfortunately, we don’t have the budget to pursue my education in New York. In order to make my dreams come true, I need to find a scholarship or a sponsor. I haven’t got any positive response from the institutions I’ve applied yet, so I decided to start my own campaign to make my voice and story heard!

You can help me to pursue my education and eventually become the First Turkish Academy Award-winning actress by donating my cause. I want to be the first, I want to be different. I want to make my “so-called” impossible dreams come true, prove that there is no such a thing as impossible, and represent my country by playing on Broadway or holding a beautiful, golden statue in my hands… Because dreams are made to come true!

story:
Have you ever needed support in some area of your life only to find yourself trying to figure it out, unsuccessfully, on your own?

Hello Supporters. My name is Howard Crampton Jr. and I’m rallying folks, just like you, who enjoy offering their support where, when and how you can.

The Support Project: #RWP

Inspiring you to inspire others through developing, strengthening and becoming the inspiration yourselves. "Be the change you wish to see in the world." - Gandhi 

The Goal: 

I’m developing an online education program to support folks with relationship/marriage challenges that will finance my way through my master’s program in professional mental health counseling and addictions. The Start-Up Cost = $5,600


According to the National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH), “In 2012, an estimated 16 million adults aged 18 or older in the U.S. had at least one major depressive episode in the past year.” The American Psychological Association (APA) reports that 40-50% of Americans divorce each year, and that’s only for first-round marriages!

I currently contract with a local homeless shelter in N. Hollywood, CA working with disabled veterans with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder, funded through government grants. I also currently hold a bachelor degree in psychology and work as a personal development coach, with an emphasis on spiritual evolution. I meet people regularly who are looking for mental/emotional support yet can’t afford help mostly due to not having insurance. So I had the idea to take my relationship education and divorce prevention program online and offer it at a most affordable rate.

I have completed certification courses in Strategic Interventions by the Robbins-Madanes Coach Training program and in Neurolinguistic programming taught by one of Tony Robbins previous sales trainers, Niurka Inc.

Targeted Funds: $5,600

$4,000 - Web Developer/Designers

$1,100 - Marketing Materials

$500 – Customer Support Team


Why Crowdfunding?

I have been the person who’s answered “Yes” to the question posed at the top more times than I’d like to admit. I wanted to try and figure it all out on my own until I really understood the Power of Support. I believe in cooperation and not competition. As I allow other’s to practice their skills and talents and I practice mine, we all get to do what we love and be equally compensated. Crowd funding allows me the opportunity to finance a project and have it launched so I can successfully focus on furthering my education on subjects that I’m passionate about, and contribute to Elevating our Moods and increasing our Quality of Living.


One More Thing!

I understand not everyone can contribute financially, but you can support through sharing this campaign with your network of friends, family, coworkers, church groups or other groups you belong to. Any size donation helps contribute to creating and launching this program, and every share raises awareness around decreasing emotional suffering, divorce, suicide, and many other disorders. Consequently, as more people become engaged you can say that you had a hand in helping to relieve emotional suffering and contribute to the evolution of integrity and emotional well-being.

...and don't forget to repost this campaign with #RWP!


Contact Me:

Please stay in touch and follow along through this amazing journey by friending me at any of the social media sites below! You can also email any time at:

Info@HowardCramptonJr.com

Thank you so much in advance for your level of support!

Cheers,

Howard Crampton Jr

P.S. If you choose to participate in one of the group coaching programs, once you donate your email and contact information will be recorded and I will send updates on dates and times, in time.

P.S.S. If your marriage or relationship is in dire need, please contact me directly at Howard@RealLoveandMarriage.com  once you've made your contribution and we'll discuss solutions for supporting you.

story:
My name is Sarah Birch I'm 18 years old. Last year, February, 2014, I was privileged enough to attend a mission trip to “Port Au Prince” in Haiti, which was an initiative through St. Mary’s Church. It was a trip empowering those who volunteered to realize the power we have to help those in need, and make a difference in issues we see facing the world. This mission trip gave me the knowledge and opportunity to have an impact, and because of it, I have realized that I have a social responsibility to be a global citizen. Now I want to “Be the Change” I want to see in the world.

I have personally made the commitment to raise $10,000 to build a school in Haiti before the end of June 2015. I have already raised $3,000. I am hoping to raise the rest here. I plan to do this through Free the Children’s gift catalogue. Free the Children is an organization that works to free children from poverty and exploitation by empowering communities with the skills and resources needed to change their lives. If successful, this school will “equip hundreds of children with the tools to break the cycle of poverty and build a brighter future for their families and communities.”

This could change hundreds of children's lives, I hope you consider donating.

This is a link to a newspaper story about me.

http://www.simcoereformer.ca/2015/01/30/helping...

story:
Global Peace Event is held every year on full moon in May

Our goal is to bring people together from different spiritual, religious as well as secular backgrounds. We will set intentions for peace, chant peace prayers and mantras from different traditions so we can all connect to each others' basic humanity, sincerity and recognize that, 

Peace is our yearning no matter who we are!

Free For All!

May 21st, 4pm-8pm

Quaker Meeting House

701 W. Howard Ave 

Decatur , GA 30030


STORY

On September 11, 2001, my world came crashing down. Like many Americans, I felt completely violated. I feared for the safety of my children and my family. I remember thinking, "This only happens in far away countries, to people who often don't even feel real. How could it ever happen to us, in USA?" I know a lot of you felt this ways. As time went by I kept praying and asking for directions. I knew some how my life's journey included being a voice for peace. What I learned was even more profound. I realized that even though each one of us, in this world, has different paths, our ultimate goal is happiness and peace within ourselves and around us. 

When I looked in my own heart, I found it to be full of pain, suffering and anxiety. I yearned so much for peace but, it was hard to feel it. So it became my mission to find the source of peace in my heart. From here I began coaching others how to get in touch with their inner happiness and peace. All through this time, I knew I was going to organize peace events and bring people together for peace. In fact, back in 2005 and 2006, I even got a team together to begin working on this goal. But as life would have it, those plans did not materialize.

In 2014, while listening to a CD set on Sanskrit mantras, I came across the story of Vesak which commemorates Buddha's birth, enlightenment and death anniversary. According to this story, every year on full moon in May, Christ, Buddha and everyone who has worked on the upliftment of the world gather on an esoteric plane. There is a crystal bowl with a liquid in front of Christ who says a mantra. At the moment of the full moon, Buddha emanates a beautiful light and at this moment, everyone on the earth gets a quickening.  Everyone present then gets a drink of the water charged with the mantras and leaves. Global Peace event is a modified recreation of the above event. 

If we are to create lasting peace we will have to learn to look at each other's humanity. If peace has to become reality, we will have to learn to respect each other, come together, pray together, break bread together, share ideas, share joys, share tears, and uplift each other. 

Global Peace Event is a step in the direction of coming together for peace. It is a call to recognize our own and each other's  humanity. It is a call to come together, for all who care about peace. 


The Event

This is a high impact, high vibration event grounded in the knowledge that all action start at the level of thought and intentions

This event is a commemoration of Buddha's birth, enlightenment and death. Vesak is celebrated by people all over the world. In this celebration we are inviting people from different walks of life, spiritual backgrounds and thought form. Our purpose is to have conversations about peace and how to make peace a priority in our own lives.

This is a unique opportunity for you to listen to an exciting panel of speakers from different spiritual backgrounds as well as peace professionals and peace activists. These speakers will talk about peace in their paradigm and how to make peace a priority in your life. They will also help set intentions for peace and will bring peace prayers and mantras from their own spiritual background for us to repeat and chant.

You will receive water charged and infused with these peace intentions and prayers.

 

Speakers 

Dr. Sherrill Hayes

Peace Professional

Dr. Sherrill Hayes Ph.D., Newcastle University; M.S. & B.S. University of North Carolina at Greensboro, is Associate Professor and Director of the Master of Science in Conflict Management at Kennesaw State University. Since 1999, Dr. Hayes has worked as a family and child custody mediator in the UK and US, designed and evaluated conflict resolution programs for governments and non-profits, delivered training to a wide array of businesses, non-profits, and professionals in the US, UK, Haiti, Ghana, and Germany, and served as a consultant to the Cox Family Enterprise Center. Dr. Hayes is a registered Neutral for Civil and Domestic Mediation with the Georgia Office of Dispute Resolution and his areas of teaching and research include: family, community, and organizational dispute resolution; designing and evaluating conflict management programs and policies; sports as a peace building tool; and refugee resettlement.


Imani Evans

Empowerment Coach

Imani Evans is a counselor and life coach who believes in authenticity as the gateway to unshakeable joy. She has been in the personal empowerment industry for more than 23 years serving as an advocate and change agent in organizations throughout Atlanta, New Jersey and New York. She is the founder of Women Healing Women a 501C3 non-profit organization that offers supportive services to long-term survivors of sexual and domestic violence. Imani believes that 'violence is an experience, not an identity and that the eradication of violence is reliant on our commitment to raise the vibration of love and peace without discrimination.

Evans holds a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology, a Masters degree in Counseling Psychology and is currently pursuing a doctorate in Counseling Education & Supervision. She is the author of Today is The Miracle and is scheduled to release her upcoming book, Unveiling the I Am in June 2015. Imani is a performance artist and healer combining her gifts to guide herself and others toward inner harmony, increased authenticity and personal evolution.

Dr. Noor V. Gillani D. Sc.

Peace Activist & Educator

Dr. Gillani retired as Principal Research Scientist at NASA-AL National Space Science & Technology Center and Professor of Atmospheric Science at University of Alabama in Huntsville after 15 years of service (1995-2010). Prior to that, he was Professor of Mechanical Engineering at Washington University in St. Louis (WUSTL, 1974-92) and of Atmospheric Science at NC State University (1993-95). During his academic career, he also spent sabbatical periods at DOE’s Brookhaven National Lab, EPA’s National Environmental Research Lab, and TVA’s Environmental Research Center. His research focus throughout his academic career was on Air Quality. From 1984 to 1992, he served as US Delegate to NATO’s Commission for the Challenges of Modern Society. He has also served on the Science Committees of several major US environmental measurement and analysis programs. President/Exec. Director, The PYAR FoundationExec. VP for Programs, International Association of Educators for World Peace (IAEWP)(Ret) Principal Research Scientist, NASA-AL National Space Science & Technology Center(Ret) Professor, Atmospheric Science Dep., U. of AL Huntsville(Formerly) Professor of Mechanical Engineering, Washington University in St. Louis

Dr. Gillani is a devout Muslim of Indian ethnic origin and was born and raised in Tanzania, then completed high school (GCE A’Level) in England, and proceeded to the USA for his higher education, first at Harvard (AB cum laude, 1967) and then at WUSTL (DSc, 1974).

Currently in retirement, Dr. Gillani is Founder/President of The PYAR Foundation for children in distress around the world, VP of the UN-affiliated International Association of Educators for World Peace, and is also active in interfaith and social justice causes. He is also involved in the creation of the new Institute of Global Harmony in India, where he expects to join the Administration soon. He is grieved by the gross misinformation of Americans about Islam, and works passionately to counter Islamophobia through education.  He has also developed a model of Islamic Humanism (individual human development to the fullest potential based on the Quranic concept of human being), which serves as the basis for his own life, with a focus on cultivation of spirituality and love for God,and service to all beings in God’s creation, especially those in need.

Johnnie B. Porter, M.A; M.Div. (Ph.D. Candidate)

Pastor

Johnnie Porter is the husband of Robyn J. Porter a high school math educator, and is the father of a ten year old son, and two daughters ages seven and four. He currently lives in West GA in city of Villa Rica, and is a native of East Texas by way of Tyler Texas.  He has lived and served the metro Atlanta community since 1999. He is the Senior and founding pastor of the New Bethesda Christian Ministries Life Church in Villa Rica, Ga. www.Newbcm.com  He is a 2003 graduate of the Charles H. Mason Theological Seminary at the ITC Atlanta, GA  Pastor Porter has worked extensively with interdenominational and political organizations in the greater Atlanta metropolitan area in regards to questions about social welfare, politics, the black family, and improving the plight of African- American males. He is a community organizer and is the founder of The C.A.L.E.B. Group of West GA (Congregations Advocating For Leadership and Betterment) which focuses on Rural community collaboration as it relates to social justice and faith. Johnnie is also a social entrepreneur and licensed insurance broker, but has spend the last 16 years of his life serving the community as a Clinically trained Hospice Chaplain and Bereavement Care Coordinator.  He is currently working on a Ph.D. in Marriage and Family Therapy with a concentration in General Family Therapy, at North Central University.

Dwight Harriman

Shaman

Dwight Harriman is anointed shaman, He has for many years deepened his relationship with Spirit through a melding of paths.  Called by visions as a child, Dwight’s early mystical leanings ripened through long-time 12 Step study, religion, the study of anthropology and through shamanic practice.  Part Cherokee, Dwight earned a degree in anthropology with honors from Georgia State University and has studied for years under different shamans.  He was anointed in 2008 as a shaman and mesa carrier from the International School of Shamanism.  Dwight has led many healing ceremonies, rituals of all types and shamanic journeys.

Penelope Summers

Peace Witch

Penelope Summers holds a B.A. from Lycoming College in  English, an  M.A.  in Writing from the University of Colorado at Boulder and a dual M.A in Peace and Conflict Studies and International Administration and Conflict Management from the University of North Carolina at Greensboro and the University of Konstanz in Germany, respectively.  She is a massage therapist, herbalist and a student of spirituality.  Her work path has been eclectic and she currently works in human resources, teaches, works as an intuitive and is writing a book that joins the practices of peace and witchcraft.

Shahina Lakhani MSN

Soul Coach Peace Activist

Shahina is a Peace Activist, Soul coach, speaker and author. She has a Masters degree in nursing. She is a Master practitioner of Neurolinguistic programming, Certified Theta Healing Practitioner and Certified Angelic Life Coach. Shahina is also trained in Kenisiology, Emotion Code and Silva Method. She is attuned to Karuna Reiki I & II.

Shahina is an intuitive, psychic, medium and has the honor of channeling various angels and ascended masters including Indian gods and goddesses. She connects with the innate wisdom of these sacred beings to help people move forward on their life’s path.

She is passionate about helping you connect to the power house of your soul. She  helps people create inner alignment, empowerment, self love, and inner peace. Her ultimate passion is World Peace which she believes can only be achieved by first cultivating inner peace and inner alignment. This helps you to live in the world from a place of being enough, being powerful, from inner compassion, and self love.

How we will use the funds

The funds collected will be used to pay for the above event, marketing, refreshments and any other incidentals. 
To plan for future events
The speakers are donating their precious time.
We are also considering a part time employee and creating a corporation.
This is a labor of love, donations are crucial to help us keep doing this event and add new events for world peace and  personal empowerment of all who need our help.
THANK YOU for your generosity and for being a Partner In Peace

Global Peace Event is held every year on full moon in MayOur goal is to bring people together from different spiritual, religious as well as secular backgrounds. We will set intentions for peace, chant peace prayers and mantras from different traditions so we can all connect to each others' basic humanity, sincerity and recognize that, Peace is our yearning no matter who we are!Free For All!May 21st, 4pm-8pmQuaker Meeting House701 W. Howard Ave Decatur , GA 30030STORYOn September 11, 2001, my world came crashing down. Like many Americans, I felt completely violated. I feared for the safety of my children and my family. I remember thinking, "This only happens in far away countries, to people who often don't even feel real. How could it ever happen to us, in USA?" I know a lot of you felt this ways. As time went by I kept praying and asking for directions. I knew some how my life's journey included being a voice for peace. What I learned was even more profound. I realized that even though each one of us, in this world, has different paths, our ultimate goal is happiness and peace within ourselves and around us. When I looked in my own heart, I found it to be full of pain, suffering and anxiety. I yearned so much for peace but, it was hard to feel it. So it became my mission to find the source of peace in my heart. From here I began coaching others how to get in touch with their inner happiness and peace. All through this time, I knew I was going to organize peace events and bring people together for peace. In fact, back in 2005 and 2006, I even got a team together to begin working on this goal. But as life would have it, those plans did not materialize.In 2014, while listening to a CD set on Sanskrit mantras, I came across the story of Vesak which commemorates Buddha's birth, enlightenment and death anniversary. According to this story, every year on full moon in May, Christ, Buddha and everyone who has worked on the upliftment of the world gather on an esoteric plane. There is a crystal bowl with a liquid in front of Christ who says a mantra. At the moment of the full moon, Buddha emanates a beautiful light and at this moment, everyone on the earth gets a quickening.  Everyone present then gets a drink of the water charged with the mantras and leaves. Global Peace event is a modified recreation of the above event. If we are to create lasting peace we will have to learn to look at each other's humanity. If peace has to become reality, we will have to learn to respect each other, come together, pray together, break bread together, share ideas, share joys, share tears, and uplift each other. Global Peace Event is a step in the direction of coming together for peace. It is a call to recognize our own and each other's  humanity. It is a call to come together, for all who care about peace. The EventThis is a high impact, high vibration event grounded in the knowledge that all action start at the level of thought and intentionsThis event is a commemoration of Buddha's birth, enlightenment and death. Vesak is celebrated by people all over the world. In this celebration we are inviting people from different walks of life, spiritual backgrounds and thought form. Our purpose is to have conversations about peace and how to make peace a priority in our own lives.This is a unique opportunity for you to listen to an exciting panel of speakers from different spiritual backgrounds as well as peace professionals and peace activists. These speakers will talk about peace in their paradigm and how to make peace a priority in your life. They will also help set intentions for peace and will bring peace prayers and mantras from their own spiritual background for us to repeat and chant.You will receive water charged and infused with these peace intentions and prayers. Speakers Dr. Sherrill HayesPeace ProfessionalDr. Sherrill Hayes Ph.D., Newcastle University; M.S. & B.S. University of North Carolina at Greensboro, is Associate Professor and Director of the Master of Science in Conflict Management at Kennesaw State University. Since 1999, Dr. Hayes has worked as a family and child custody mediator in the UK and US, designed and evaluated conflict resolution programs for governments and non-profits, delivered training to a wide array of businesses, non-profits, and professionals in the US, UK, Haiti, Ghana, and Germany, and served as a consultant to the Cox Family Enterprise Center. Dr. Hayes is a registered Neutral for Civil and Domestic Mediation with the Georgia Office of Dispute Resolution and his areas of teaching and research include: family, community, and organizational dispute resolution; designing and evaluating conflict management programs and policies; sports as a peace building tool; and refugee resettlement.Imani EvansEmpowerment CoachImani Evans is a counselor and life coach who believes in authenticity as the gateway to unshakeable joy. She has been in the personal empowerment industry for more than 23 years serving as an advocate and change agent in organizations throughout Atlanta, New Jersey and New York. She is the founder of Women Healing Women a 501C3 non-profit organization that offers supportive services to long-term survivors of sexual and domestic violence. Imani believes that 'violence is an experience, not an identity and that the eradication of violence is reliant on our commitment to raise the vibration of love and peace without discrimination.Evans holds a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology, a Masters degree in Counseling Psychology and is currently pursuing a doctorate in Counseling Education & Supervision. She is the author of Today is The Miracle and is scheduled to release her upcoming book, Unveiling the I Am in June 2015. Imani is a performance artist and healer combining her gifts to guide herself and others toward inner harmony, increased authenticity and personal evolution.Dr. Noor V. Gillani D. Sc.Peace Activist & EducatorDr. Gillani retired as Principal Research Scientist at NASA-AL National Space Science & Technology Center and Professor of Atmospheric Science at University of Alabama in Huntsville after 15 years of service (1995-2010). Prior to that, he was Professor of Mechanical Engineering at Washington University in St. Louis (WUSTL, 1974-92) and of Atmospheric Science at NC State University (1993-95). During his academic career, he also spent sabbatical periods at DOE’s Brookhaven National Lab, EPA’s National Environmental Research Lab, and TVA’s Environmental Research Center. His research focus throughout his academic career was on Air Quality. From 1984 to 1992, he served as US Delegate to NATO’s Commission for the Challenges of Modern Society. He has also served on the Science Committees of several major US environmental measurement and analysis programs. President/Exec. Director, The PYAR FoundationExec. VP for Programs, International Association of Educators for World Peace (IAEWP)(Ret) Principal Research Scientist, NASA-AL National Space Science & Technology Center(Ret) Professor, Atmospheric Science Dep., U. of AL Huntsville(Formerly) Professor of Mechanical Engineering, Washington University in St. LouisDr. Gillani is a devout Muslim of Indian ethnic origin and was born and raised in Tanzania, then completed high school (GCE A’Level) in England, and proceeded to the USA for his higher education, first at Harvard (AB cum laude, 1967) and then at WUSTL (DSc, 1974).Currently in retirement, Dr. Gillani is Founder/President of The PYAR Foundation for children in distress around the world, VP of the UN-affiliated International Association of Educators for World Peace, and is also active in interfaith and social justice causes. He is also involved in the creation of the new Institute of Global Harmony in India, where he expects to join the Administration soon. He is grieved by the gross misinformation of Americans about Islam, and works passionately to counter Islamophobia through education.  He has also developed a model of Islamic Humanism (individual human development to the fullest potential based on the Quranic concept of human being), which serves as the basis for his own life, with a focus on cultivation of spirituality and love for God,and service to all beings in God’s creation, especially those in need.Johnnie B. Porter, M.A; M.Div. (Ph.D. Candidate)PastorJohnnie Porter is the husband of Robyn J. Porter a high school math educator, and is the father of a ten year old son, and two daughters ages seven and four. He currently lives in West GA in city of Villa Rica, and is a native of East Texas by way of Tyler Texas.  He has lived and served the metro Atlanta community since 1999. He is the Senior and founding pastor of the New Bethesda Christian Ministries Life Church in Villa Rica, Ga. www.Newbcm.com  He is a 2003 graduate of the Charles H. Mason Theological Seminary at the ITC Atlanta, GA  Pastor Porter has worked extensively with interdenominational and political organizations in the greater Atlanta metropolitan area in regards to questions about social welfare, politics, the black family, and improving the plight of African- American males. He is a community organizer and is the founder of The C.A.L.E.B. Group of West GA (Congregations Advocating For Leadership and Betterment) which focuses on Rural community collaboration as it relates to social justice and faith. Johnnie is also a social entrepreneur and licensed insurance broker, but has spend the last 16 years of his life serving the community as a Clinically trained Hospice Chaplain and Bereavement Care Coordinator.  He is currently working on a Ph.D. in Marriage and Family Therapy with a concentration in General Family Therapy, at North Central University.Dwight Harriman
Shaman
Dwight Harriman is anointed shaman, He has for many years deepened his relationship with Spirit through a melding of paths.  Called by visions as a child, Dwight’s early mystical leanings ripened through long-time 12 Step study, religion, the study of anthropology and through shamanic practice.  Part Cherokee, Dwight earned a degree in anthropology with honors from Georgia State University and has studied for years under different shamans.  He was anointed in 2008 as a shaman and mesa carrier from the International School of Shamanism.  Dwight has led many healing ceremonies, rituals of all types and shamanic journeys.
Penelope Summers
Peace Witch
Penelope Summers holds a B.A. from Lycoming College in  English, an  M.A.  in Writing from the University of Colorado at Boulder and a dual M.A in Peace and Conflict Studies and International Administration and Conflict Management from the University of North Carolina at Greensboro and the University of Konstanz in Germany, respectively.  She is a massage therapist, herbalist and a student of spirituality.  Her work path has been eclectic and she currently works in human resources, teaches, works as an intuitive and is writing a book that joins the practices of peace and witchcraft.Shahina Lakhani MSNSoul Coach Peace ActivistShahina is a Peace Activist, Soul coach, speaker and author. She has a Masters degree in nursing. She is a Master practitioner of Neurolinguistic programming, Certified Theta Healing Practitioner and Certified Angelic Life Coach. Shahina is also trained in Kenisiology, Emotion Code and Silva Method. She is attuned to Karuna Reiki I & II.Shahina is an intuitive, psychic, medium and has the honor of channeling various angels and ascended masters including Indian gods and goddesses. She connects with the innate wisdom of these sacred beings to help people move forward on their life’s path.She is passionate about helping you connect to the power house of your soul. She  helps people create inner alignment, empowerment, self love, and inner peace. Her ultimate passion is World Peace which she believes can only be achieved by first cultivating inner peace and inner alignment. This helps you to live in the world from a place of being enough, being powerful, from inner compassion, and self love.How we will use the fundsThe funds collected will be used to pay for the above event, marketing, refreshments and any other incidentals. To plan for future eventsThe speakers are donating their precious time.We are also considering a part time employee and creating a corporation.
This is a labor of love, donations are crucial to help us keep doing this event and add new events for world peace and  personal empowerment of all who need our help.THANK YOU for your generosity and for being a Partner In Peace

story:
Short Summary

Hadrian Series: Our Vision…

Our vision is to create spaces for families and communities to learn, explore and play together. Our desire is to contribute in the cultivation of a mindful life, one that allows human beings to nurture focus and attention, and make choices with an open mind, open heart and open will.

Hadrian Series has come to being as a way to respond to this intention, by offering parents, coaches and educators a new narrative to support children in their growth developmentally. This is a two-way path. While the intention is to support the child, through the conversation (from Latin: con-versare- means to turn to one another), we create our dance of language that brings both the adult and the child together into a discovery, a new narrative that they co-create in partnership.

Hadrian Series starts its journey with Baby Light, a book that celebrates light and life, through a curious and sparkling inquiry. Baby Light will be soon followed by a few other books, which have already emerged and are in the creative process. 

We intend to create a bouquet of resources, especially in the space of children literature and playful learning, and we would like to facilitate and host a space for others who feel compelled to contribute and work with us to fulfill this vision.

Hadrian Series is a calling to all of us as “human becomings” to bring forth the goodness and the beauty of the world at any given moment. If you feel compelled to co-create with us and/or to support this emergence forward, we welcome a conversation.

WHY THIS BOOK? -A personal story of growth

When my son Hadrian came to the world I experienced a major shift, one of those overnight root expansions, like at the“Jack and the Magic Beans”...My heart grew bigger and my capacity to be with others expanded. How do you manage all that? I stayed with it and with all the support from family and friends I was able to navigate the newness and actually tap into the evergreen source that it was bringing forth for me. One day at a time, I was able to accept that life had slowed down and that I was living in a different rhythm; one that required another kind of care and lots of patience. I remember how I started noticing in my neighborhood the gorgeous trees, the birds that visited and all the kind people all around us. Walking with Hadrian allowed me to see all that. I could whiteness the beauty and the goodness right in front of me. It was all there to be celebrated. 

One day, when my son Hadrian was about 1(one) and he had just started to walk, I was sitting in the living room reading, when I witnessed something extraordinary. I saw what I could have easily seen before, only that now I was “SEEING” with a new pair of eyes. I was seeing, sensing and embodying it. The sunlight had fallen inside the room and the string of light was creating quite an excitement for Hadrian, who seemed curious and playfully exploring. I saw him poking and turning around, and then going back and forth as the light appeared and disappeared in his presence. Oh, it was magical! Inside me, it felt like a stiff “Grinch” was melting down and all of a sudden I was like a child. I wanted to play and delve in wonder!  It was this story that inspired the creation of Baby Light, a children’s book for the family, one that inspires an open mind, an open heart and an open will. It's a way to go deeper with how beauty affects us right NOW, supporting children’s growth through the art of beauty and mindfulness.

As the experience was landing, I felt the desire to support Hadrian in exploring what had happened at a deeper level, in simple ways. When we grow we somehow lose that sense of play and wonder, it almost feels like we cut fun once we get into the real work. I felt the need to offer my son another way of looking at life and the daily experience where we whiteness, observe, engage and breathe. I became so compelled at creating a new narrative to support his growth, one that allows him to explore and find beauty in everything. He can search for his own answers and yet have the guidance that offers him possibilities. I wanted to invite him into a new language through embodiment and inquiry, one that can open up choices from a place of care and alignment. 

I am compelled to see this little story be a dialogue builder, a new way of creating a space for children and parents, for families, to celebrate splendor and goodness everyday. It is an invitation for parents, coaches and educators and anyone who has the desire and passion to create spaces for families to come together, to learn and explore. It is my desire to support human beings develop emotional, cognitive, relational, somatic and spiritual competence, to serve as a foundation for growth and development and to live life to its fullest.


Our Goal 

Our Goal is to have this book published and go live on July 30th, 2016. We would like to first get it published as a paperback and next as an e-book and share this story with as many parents, children, coaches and educators to support meaningful conversations.

With the help and care of my talented husband Gianfranco, who has done incredible work to create the illustrations, and so many other family members and friends this book is almost done and ready for self-publishing. With your engagement and contribution we can make it happen!

The investment

All funds received up to and including the goal amount of $12,000 will be used on Baby Light printing costs for the first 1000 books and as a start-up costs for the 2 other books that we have on the works. As a startup project the set up and printing costs are by far the biggest expense for Hadrian Series (including design, production, set up, etc). The book will be sold online primarily via Amazon and through select bookstores. 

How may you join?

We would love to have you become a part of our journey. Your contribution will be an important foundation to bring the first step to completion. There are different ways you may choose to join in and of course we are always open to new ideas.

We are an amazing team and we will put to the service of this venture our talents and skills to make it happen( you will see some of these in the list of choices/perks)

The book would be in your hands by the 30th of July 2016.

What we see as possibilities? What would it look like?

Once the book is released on July 2016, we plan some of the following activities:

  1. Conversations in Pre-Schools and Pre-Ks in the Washington Metropolitan Area and Tirana, Albania and or, anywhere we can find friends and colleagues who may arrange a visit
  2. Small café conversations with parents, coaches and educators
  3. Talks and presentations at coaching and educators’ conferences
  4. Workshops, for parents, coaches and educators, that:

  • Help to facilitate the reflection on the question” How to I bring my beauty and goodness forth, NOW?
  • Focus on creating mindful choices to design the life that you want
  • Create new narratives for conversations in the family, workplace and life
  • Help build clarity and focus through creative inquiry and discovery
  • Support transitions in life and allow you to navigate newness
 5. Sharing the work with anyone who shows up and is curious to explore and co-  create (like YOU, your ideas and thoughts are welcome)

Moving Forward:

  • Year 2016: Publish 3 books + virtual community conversations circle  (a space for families to have conversations)
  • Year 2017: Publish 6 books + community conversations circle expanded + complementary resources to support learning through play
  • Year 2018: Publish 12 books + help 3 other authors with their vision+ community conversations circle + an exhibition to celebrate beauty + complementary resources to support learning through play

Other Ways You Can Help

Your support and help in spreading the word are truly appreciated. Tell everyone you know about Baby Light and this campaign so we can reach as many children as possible.

Become a "Baby Light Host" by inviting a few friends and family to your home, your book club, organization where we can have a small conversation about the Book and activities for both children and adults.  

Also, if you have any ideas and thoughts on how to share the work beyond the Book, we would love your insights.

story:
|||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||

 

FAQ


Q: What is EVE?
A: EVE is an evolution of UNL, basically it is UNL 2.0. Legacy UNL is 1.0.

 

Q: What happens to UNL?
A: UNL 1.0 development discontinued and all the power thrown to develop and improve EVE-NG / UNL 2.0.

 

Q: I have latest UNL v12 now, what should I do to have EVE?
A: Once EVE alpha and other versions released we'll provide a way to upgrade your current setup to EVE or you can install a fresh ova with EVE, both ways are good.

 

Q: I have tons of labs on UNL, what will happen after upgrading to EVE?
A: All UNL labs will be fully compatible with EVE. You can upgrade your UNL and continue using your labs or export labs from UNL, install fresh EVE and import labs to it.

 

Q: What are the sites and other community contacts for EVE?
A: EVE is going to use same sites as UNL before
    site - http://www.unetlab.com
    forum - http://forum.802101.com/forum39.html (eventually will be transferred    to unetlab.com)
    twitter - https://twitter.com/unetlab
    youtube - https://www.youtube.com/c/UnifiedNetworkingLab

 

Q: Are there going to be hosted solution for EVE?
A: Yes, we are planning to have a hosted solution. EVE will help users build labs of any size and run full replicas of their production networks, which is ideal for pre-deployment testing of network changes. There still will be a free VM-based appliance, similar to the current distribution     model of UnetLab, however the cloud offering will have some form of subscription-based fees.

 

Q: Why EVE-NG, why not continue under UNL/UnetLab name?
A: We are continuing with unetlab name/brand, but as EVE-NG / Unified Networking LAB 2.0.
    EVE structure will be completely different from current UNL 1.0 in case of code and logic, but it uses UNL 1.0 as base for everything

|||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||

 

Key Features:

The objectives are:

 

  • No network size limit (multi clustering on different hosts)
  • Sharing of design (option to share labs, configs online with friend or others)
  • UNetLab Labs backwards compatibility 
  • Ability to quick transpose real network to virtalization
  • Ability to provide a UI for teacher/student with chat box and console supervision/interaction (premium addon)
  • General UI reword and improvements (to be able to make 99% of things from UI, CLI will remain of course for advanced users)
  • Clientless - telnet,rdp,vnc,wireshark over html5
  • Import/export configs from/to local PC
  • Multi Configuration per Lab
  • Import gns3 and virl Labs
  • Simultaneous connection of multiple users to the same Lab
  • And much, much more

We are going to release an alpha and beta versions to the public for free (doesn't matter what perk you got), so anyone who'd like to participate in testing is always welcome.

There will be a site with all the road map and features we are going to work on, howto's, forum, blog posts and more cool stuff for collaboration and labs sharing

 

 

Our Goals:

We want to build a product and features based on your requests and complaints gather during working with UnetLab/UNL.

We are going to develop emulation platform which will be ready for any academic/learning  and POC scenarios. All power will be thrown in making a one of a kind platform for everyone that will (hopefully) combine packet-tracer, gns3, virl in terms of from beginner to advanced and pro user that want to learn networking, network automation, SDN and other techs.  

 

 

 

 

Choosen Technologies (might change during the work):

- Linux Ubuntu Server LTS

- Openstack - Libvirt - KVM - ( +  ability to link to multiple hypervisor)

 - Guacamole

- Apache 

- Php

- Mysql

- AdminLTE (for the UI)

 

 

 

Use of Funds:

All the funding we'll rise will go into development of the new platform. In case we'll have an extra money, they will be spent for hiring more developers in order to speedup development and work on more features

 

  •  The main platform will remain open source and FREE
  •  We are going to develop premium addons, that will be added on top of the free version

 

 

Info about premium addons:

One might be afraid that EVE will be not be for free for personal use anymore with an addition of the premium addons - that is not correct.
A person who'd like to learn/evolve his skills will continue using EVE completely FREE.
Premium addons will be designed mainly for Learning centers/companies and bigger enterprises with specific business needs.
Some premium addons will be designed and added in advance by EVE team and some will be designed and added per request.

 

 

Planing:

 

pre-Alpha - End of November 2016

Alpha - January 2017

Beta - March/April 2017

Future plans:

We will offer a ready to use on demand solution ( size , individual /  multi-user  platform )

Starting from User with 16 VCPU and 80G Ram  for a day  to specific need with price available from online calculator ( concurrent users / network size / time length )    

                         

 

 

Other ways you can help us:

If you don't want or can't contribute, that is absolutely fine and we respect your choice, instead you can help us spread the word and share this via social sites (facebook, linkedin etc) individually or by means of Indiegogo share tools.
story_txt:
||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||| FAQQ: What is EVE?A: EVE is an evolution of UNL, basically it is UNL 2.0. Legacy UNL is 1.0. Q: What happens to UNL?A: UNL 1.0 development discontinued and all the power thrown to develop and improve EVE-NG / UNL 2.0. Q: I have latest UNL v12 now, what should I do to have EVE?A: Once EVE alpha and other versions released we'll provide a way to upgrade your current setup to EVE or you can install a fresh ova with EVE, both ways are good. Q: I have tons of labs on UNL, what will happen after upgrading to EVE?A: All UNL labs will be fully compatible with EVE. You can upgrade your UNL and continue using your labs or export labs from UNL, install fresh EVE and import labs to it. Q: What are the sites and other community contacts for EVE?A: EVE is going to use same sites as UNL before    site - http://www.unetlab.com    forum - http://forum.802101.com/forum39.html (eventually will be transferred    to unetlab.com)    twitter - https://twitter.com/unetlab    youtube - https://www.youtube.com/c/UnifiedNetworkingLab Q: Are there going to be hosted solution for EVE?A: Yes, we are planning to have a hosted solution. EVE will help users build labs of any size and run full replicas of their production networks, which is ideal for pre-deployment testing of network changes. There still will be a free VM-based appliance, similar to the current distribution     model of UnetLab, however the cloud offering will have some form of subscription-based fees. Q: Why EVE-NG, why not continue under UNL/UnetLab name?A: We are continuing with unetlab name/brand, but as EVE-NG / Unified Networking LAB 2.0.    EVE structure will be completely different from current UNL 1.0 in case of code and logic, but it uses UNL 1.0 as base for everything||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||| Key Features:The objectives are: 
No network size limit (multi clustering on different hosts)
Sharing of design (option to share labs, configs online with friend or others)
UNetLab Labs backwards compatibility 
Ability to quick transpose real network to virtalization
Ability to provide a UI for teacher/student with chat box and console supervision/interaction (premium addon)
General UI reword and improvements (to be able to make 99% of things from UI, CLI will remain of course for advanced users)
Clientless - telnet,rdp,vnc,wireshark over html5
Import/export configs from/to local PC
Multi Configuration per Lab
Import gns3 and virl Labs
Simultaneous connection of multiple users to the same Lab
And much, much more
We are going to release an alpha and beta versions to the public for free (doesn't matter what perk you got), so anyone who'd like to participate in testing is always welcome.There will be a site with all the road map and features we are going to work on, howto's, forum, blog posts and more cool stuff for collaboration and labs sharing  Our Goals:We want to build a product and features based on your requests and complaints gather during working with UnetLab/UNL.We are going to develop emulation platform which will be ready for any academic/learning  and POC scenarios. All power will be thrown in making a one of a kind platform for everyone that will (hopefully) combine packet-tracer, gns3, virl in terms of from beginner to advanced and pro user that want to learn networking, network automation, SDN and other techs.      Choosen Technologies (might change during the work):- Linux Ubuntu Server LTS- Openstack - Libvirt - KVM - ( +  ability to link to multiple hypervisor) - Guacamole- Apache - Php- Mysql- AdminLTE (for the UI)   
Use of Funds:
All the funding we'll rise will go into development of the new platform. In case we'll have an extra money, they will be spent for hiring more developers in order to speedup development and work on more features
 


 The main platform will remain open source and FREE


 We are going to develop premium addons, that will be added on top of the free version

story:
Besides a proud babywearing mother of 3, I am a trained babywearing consultant  with a background in Information Sciences.  After seeing the same questions being asked on Facebook groups over and over again, I thought it was time for an app!

With the Up & Close app I aim to bring together information which is spread throughout the World Wide Web, in order for you to have it at hand at all times. Hopefully it will help increase knowledge on ergonomic babywearing.

The app offers a lot of information on babywearing, the do’s and don’ts, wrap sizes, etcetera. It also contains an extensive search engine with over 70 carries for front, hip and back carrying. You can easily find video tutorials for each carry and keep preferred carries in your personal list of favorites.

The app is free and I like to keep it that way, therefore I need your help. The iPhone version was created from my own funds, but I don’t have sufficient budget to further develop it and create an Android version. If we would all contribute with a small donation, we can do it together!

The iPhone app can be downloaded here (currently only for iPhone).

The release of the iPhone version triggered a lot of enthusiasm and great feedback. The app can improve with further development!

·  To all babywearers on Android: please join in and make it possible to develop an app for you too! Including all the information, the search engine, the favorites list, etc.

·  To all babywearers on iPhone: please show that we are a community and pitch in to help create the Android version :-)! So much appreciated!

·  To all babywearers interested, on both iPhone and Android: it’s great to see that the app meets a need. In order to keep the app going, keep it in the app stores and enjoy updated versions with improved and potential new functionality: please join in! Thank you all!

Estimated amounts:

€ 500,- for further improvements of the iPhone app.

€ 1500,- for the development of Android app

€ 400,- for maintenance, bugfixes, adjusts due to platform changes, etc.

€ 350,- to cover app store fees for a the coming 3 years and be able to keep the app in both the Apple and Google app store.

Total: € 2750,-

If the amount is not entirely reached, all funds gathered with this campaign will be used for, first of all, the development of an Android app. Let’s hope we’ll have at least enough to create a very basic version.

In case you are not able to help in a financial way, please help by spreading the word about this campaign. Share on social media and use the Indiegogo share tools! 

Thank you!

Best regards, Sabine
