story:
Short Summary

I have worked in the agricultural field for more than 20 years in South Korea and New Zealand as a Veterinarian/Farm Consultant.

I have always dreamed of helping out and feeding poor, undernourished, hungry people of the third world countries. Due to global warming and the natural disasters that will become more and more prevalent, worldwide food crisis is bound to happen sooner or later.  This is why educating and providing farming skills to the people of the third world countries is so crucial and quite urgent.

There are many senior retirees in the U.S who are ready and willing to devote their lives in helping the poor, but don't know where or how to. This is why I am planning on running the Agricultural Mission Center to train/educate missionary volunteers all about farming. Several pastors I've met are already supportive of my plan and have asked me for some tips on farming broiler chickens, hens, pigs, and goats.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm currently in the process of negotiating with an investor to purchase a small area of land in Long Island, NY, so he can provide free leasing for the Agricultural Mission Center(AM Center).

<Setting up the AM Center>

1) Building a mobile home including power, natural gas, water/sewer connect

2) Start farming e.g- goats, broiler chickens, hens, pigs, vegetables, etc.

3) Network with churches to recruit retirees who are willing to help and learn about farming.

<Next Steps>

1) At the AM Center, a prayer ministry called the House of Prayer(HOP) will be set up specifically for the purpose of praying for this world mission. We strongly encourage pastors to join AM Center with their church volunteers to help lead the members spiritually through prayers and guidance.

2) After the completion of the AM Center and HOP, the center will be open for seniors to live, learn, work and have fellowship. 

The Impact

In 2050, the world population will grow up to 9 billion, and food necessity will be doubled compared to current food consumption. If the third world countries don't start preparing for food shortage right this moment, the mass exodus/emigration will put the entire world in chaos.

By training volunteer retirees on farming, they will be able to go overseas and provide assistance to the third world countries through educating them on producing their own food and to self sustain. 

Risks & Challenges

Main risks are 1) failure of land leasing, 2) not recruiting enough volunteers.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute financially, please help by spreading this campaign to your family and friends.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ricky Perez, and I'm here to share my dream, a dream that maybe one day, my country of El Salvador will be relieved of some of the crime and gang violence they face everyday. Even though it may seem like a long shot considering the adversity, I am hopeful this dream will manifest and make the change. The dream consists of a  fairly simple solution, to get my people on the right track by means of a soccer ball. Soccer (Futbol) is the sport that Salvadorians exude passion for through their pores, any child would dream of being able to play on the street, let alone, in a league. But, like most underprivileged kids, dreams as such are too farfetched, and sadly most won't have the luxury to play with a proper soccer ball. If we could introduce soccer balls to poverty stricken areas maybe we can curve and inspire kids not to turn to gangs and violence. If we can touch and inspire one child then we have already won, and that alone will make this dream a reality.



What We Need & What You Get

The idea is to raise $10k in order to purchase about 500 to 800 soccer balls along with other equipment needed. The equipment and balls will then be donated to youths in the most poverty stricken areas of El Salvador, with the help of fesaelsalvador.org. Twenty percent of the proceeds will go into producing a video documenting this experience thus creating a wider range of awareness for our ongoing battle against violence. Along in this Journey we will collaborate with a few different Salvadorian Soccer Players and artist to create some cool perks for those who donate. We will be adding limited edition merchandise that you can get in return for you donations.



The Impact

Hope360 El Salvador is a very ambitious project driven by the passion of futbol. It is a passion that my El Salvadorian people live and breathe. We want to use this passion for futbol as leverage to fight violence and steer the youth in the right direction. Your are contributing to the social change and safety of a nation with a soccer ball.

Risks & Challenges

The only risks and challenges we face is not meeting our budget goals. We are determined to reach and fulfill our dream by any means necessary. We want to create change in El Salvador.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please Help us by reposting our links and following us on social media
INSTAGRAM @HOPE360ES
TWITTER @HOPE360ES
www.facebook.com/hope360es

story:
Legendary basketball coach and educator Ted Gustus, Jr. has worked in some of the most challenging schools in communities in New York City for over 40 years.   Gustus is also an author, life coach, entrepreneur, motivational speaker, community activist, and a proud husband and father. He has written a new book entitled, “One Breath”. His new book includes inspiring stories of a Coach’s successful quest to breathe life into his lifeless community with a "12 Step Game Plan". Despite having to overcome his own personal obstacles and tragedies in life, he has successfully transformed "boyz n da hood" into responsible men in the neighborhood by applying his 12 Step Game Plan and infusing it with sports and music. This "12 Step Game Plan" is explained and described in detail in his new book.

Inspired by his "One Breath" 12 Step Game Plan, he has created The M.A.N. (Manhood Academy Network) "One Breath" Leadership Academy. The M.A.N. "One Breath" Leadership Academy is a 6-12 week workshop for boys and young men that are captains and co-captains of basketball teams to develop and address their leadership and communication skills as well as their behavior patterns. By donating $120, an athlete can attend The M.A.N. "One Breath" Leadership Academy and is provided the necessary skills to be productive leaders on their basketball team, school, community and in society. 

The magnitude of your contribution is enormous and greatly needed for this initiative. Simply put, "America's Hoodz" are in desperate need of your help. They are broken and need to be fixed. The by - product of this broken "American Hood" is evident. "My Brother's Keeper" ,  the recent initiative started by the President of United States Barack Obama, addresses the challenges of Black boys and young men in America's Hoodz. Black men coming from America's Hoodz are number one in every conceivable and alarming epidemic, including high school drop-outs, homicide, HIV & AIDS, incarceration, illiteracy, etc.  

The behaviors exhibited in these pictures are simply young men calling out for help! With your help and donations, you will breathe life into these lifeless young men and afford them an opportunity to attend The M.A.N. "One Breath" Leadership Academy. For over 40 years, "Coach" Gustus and his Making A Difference T.E.A.M. (Together Everyone Achieves Miracles) have used their ONE BREATH to Breathe Life into literally thousands of boys and young men in "hoodz" across the country.


What We Need & What You Get

With your donation, we can enroll our goal of 100 boys into the The M.A.N. "One Breath" Leadership Academy. Each scholarship tuition is $120

  • Session Outcomes:  By the end of these sessions, participants will be able to 

utilize sports and music to help transform “boyz n da hoodz” into responsible men in the Neighborhood and Community. These responsible men will recognize the power of utilizing their “One Breath” to breathe into a “lifeless” community. They will also use the “One Breath" 12 Step Game Plan to modify destructive social and emotional behaviors into healthy behavioral habits.

  • How Much Funding Do We Need?

The M.A.N. (Manhood Academy Network) "One Breath" Leadership Academy will induct 100 captains and co-captians of boys' basketball teams in New York City. After 12 weeks each boy will be inducted into The M.A.N. Society where they will receive ongoing (life-long) mentoring and coaching. In addition, these young men are required to complete the last step which is service. They are responsible for recruiting another captain to attend The M.A.N. "One Breath" Leadership Academy. This process is done continuously. The initiative will be conducted in the following areas: NY, NJ, PA, DC, ATL, and LA (Los Angeles). The first round of funding is for 100 captains in NY. Additional funds raised over the initial $12,000 will go towards the tuition of newly recruited captains in other cities. 

  • The Impact

"Coach" Gustus has a 40-year successful track record of transforming the lives of "boyz n da hood". He has been recognized by President Barack Obama for his outstanding life time achievements. He has traveled across the country mentoring student athletes and working with street gangs from NYC to Los Angeles. He has a proven track record for successfully "changing" the mindset and frame of mind which led to improving the quality of life for boys and girls living in "da hood". 


  • Testimonials

What have I learned from Coach Gustus’ workshops?

By: Stacey

Student

“Since I entered the class in January I have transformed tremendously. The one lesson that I strongly believed changed me was the law of attraction, which was one of the first things I learned. It made me think positive at all times, for example walking up to someone and saying “great morning.” In this class I learn to deal with drama and death. And to never let any of that touch my heart and continue to live life.  I have even learned how to create an LLC… how to create my own company.  I can truly say when I entered this class I was a seed which grew and will continue to grow."


By: Marco

H.S. Student

“There is no doubt that Coach Gustus’ Life Skills class should be expanded.   This class helps us as students to see where we are right now in school.  By being in this class it made us realize that we have to change.  Some of us may not like that but one of Gustus’ principles teaches us that when change is necessary, not to change can be destructive.  This is what we the students are trying to live by. 

We need this class very badly because some of us need a person like Coach Gustus in our lives (a father figure).   He directs us on the path we should go on and reminds us not to get distracted by our friends in the hallways when it’s time to go to class.  It is not always easy to put what he teaches into play, because it’s a process and we have to practice it.   I have some fellow seniors who do not have this class, but come into the class to sit in, because they want to hear some of Coach’s wisdom and knowledge.  What I see in Coach Gustus I rarely see in other men.  For that, others should experience being in this class for themselves.”

  • Risks & Challenges

Each year athletic teams across the country get ready to compete in their annual season. Days and hours are dedicated to practicing and getting prepared to have a successful season. As the coaches prepare to lead the team from the bench, a captain of the team is usually selected by the team and the Coach. This athlete is expected to lead the team going to and from games, while in school, and when the team goes on the road for competition. This Captain has encompassed the enormous task of leading 12-15 of his peers. In addition, he has to become the liaison between the coaching staff and his team mates. This is an awesome task and responsibility bestowed on these young men. It is an incredibly difficult task for “boyz n da hood” to manage. As a result of the conditions placed in "America’s Hoodz", these captains are confronted with enormous negative challenges. The M.A.N. “One Breath” Leadership Academy addresses these challenges by teaching, coaching and preparing the captains on how to successfully navigate and function as a leader within "da hood". 


  • Other Ways You Can Help

TAKE the “One Breath, Breathe Life” Pledge Challenge!

Read all directions before you begin the pledge!

  • Video Recording Directions:

  1. After choosing from the list below the pledge, take a green balloon then take ONE deep breath and blow into the balloon. Keep the balloon inflated (do not tie it) and then state your pledge.
  2. As you challenge another person or organization, slowly let the air out of your balloon demonstrating how you're breathing “Life” into your community. Then say, “One Breath,... Breathe Life"!
  3. Stand Together by passing on our Mantra “One Breath, Breathe Life” to show others your solidarity.
  4. Go to: www.onebreathtour.com/thepledge to learn more and use some of  these hashtags to connect with others that are involved #onebreathpledge, #onebreathbook, #onebreathtour, #communitycpr, #CoachGustus to learn more. Post this pledge video and to your Facebook, Instagram and/or Twitter page.

 (We challenge you to take the “ONE BREATH” Pledge….)

Pledge:

My name is ____________. As I look around at (“America’s Hoodz”), I see that it is time for us to STAND TOGETHER and take “One Breath” to “Breathe Life” into it. I am pledging to take the “One Breath, Breathe Life” Challenge by blowing my one breath into this balloon and breathe life into my community by (Choose one or more):

  1. Donating $25 and receiving an autographed copy of the “One Breath: A 12 Step Game Plan” book. ($10 of this will go towards The M.A.N. "One Breath" Leadership Academy).
  2. Hosting a private "One Breath" book-signing party
  3. Hosting a "One Breath BookTour" for my school or organization
  4. Making a direct  donation of $___________to The M.A.N. "One Breath" Leadership Academy”                                                                                                          
      1. I now challenge ______________________to take the “One Breath.... Breathe Life” Pledge Challenge to Breath life into a lifeless community.
    6.
story_txt:
Legendary basketball coach and educator Ted Gustus, Jr. has worked in some of the most challenging schools in communities in New York City for over 40 years.   Gustus is also an author, life coach, entrepreneur, motivational speaker, community activist, and a proud husband and father. He has written a new book entitled, “One Breath”. His new book includes inspiring stories of a Coach’s successful quest to breathe life into his lifeless community with a "12 Step Game Plan". Despite having to overcome his own personal obstacles and tragedies in life, he has successfully transformed "boyz n da hood" into responsible men in the neighborhood by applying his 12 Step Game Plan and infusing it with sports and music. This "12 Step Game Plan" is explained and described in detail in his new book.

Inspired by his "One Breath" 12 Step Game Plan, he has created The M.A.N. (Manhood Academy Network) "One Breath" Leadership Academy. The M.A.N. "One Breath" Leadership Academy is a 6-12 week workshop for boys and young men that are captains and co-captains of basketball teams to develop and address their leadership and communication skills as well as their behavior patterns. By donating $120, an athlete can attend The M.A.N. "One Breath" Leadership Academy and is provided the necessary skills to be productive leaders on their basketball team, school, community and in society. 
The magnitude of your contribution is enormous and greatly needed for this initiative. Simply put, "America's Hoodz" are in desperate need of your help. They are broken and need to be fixed. The by - product of this broken "American Hood" is evident. "My Brother's Keeper" ,  the recent initiative started by the President of United States Barack Obama, addresses the challenges of Black boys and young men in America's Hoodz. Black men coming from America's Hoodz are number one in every conceivable and alarming epidemic, including high school drop-outs, homicide, HIV & AIDS, incarceration, illiteracy, etc.  

The behaviors exhibited in these pictures are simply young men calling out for help! With your help and donations, you will breathe life into these lifeless young men and afford them an opportunity to attend The M.A.N. "One Breath" Leadership Academy. For over 40 years, "Coach" Gustus and his Making A Difference T.E.A.M. (Together Everyone Achieves Miracles) have used their ONE BREATH to Breathe Life into literally thousands of boys and young men in "hoodz" across the country.



 What We Need & What You Get

With your donation, we can enroll our goal of 100 boys into the The M.A.N. "One Breath" Leadership Academy. Each scholarship tuition is $120



Session Outcomes:  By the end of these sessions, participants will be able to 

utilize
sports and music to help transform “boyz n da hoodz” into responsible men in the Neighborhood and Community. These responsible men will recognize the power of utilizing their “One Breath” to breathe into a “lifeless”
community. They will also use the “One Breath" 12 Step Game Plan to modify destructive social and emotional behaviors into healthy behavioral habits.
 

How Much Funding Do We Need?

The M.A.N. (Manhood Academy Network) "One Breath" Leadership Academy will induct 100 captains and co-captians of boys' basketball teams in New York City. After 12 weeks each boy will be inducted into The M.A.N. Society where they will receive ongoing (life-long) mentoring and coaching. In addition, these young men are required to complete the last step which is service. They are responsible for recruiting another captain to attend The M.A.N. "One Breath" Leadership Academy. This process is done continuously. The initiative will be conducted in the following areas: NY, NJ, PA, DC, ATL, and LA (Los Angeles). The first round of funding is for 100 captains in NY. Additional funds raised over the initial $12,000 will go towards the tuition of newly recruited captains in other cities. 
    
The Impact
 "Coach" Gustus has a 40-year successful track record of transforming the lives of "boyz n da hood". He has been recognized by President Barack Obama for his outstanding life time achievements. He has traveled across the country mentoring student athletes and working with street gangs from NYC to Los Angeles. He has a proven track record for successfully "changing" the mindset and frame of mind which led to improving the quality of life for boys and girls living in "da hood". 




Testimonials

What have I learned from Coach Gustus’ workshops?
By: Stacey
Student
“Since
I entered the class in January I have transformed tremendously. The
one lesson that I strongly believed changed me was the law of attraction, which
was one of the first things I learned. It made me think positive at all times, for example walking up to
someone and saying “great morning.” In
this class I learn to deal with drama and death. And to never let any of that touch my heart
and continue to live life.  I have even
learned how to create an LLC… how to create my own company.  I can truly say when I entered this class I
was a seed which grew and will continue to grow."


By: Marco

other men.  For that, others should

story:
Voluntary of Compassion

I am Stefa, a german "girl" that had the most peace- and playful childhood. Perfect conditions, never ending love and care. These days I spend and study at the Sri Bodhiraja Temple, a Buddhist monastery in Sri Lanka - I am thankfully pervaded by the supreme philosophy of life given by the Buddha. This temple as all directed charitable activities of the Sri Bodhiraja Foundation are initiated and cared under the great guidance of Dr. Ven. Omalpe Sobhita Thero, a Chief Monk that is definitely devoted to wakefulness - one of his (many) current projects touched me somehow specially - that I decided to get active after I visited a place the shows deepest despair and greatest hope in one. The utmost spectrum of human facets...


Visaka Home

started in 2014, shelters sexually abused and thereof pregnant girls(!) and their babies.  Actually VISAKA HOME caretakes 8 young not even adult woman, with their 5 newborn,  two among await giving birth those days. The inhabitants are mostly detected and send by local governance authority, they have been massively noticed and faced extreme cruel and inhuman familial conditions.

To recondition those young traumatized and violated mothers and to help them develop cordial  mother-child relationships as well as secure stability, faith and joy for their own future path requires an eclectic and elaborated psychosocial care. Medical supply, psychological counseling, scholar education and practical skill development, as well as parental education are provided. The common target is stated with the Buddha’s word "Atitam nanu socanti" – should they be able to forget their bitter and unpleasant past and face the future with faith and happiness, afar from fear, fright or distress.


1 year maintenance & security for these innocent girls.

The actual facility of VISAKA HOME has reached its limitations, be it capacity as well as material resources. On 8th of March, 2015, the Sri Bodhiraja Foundation is pleased to open new extension in order to accommodate and shelter 10 more victims of sexual crime. The expansion concept is a reaction to the direct demand of Sri Lankan Probation Department that the previous measures in VISAKA HOME has considered to be effective and satisfying.

The set up fund for initial basic launch could have been raised under cooperation of governmental contribution and the Sri Bodhiraja Foundation. The livingmaintenance costs are not ensured yet.

Daily running costs add up to 32 EUR / 38 USD.
That means annual running costs sum up to 11.680 EUR / 13.870 USD.

Wholesome support in any matter

Please consider contributing to this project, I visited them some days ago, and will do regularly. The individual storys of their fates mostly are too hard to realize. Somehow I am unwilling to accept reality, but we have to. Your 100% money will directly and totally go to this place - I invite you to consider the foundations website www.bodhirajafoundation.org to get a clear idea about integrity and trustworthiness. The monks and their documented many selfless works for the well being of others should be a good proof of credibility.

No risks but chance of real happiness

According to Buddhism, we reach to real happiness when we can help to others.
The experience of sharing, and giving (up) some of the own resources is a very strong action. Sure you know about that, because you are here :-)

Spread, share, multiply, promote, post, support.

Please contact your network, your rich uncle, your alone neighbour... Sharing is caring.  Giving is getting. That's all there is to it.

I thank you by heart! Be all well and happy!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Ciao!

This Campaign is now closed, but you can continue giving directly to our website at:

WWW.GENESISARTSCHOOL.COM

My name is Duane Forrest. I'm a singer and songwriter from Toronto, ON. I love music, dance, acting and visual arts.  I honestly can't imagine my life without them. Music has brought me all over Canada, the States, Europe and Central America. And it was in Honduras were it hit me that not all people and places embrace education in the arts. I met countless people old and young who had never had the chance to learn how to dance, play an instrument or mix colours on canvas. I couldn't shake the feeling of how terrible this was. What a shame it was. I did some research and found that this type of education was not a part of the system there and many other third world countries as reading and math take precedence. 

6 years ago I started a small charity called Genesis community of the arts. http://www.genesisartschool.com

We find local artists in Honduras and Guatemala with education and talent in the aforementioned areas of the arts and we provide them with the training and resources to enter schools,  after school programs and even orphanages and teach the arts! 

I know education in the arts can change a person, city and nation for the better. It can stir up creativity which can lead to new businesses and stir the economy. It can help someone's soul. It helped mine. I grew up in a rough neighbourhood in Toronto. I was able to stay off many negative paths and flourish due to painting in my living room,  or practicing drum patterns in the backyard. The arts taught me to dream and I want to give that power to youth everywhere. 

What We Need & What You Get

Until Now, I've funded over 75% of Genesis' budget from the proceeds of my music career - and this has given me so much joy - but I'm now reaching out to my community because the demand for art classes is greater than I can support on my own. We need at least $20,000 CAD to cover the costs of 5 part time teachers Genesis currently employs in Choloma,  Honduras, Copán Ruinas,  Honduras and Panajachel, Guatemala. It costs $5000 to cover the part time salary of each teacher for 10 months of classes,  teaching 16 hours a week with 4 hours of prep. We then need $5000 to cover the costs of replenishing art supplies,  repairing instruments and buying new guitars and keyboards for the growing need of the classes. We are looking for 2000 people to give at least $10! Please consider helping out this cause!

We have a bunch of really cool perks for those that can donate large amounts. I will also be adding new perks as the campaign goes along.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, we still could really use your help! Sharing this Campaign via Facebook, Twitter and Instagram can help us in huge ways! our goal is to have 2000 people give at least $10. The more people we reach with this campaign, the better.
Thank you for showing interest in this campaign. My dream is to see the Arts become a part of the education system in Central America. Help us see it through.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Nondumiso Mathenjwa, mining engineer graduated from University of Johannesburg and One Young World Ambassador. I would like to assist an orphaned ambitious girl Zinhle Sibanyoni from the mining town Middelburg in South Africa to further her studies at University level.

'Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world' Nelson Mandela

With your contributions we can make sure that Zinhle goes to school and equip herself to make a better future and for her family.

Zinhle will be greatly motivated as an orphan to receive support to study at University. In her own words she looks up to being the breadwinner for her family and prove that your destiny can be changed for the better despite the background. She would like to be a law advocate and social worker to stand up for the rights of the vulnerable in our society.

What We Need & What You Get

Zinhle will need accommodation fees, school fees, book fees which totals to about $8500 only for the first year.  She is conditionally accepted for a Social Science degree at North West to study in 2015, which takes four years. She is excited after she received her matric results on the 6th of January 2015, but stressing about her education future. She have not yet got a response from NFSAS (government bursary loan scheme), she could use  a contribution towards her registration which is on the 19th of January 2015. Details are below should you prefer to send your contribution directly to NorthWest University (sulezi@gmail.com).

When you contribute you will get a thank you letter via email written by Zinhle, $500 you will get a thank you handwritten letter by her, $1000 or more you will get an update every 3months on her studies with her results with her photos compiled by her and me.

The Impact

Your contributions will make sure that we direct Zinhle's future to a positive direction, which will help with poverty reduction in and around Zinhle's community.

Risks & Challenges

Peer pressure at university is reality of many institutions across the world, to mitigate the risk she will be mentored by myself and other professionals.  She will be guided through her studies for her to succeed with impressive results that will open doors for bursaries and other generous hearts to continue with her other years.

Other Ways You Can Help

I would really appreciate it, if you spread the word and share this link with everyone you know. Together we can make difference. For more information please contact me on nondum24@gmail.com or my team member Sulezi Mdodana on sulezi@gmail.com

weapon which you can use to change the world' Nelson Mandela
With your contributions we can make sure
that Zinhle goes to school and equip herself to make a better future and for
her family.
Zinhle will be greatly motivated as
an orphan to receive support to study at University. In her own words she looks
up to being the breadwinner for her family and prove that your destiny can be
changed for the better despite the background. She would like to be a law
advocate and social worker to stand up for the rights of the vulnerable in our
society.
What We Need & What You Get
Zinhle will need accommodation fees,
school fees, book fees which totals to about $8500 only for the first year.  She
is conditionally accepted for a Social Science degree at North West to study in
2015, which takes four years. She is excited after she received her matric results on the 6th of January 2015, but stressing about her education future. She have not yet got a response from NFSAS (government bursary loan scheme), she could use  a contribution towards her registration which is on the 19th of January 2015. Details are below should you prefer to send your contribution directly to NorthWest University (sulezi@gmail.com).
When you contribute you will get a
thank you letter via email written by Zinhle, $500 you will get a thank you
handwritten letter by her, $1000 or more you will get an update every 3months
on her studies with her results with her photos compiled by her and me.
The Impact
Your contributions will make sure
that we direct Zinhle's future to a positive direction, which will help with
poverty reduction in and around Zinhle's community.
Risks & Challenges
Peer pressure at university is reality of many institutions across the world, to mitigate the risk she will be mentored by myself and other professionals.  She will be guided through her studies for her to succeed with impressive results that will open doors for bursaries and other generous hearts to continue with her other years.
Other Ways You Can Help
I would really appreciate it, if you spread the word and
share this link with everyone you know. Together we can make difference. For
more information please contact me on nondum24@gmail.com or my team member
Sulezi Mdodana on sulezi@gmail.com

story:
About Us

We are Innis Snelling, Omer Zigdon and Ralph Tiemann.  While backpacking throughout Southeast Asia, we learned about funding issues at the non-governmental organization, KNGO Cambodia.  We are determined to help KNGO and are fundraising on behalf of its founder, Mr. Sun Saveth.

In Cambodia, one of the poorest countries in South East Asia, the government provides only four hours of state run education per day. With just the government education, children often lack basic reading, writing, and math skills. They also often show little responsibility for their actions and demonstrate poor communication skills and attitudes towards others. Many end up with little hope for decent employment and face a bleak future. Khmer New Generation Organization (KNGO) was created to change exactly that.

In Bospo Village, Cambodia, KNGO provides free supplimentary education for local impoverished children. This education, including essential English classes, gives the children many opportunities for a brighter future. Thanks to donations in the past, KNGO has been a successful organization. However, ongoing funding is needed to continue and expand the programs.


Goals

The primary goal is to raise money so that KNGO can continue to operate as it has in the past. As the school is run completely by donations by others, fundraisers like these help a great deal for the continuation of the school. Newly raised money will be used for teacher salaries and administration costs.

The secondary goal is to expand the school.  Currently, 450 children from six to twenty years old are receiving FREE education at KNGO.  However, there are still 550 more children hoping to get access to the free education.  If this goal is reached, it will help build new classrooms, buy new computers, and pay for more teachers.


How We Will Spend Your Money

In order to keep the school in operation and potentially expand the school, we are hoping to raise $10,000. For a better understanding of where your money will go, see below.

Primary Goals:

  • $30 - One month of funding for 10 students

  • $15- Weekly school supplies

  • $60 - A part time teacher's salary for one month

  • $120 - A full time teacher's salary for one month

----------------------------------------------------------------------

Secondary Goals:

  • $490 - One new computer (13 needed)

  • $2197 - The building of a new classroom


Will My Donation Matter?

A donation of any size would greatly help the KNGO to continue to provide exceptional free education for the poor children of Bospo Village and the surrounding areas. The education that KNGO provides includes: English literacy, Khmer literacy, Mathematics, computer programming, primary health education, community environmental awareness and vocational skills training.
Any amount of money (great or small) will help to fund day-to-day schooling.

I Can't Donate - What Can I Do?

We are constantly seeking volunteers to assist our Khmer teachers with our English literacy program. Regardless of whether you have teaching experience or not, the interaction volunteers have with our children makes a huge impact on their development.

If you decide to volunteer, not only will it positively affect the development of our children, but you will gain a rewarding and unforgettable life experience.

story:
My name is Bryce Chapman and my team and I have been teaching Dog Safety for Kids since 1992. 

The aim of our program is to educate children so they can be safer around dogs at home, at a friends or relatives house and out in the community. 
We do this by teaching children how dogs communicate, how to see signs that a dogs behaviour is changing, how and when to stay away from dogs, how to ask, approach and pat someones dog, what to do in an emergency, and much much more. 
As we head into our 24th year of teaching Dog Safety for Kids in Australian Schools we are now drawing on that experience to launch this essential program into the digital age. 

Thanks to improved high speed broadband connections into schools, kindergartens and households we can now reach more children throughout the entire world. 
After all, it's a global problem we are fighting.


Dog bites and attacks  = a global problem



 These shocking statistics are getting worse!


     *  The number of people admitted to Accident and Emergency (ER) in the UK as a          result of dog attacks has risen by 43% in the past 4 years. 

     *  Even worse, in London there has been a 119% rise in hospitalisation of under 18          year olds as a result of dog attacks.  

     *  In the United States, the fifth most frequent cause of visits to the ER with                      children's activities is from dog injuries and there has been an 86% increase in          dog bite hospitalisation from 1993 to 2008. 

     *  Shockingly, there has been an 82% increase in fatalities from dog attacks from          the 1980's to 2012! 


Now you can see why we are so passionate about launching this new on-line classroom. We have been doing an incredible job here is Sydney, but it's now time to teach our program to the rest of the world. 

"We cannot stand by and have these dreadful numbers 

increase any longer".

 


Our new Classroom will work like this: 

     •Teachers, parents, dog owners and sponsors can access the membership site       from on our web site www.dogsafetyforkids.com   

     •"Kick Start" Membership for the classroom is FREE and we aim to provide                    valuable tips and strategies on Dog Safety for Kids in short and precise 3 - 5                minute video lessons. For those wanting to jump start their dog safety                            strategies at home or in the classroom this is a great way to start. 

     •For those looking for the complete classroom program an easy upgrade to                    full Membership is just a few clicks away.

     •Membership starts at US$47 for an individual or family household; then it's                  US$197 for a kindergarten, child care centre or playgroup and US$297 for an              entire elementary or primary school. 

     **These are Early Bird prices available during this launch**

     •Each registered member can access the classroom on-demand over the 12                  month period. This allows teachers to easily schedule the program into their                calendar; year after year. 

     •The goal is to remove all boundaries to education by making it affordable,                  accessible, easy to use. 

     •Membership gives full access to the entire B.E.S.A.F.E. program including                    exclusive additional Kick Start lessons, Do-It-Yourself video-integrated                          lesson plans and complete Done-For-You lessons.

     • All lessons are Outcome Based Education.

     •Supporting PDF downloads, extension and follow up activities are included.

     •Lessons will be upgraded and advanced plug-ins offered as they roll out.


The following video shows a brief overview of the B.E.S.A.F.E. program.




The following video demonstrates how a live kindergarten lesson provides our foundation for the all new on-line classroom.





Well, as you can see by now we have been teaching children Dog Safety for Kids since 1992. At that time, I also started an educational business in Sydney called Kindifarm and together they went on to become Australia's leading farm animal and dog safety education programs, teaching well over 2 million children. 

This meant that I also became a leader of a highly energetic team which allowed the business to gain momentum and grow outside my own strengths and skills. 

The following video shows one of our live Kindergarten visits which was aired on Animal Hospital, Chanel Nine (Australia).




Additionally, in the past twelve months alone I have attended Brendan Burchard's Experts Academy (U.S. based world leading expert in training authors, speakers and coaches), trained with Kerwin Rae (an Australian world leader in growing services on line), attended Andy Harrington's Speaker's Academy (UK based world leader in public speaking and video/stage training), and more.

Therefore, much of the training and skills I need to move Dog Safety for Kids to the digital classroom have been undertaken.

I have been training with the worlds best to be the worlds best in delivering this critical program.

So, now we have great experience in teaching, running a team and successful business, developing skills in the digital medium, and talent in speaking and training on-line.

So what do we need the money for?



We need to get that wealth of knowledge onto video tapes to be cut and edited into an educational module that is going to be delivered, together with all supporting material, world wide via an on-line membership program.

We need money to:

     •Contribute to overheads for the next 12 months including: broadband,                    Infusionsoft (automated customer contact) and Customer Hub (on-line                        subscription host).

     •IT support: Infusionsoft and Customer Hub  advanced strategy, setup and 12            months ongoing support; social media and web-site overhaul and 12 months                ongoing support.

     •Video equipment: 2 x video cameras; microphone integration; sound mixer;                lights; booms; glide-cam; computer and editing programs;  iPads; and other                associated equipment.

     •Video Production: Engaging a Producer and film crew for the initial 20 x 5                 minute, 6 x 15 minute and 2 x 30 minute modules; and Editor for post                             production.

     •Studio fit out: Modifications to one of our studio areas for video production.

     •Supporting Outcome Based Material: PDF design and layout; certificate                    design and layout.



I am sure you noticed when watching our intro video on Indiegogo that our present video production and presentation needs improvement! 

The impact of this Indiegogo crowdfunding is going to dramatically improve this, after all, we don't want to distract teachers, parents and children with poor filming, sound and editing.

Engaging crew for the initial filming will allow a speedy launch of the on-line class room as well as training our team to reduce future ongoing costs. 

The purchase of in-house video and editing equipment is essential in allowing us to film on a budget. We are filming with dogs and children, both notoriously hard to hold to time restraints, I know as I have worked with both for 23 years.  

Crowdfunding will also allow us to engage experts in Infusionsoft and Customer Hub for the initial advanced set-up. This will speed up the launch of this program and deliver it in the best manner from day one.  

Ongoing support over the next twelve months with Infusionsoft, Customer Hub, the web site and social media will allow us to focus on what we are best at whilst maximising our reach.

So, crowdfunding is not only going to ensure we launch the Dog Safety for Kids on-line classroom, but also allow us to launch earlier, on a global platform, and in the best quality. 

 

     

The main risk we are facing is any further delay in delegating and outsourcing tasks that are better done by experts.  

The second risk is not getting known by teachers, parents and businesses. To make a lasting impact on each region, we need to achieve a high uptake of the program into schools.

Our final risk is that kindergartens and schools face limited funding.  

To meet these challenges one of our goals is the engage parents, local business and larger corporations to sponsor this program in schools and kindergartens as part of their community involvement (and exposure).
Parents can sponsor their school or kindergarten; Local business can sponsor a local area or suburb, and a corporation can introduce the program to an entire city, or more.

This means there is no financial pressure on the schools and kindergartens, and the sponsor can benefit from the exposure or philanthropy.


                                                   ** ADDITIONALLY,                                                                    OUR BONUS MEMBERSHIPS MEAN  KINDERGARTENS, SCHOOLS                                AND SPONSORS CAN HELP PAY FOR THEIR PERKS BY                                FUND-RAISING **

  

 

                             

In addition to the perks we are offering there are many other ways you can help as well.

     •Are you or do you know an expert in Infusionsoft or Customer Hub (or Kajabi)? If      so, can you offer some assistance with set-up and on-going support?

     •What about web site design, optimisation and on-going support?

     •Do you have video production experience and are willing to do some production      for us here in Sydney?

     •Are you can expert at social media? This is now the best way to spread our                 message so again, set up and on-going support would be terrific.   

    Bonus Memberships may be offered for your help.

     •You can also help greatly by making some noise about Dog Safety for Kids                  on your own network (email, social media, at your school, community                            groups and so on) or in traditional media.

     •Do you own a business or, know someone who does, that would jump at the                  opportunity to sponsor a kindergarten or school?

     •Do you know a corporation that would like to improve their image and                            exposure by sponsoring a suburb or city?

     •What about local government?  

     •Lastly, please use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the crowdfunding                    campaign out to as many people as possible! 

                                       

 

**BONUS Memberships** 

 

Our schools cannot educate in isolation from the general community because lessons taught must be reinforced and repeated at home and in every day life.

To demonstrate our commitment to Dog Safety for Kids making a real difference we have added a generous number of BONUS Family Memberships to all Membership Perks.   

For each Family or Dog Owner Membership Perk we will match its value with a BONUS membership.

For each Kindergarten Perk we will give you 5 BONUS Family Memberships.

For each School Perk we will give you 10 BONUS Family Memberships.

And, for Sponsor a Suburb or City Perks you also receive BONUS Kindergarten and School Memberships. 

The value of these BONUS Memberships ranges from $47 up to an incredible $31,170 worth of additional Memberships.

** THESE BONUSES CAN BE USED FOR FUND RAISING BY KINDERGARTENS, SCHOOLS AND SPONSORS **

Small, big or massive.....together we can open the on-line classroom in as many schools and households as possible, and make a real difference. 

  


Thank you so much for taking the time to support Dog Safety for Kids move into the digital classroom. 

You have made a big difference and helped make it safer for our children all around the world be safer with their best friend, the dog.



So, you don’t have a dog for membership or a team for sponsorship but, you want to support our launch into as many schools as possible.

Well, here’s your chance to become an official Founder of the Dog Safety for Kids On-Line Classroom.

With this perk we officially name you as a Classroom Founder on our Facebook Page, web site Founder Page and inside the Classroom Membership Site in our dedicated Founder Room.

We also keep you up to date on our progress and stay connected.



For families with a dog, or those planning on getting one, this perk gives your household Membership as a Founder of the Dog Safety for Kids On-line Classroom.

Your family has unlimited entry to the classroom for 12 months.

As a Founding Member you benefit from Early Bird Pricing.

You are among the first to gain access to the classroom on launch.

We officially name your family as a Classroom Founder on our Facebook Page, web site and inside the Classroom Membership site.

Also, we stay connected.

Plus, we give you 1 BONUS Family Membership ($47 Value). Give it to a friend or relative and lets help keep our kids safer, household by household.



So, you don't have children but you still know how much children love your dog. Relax; this perk gives you membership as a Founder of the Dog Safety for Kids on-line Classroom as well.

You receive unlimited entry to the classroom for 12 months.

As a Founding Member you benefit from Early Bird Pricing.

You are among the first to gain access to the classroom on launch.

We officially name you as a Classroom Founder on our Facebook Page, web site and inside the Classroom Membership site.

Also, we stay connected.

Plus, we give you 1 BONUS Family Membership ($47 Value). Give it to a friend or relative and lets help keep our kids safer, dog owner by dog owner.



Kindergarten, Day Care Centre or playgroup  Membership as a Founder of the Dog Safety for Kids on-Line Classroom.

This perk gives a kindergarten Membership to the Dog Safety for Kids On-Line Classroom as a Founder. 

Teachers have unlimited entry to the classroom for 12 months.

All Founder perks apply. 

Plus, we give you 5 BONUS Family Memberships ($235 Value). Use them as fund raisers or give them to staff and parents. 

The more support our children have at home and in the community the better they learn.




Sponsor an entire Kindergarten, Child Care or Playgroup as an individual, team of parents, business or any other group you can imagine.

This perk gives a Kindergarten of your choice Dog Safety for Kids On-Line Classroom Membership as a Founder.

Teachers have unlimited entry to the classroom for 12 months.

All Founder perks apply.

Plus, we officially name your team as a Sponsor on our Facebook Page, web site and in the classroom membership site.

You also receives a digital Certificate as Sponsor to display, use in media and give to the Kindergarten.

Plus, we give you 5 BONUS Family Memberships ($235 Value). Use them as fund raisers or give them to staff and parents. 

The more support our children have at home and in the community the better they learn.




School Membership as a Founder of the Dog Safety for Kids On-Line Classroom.

This perk gives your School Membership as Founders of the Dog Safety for Kids On-Line Classroom.

Teachers have unlimited entry to the classroom for 12 months.

All Founder perks apply.

Plus, we give you 10 BONUS Family Memberships ($470 Value). Use them as fund raisers or give them to staff and parents. 

The more support our children have at home and in the community the better they learn.




Sponsor an entire School Membership as an individual, team of parents, business or any other group you can imagine.

This perk gives a School of your choice Membership as Founders of the Dog Safety for Kids On-Line Classroom.

Teachers have unlimited entry to the classroom for 12 months.

All Founder perks apply.

Plus, we officially name your team as a Sponsor on our Facebook Page, web site and in the classroom membership site.

Your team also receives a digital Certificate as Sponsor to display, use in media and give to the school.

Plus, we give you 10 BONUS Family Memberships ($470 Value). Use them as fund raisers or give them to staff and parents. 
The more support our children have at home and in the community the better they learn. 



Sponsor 6 Kindergarten's or Child Care Centre's as a team, business, corporation, local government body or any other group you can imagine.

This perk gives 6 Kindergartens of your choice Membership as Founders of the Dog Safety for Kids On-Line Classroom.

Teachers will have unlimited entry to the classroom for 12 months.

All Founder and Sponsor perks apply.

Plus, you sponsor 6 kindies for the price of 5. 

That's a BONUS of $197!

Also, you receive a special Premium digital Certificate as Sponsor of a suburb to display and use in media.

Finally, a custom press release from us.

Plus, we give you 30 BONUS Family Memberships ($1,410 Value). Use them as fund raisers or give them to staff and parents. 

That's a total of $1,607 worth of additional memberships! 

So, together we will open classrooms in 6 kindergartens and 30 households. Now that will make a difference to a lot of children in your community.



Sponsor 6 School Memberships as Founders of the Dog Safety for Kids On-Line Classroom.

This perk gives 6 Schools of your choice Membership to the Dog Safety for Kids On-Line Classroom.

Teachers will have unlimited entry to the classroom for 12 months.

All Founder and Sponsor perks apply.

Plus, you sponsor 6 schools for the price of 5. 

That's as BONUS of $297!

Also, you receive a special Premium digital Certificate as Sponsor of a suburb to display and use in media.

Finally, a custom press release from us.

Plus, we

 give you 60 BONUS Family Memberships ($2,820 Value). 

Use them as fund raisers or give them to staff and parents.
That's a total of $3,117 worth of additional Memberships!

So, together we will open classrooms in 6 schools and 60 households. Now that's how teamwork helps make big changes, and make our community safer. 



Sponsor 60 Kindergarten or Child Care Centre Memberships as Founders of the Dog Safety for Kids On-Line Classroom.

This perk gives 60 Kindergartens of your choice Membership to the Dog Safety for Kids On-Line Classroom.

Teachers have unlimited entry to the classroom for 12 months.

All Founder and Sponsor perks apply.

Plus, you sponsor 60 Kindies for the price of 50. 

That's a BONUS of $1970.

An extra special Premium digital Certificate as Sponsor of a City to display and use in the media.

A custom press release.

And a meeting with me!

Plus, we will give you 300 BONUS Family Memberships ($14,100 Value)!

That's a total $16,070 of additional memberships!

So, together we will open classrooms in 60 kindergartens and 300 households, that will help make a massive difference!



Sponsor 60 School Memberships as a Founder of the Dog Safety for Kids On-Line Classroom.

This perk gives 60 Schools of your choice Membership to the Dog Safety for Kids On-Line Classroom.

Teachers have unlimited entry to the classroom for 12 months.

All Founder and Sponsor perks apply.

Plus, you sponsor 60 Schools for the price of 50. 

That's a BONUS of $2970.

An extra special Premium digital Certificate as Sponsor of a City to display and use in the media.

A custom press release.

And a meeting with me!

Plus, we will give you 600 BONUS Family Memberships ($28,200 Value).
That's a total of $31,170 of additional memberships!!!

So, together we will open classrooms in 60 schools and 600 households! WOW, what an incredible difference that will make to the children in your community!


Thank you very much for your time and consideration with our Indiegogo Dog Safety for Kids on-line classroom launch.

Bryce Chapman
Founder
Dog Safety for Kids

For those wanting to jump start their dog safety                            strategies at home or in the classroom this is a great way to start.      •For those looking for the complete classroom program an easy upgrade to                    full Membership is just a few clicks away.     •Membership starts at US$47 for an individual or family household; then it's                  US$197 for a kindergarten, child care centre or playgroup and US$297 for an              entire elementary or primary school.      **These are Early Bird prices available during this launch**
     •Each registered member can access the classroom on-demand over the 12                  month period. This allows teachers to easily schedule the program into their                calendar; year after year.      •The goal is to remove all boundaries to education by making it affordable,                  accessible, easy to use.      •Membership gives full access to the entire B.E.S.A.F.E. program including                    exclusive additional Kick Start lessons, Do-It-Yourself video-integrated                          lesson plans and complete Done-For-You lessons.     • All lessons are Outcome Based Education.     •Supporting PDF downloads, extension and follow up activities are included.     •Lessons will be upgraded and advanced plug-ins offered as they roll out.The following video shows a brief overview of the B.E.S.A.F.E. program.The following video demonstrates how a live kindergarten lesson provides our foundation for the all new on-line classroom.Well, as you can see by now we have been teaching children Dog Safety for Kids since 1992. At that time, I also started an educational business in Sydney called Kindifarm and together they went on to become Australia's leading farm animal and dog safety education programs, teaching well over 2 million children. This meant that I also became a leader of a highly energetic team which allowed the business to gain momentum and grow outside my own strengths and skills. 
The following video shows one of our live Kindergarten visits which was aired on Animal Hospital, Chanel Nine (Australia).



Additionally, in the past twelve months alone I have attended Brendan Burchard's Experts Academy (U.S. based world leading expert in training authors, speakers and coaches), trained with Kerwin Rae (an Australian world leader in growing services on line), attended Andy Harrington's Speaker's Academy (UK based world leader in public speaking and video/stage training), and more.
Therefore, much of the training and skills I need to move Dog Safety for Kids to the digital classroom have been undertaken.
I have been training with the worlds best to be the worlds best in delivering this critical program.
So, now we have great experience in teaching, running a team and successful business, developing skills in the digital medium, and talent in speaking and training on-line.
So what do we need the money for?



We need to get that wealth of knowledge onto video tapes to be cut and edited into an educational module that is going to be delivered, together with all supporting material, world wide via an on-line membership program.
We need money to:
     •Contribute to overheads for the next 12 months including: broadband,                    Infusionsoft (automated customer contact) and Customer Hub (on-line                        subscription host).
     •IT support: Infusionsoft and Customer Hub  advanced strategy, setup and 12            months ongoing support; social media and web-site overhaul and 12 months                ongoing support.
     •Video equipment: 2 x video cameras; microphone integration; sound mixer;                lights; booms; glide-cam; computer and editing programs;  iPads; and other                associated equipment.
     •Video Production: Engaging a Producer and film crew for the initial 20 x 5                 minute, 6 x 15 minute and 2 x 30 minute modules; and Editor for post                             production.
     •Studio fit out: Modifications to one of our studio areas for video production.
     •Supporting Outcome Based Material: PDF design and layout; certificate                    design and layout.



I am sure you noticed when watching our intro video on Indiegogo that our present video production and presentation needs improvement! 
The impact of this Indiegogo crowdfunding is going to dramatically improve this, after all, we don't want to distract teachers, parents and children with poor filming, sound and editing.
Engaging crew for the initial filming will allow a speedy launch of the on-line class room as well as training our team to reduce future ongoing costs. 
The purchase of in-house video and editing equipment is essential in allowing us to film on a budget. We are filming with dogs and children, both notoriously hard to hold to time restraints, I know as I have worked with both for 23 years.  
Crowdfunding will also allow us to engage experts in Infusionsoft and Customer Hub for the initial advanced set-up. This will speed up the launch of this program and deliver it in the best manner from day one.  
Ongoing support over the next twelve months with Infusionsoft, Customer Hub, the web site and social media will allow us to focus on what we are best at whilst maximising our reach.
So, crowdfunding is not only going to ensure we launch the Dog Safety for Kids on-line classroom, but also allow us to launch earlier, on a global platform, and in the best quality. 
 

     The main risk we are facing is any further delay in delegating and outsourcing tasks that are better done by experts.  
The second risk is not getting known by teachers, parents and businesses. To make a lasting impact on each region, we need to achieve a high uptake of the program into schools.
Our final risk is that kindergartens and schools face limited funding.  
To meet these challenges one of our goals is the engage parents, local business and larger corporations to sponsor this program in schools and kindergartens as part of their community involvement (and exposure).Parents can sponsor their school or kindergarten; Local business can sponsor a local area or suburb, and a corporation can introduce the program to an entire city, or more.

This means there is no financial pressure on the schools and kindergartens, and the sponsor can benefit from the exposure or philanthropy.


                                                   ** ADDITIONALLY,                                                                    OUR BONUS MEMBERSHIPS MEAN  KINDERGARTENS, SCHOOLS                                AND SPONSORS CAN HELP PAY FOR THEIR PERKS BY                                FUND-RAISING **

  
 

                             In addition to the perks we are offering there are many other ways you can help as well.
     •Are you or do you know an expert in Infusionsoft or Customer Hub (or Kajabi)? If      so, can you offer some assistance with set-up and on-going support?
     •What about web site design, optimisation and on-going support?
     •Do you have video production experience and are willing to do some production      for us here in Sydney?
     •Are you can expert at social media? This is now the best way to spread our                 message so again, set up and on-going support would be terrific.   
    Bonus Memberships may be offered for your help.
     •You can also help greatly by making some noise about Dog Safety for Kids                  on your own network (email, social media, at your school, community                            groups and so on) or in traditional media.
     •Do you own a business or, know someone who does, that would jump at the                  opportunity to sponsor a kindergarten or school?
     •Do you know a corporation that would like to improve their image and                            exposure by sponsoring a suburb or city?
     •What about local government?  
     •Lastly, please use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the crowdfunding                    campaign out to as many people as possible! 
                                       

 
**BONUS Memberships** 



 



Our schools cannot educate in isolation from the general community because lessons taught must be reinforced and repeated at home and in every day life.
To demonstrate our commitment to Dog Safety for Kids making a real difference we have added a generous number of BONUS Family Memberships to all Membership Perks.   
For each Family or Dog Owner Membership Perk we will match its value with a BONUS membership.
For each Kindergarten Perk we will give you 5 BONUS Family Memberships.
For each School Perk we will give you 10 BONUS Family Memberships.
And, for Sponsor a Suburb or City Perks you also receive BONUS Kindergarten and School Memberships. 
The value of these BONUS Memberships ranges from $47 up to an incredible $31,170 worth of additional Memberships.

** THESE BONUSES CAN BE USED FOR FUND RAISING BY KINDERGARTENS, SCHOOLS AND SPONSORS **


Small, big or massive.....together we can open the on-line classroom in as many schools and households as possible, and make a real difference. 
  


Thank you so much for taking the time to support Dog Safety for Kids move into the digital classroom. 
You have made a big difference and helped make it safer for our children all around the world be safer with their best friend, the dog.



So, you don’t have a dog for membership or a team for sponsorship but, you want to support our launch into as many schools as possible.
Well, here’s your chance to become an official Founder of the Dog Safety for Kids On-Line Classroom.
With this perk we officially name you as a Classroom Founder on our Facebook Page, web site Founder Page and inside the Classroom Membership Site in our dedicated Founder Room.
We also keep you up to date on our progress and stay connected.

Your family has unlimited entry to the classroom for 12 months.
As a Founding Member you benefit from Early Bird Pricing.
You are among the first to gain access to the classroom on launch.

story:
THE COMPANY

MY STUDENT LIFE is a student organization formed to help Nigerian students live better. We at MSL plan to offer various schemes to make life cheaper, easier and also to give advice alongside educational and lifestyle tips at the least to Nigerian students. 

WHY MY STUDENT LIFE WAS FOUNDED

Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa, with 63% of the population under the age of 24 with an annual growth rate of 3.24% and over 30million as students.

MSL was founded with the sole intent of making lives of Nigerian students better in every possible way. MSL plans to create an educational environment, where student living in Nigeria becomes best in Africa and also standard enough to compete in the western world, reducing the amount of students leaving the country for educational purposes and attracting students from all over the world boosting Nigeria’s economy gradually.

Nigeria also has a high rate of unemployment, which makes employment for undergraduates almost impossible. Students with no opportunity to earn in a country with an ever-increasing cost of living are forced to venture into immoral and illegal activities such as prostitution, robbery, Internet fraud and even unimaginable activities like money ritual increasing mortality rates of Nigerian youths. This is why helping students achieve a better and more convenient lifestyle should be an essential priority and not in any way a luxury.  

Our Core Focus: SKILL ACQUISITION

                                  EDUCATION

                                  EMPLOYMENT

                                  COST OF LIVING

THE MSL DISCOUNT SCHEME

The MSL Discount Scheme is a definitive student discount scheme. The discount scheme will be solely for students in a bid to encourage savings and reduce living. MSL is already partnering with over 150 companies to offer various ranges of exclusive discounts of up to 70% in reputable companies such as 10% off DOMINOS, 20% off NACK and a whooping 65% off paintballing E.T.C. These discounts range from transportation, to shopping and eating out to mention a few.

STUDSHOP

MSL plans to launch its discounted e-commerce platform by May 2015, where students can purchase all products from our partner companies at a discounted rate. Students can instantly see how much they can save on Grocery,essential items and other products including phones and laptops.

YEARLY SPENDING POWER

Over 50Million impression across social media, MSL plans to have at least 100,000 students shopping on our discounted e-commerce platform  by December 2015. 100,000 is just 5% of student population at higher institution( 1.7M) and 0.5% of Nigeria” current student population.

If each student spends a minimum of  N2,000/Monthly on the platform on various items such as discounted airtime, grocery shopping, clothing, travel etc. The estimate spending power on the platform would be 1.6Bn by December 2015.

SUPPORT US 

MSL is crowd funding to get our project running with increased visibility. We need about £8000, which would cover the stud shop platform set up, employment of a few extra hands, and promoting the brand across Nigerian universities.

£1,800: We need £1,500 to build the discounted e-commerce platform. £300 for a private semi dedicated server.

£2000: We hope to use this towards employment of 3 full time entry-level staffs, whose roles would include keeping the platform up to date and processing orders. We also need a full time graphic designer to help with the day to day design needs of the business. We hope to use this over a period of 6 months, we would need to expand over time but we hope to cover employment with company income when we reach that level.

£800: This would be used for equipment.

We need to buy laptops: http://www.pcworld.co.uk/gbuk/laptops-netbooks/laptops/laptops/toshiba-satellite-c50-b-14d-15-6-laptop-black-10011201-pdt.html#cat-0

  Wi-Fi Router Starter Pack: http://smile.com.ng/products-services/

This would help us run uninterrupted for atleast 6 months and give us the ability to keep up and deliver great service.

£1,400: This would be used for start up digital marketing, creating visibility in campuses, promotions to attract students onto the platform.

£2000: Merchandise, start up logistics, and physical promotional activities.

IMPACT

By donating towards the project, you would be helping MSL actualise its main vision to change the educational system. We are tackling both cost of living and unemployment today but tomorrow we would be empowering and educating. Any amount donated would impact in the future of the Nigerian educational sector. Little drops make the mighty ocean.

THE TEAM

The MSL team consists of experienced Student brand managers who have worked with big international brands like Spotify, Ref Me on student campaigns at various universities in the United Kingdom and worked closely as representatives of the prestigious University of Portsmouth over the past four years.

Kehinde Kassim- Idea Developer/ Chief Strategy Officer.

Taiwo Kassim- Student Brand Manager/ B2B Personnel/ Clientelle Acquisition

Bidemi Muolokwu- PR Personnel.

 

To discuss with us further on anything or to get involved in any other way please email Taiwokassim@mystudentlife.com.ng or call +447447131077

story:
My name is Pvgz Addams.

I'm a former homeless person, Who was lucky enough to get off the streets.

When I was in my late teens, I moved from Vancouver to the Big Island of Hawaii, To live with my mother, Who had moved away when I was 5 years old.

Upon arrival, I was unaware that my mother really didn't have a place of her own.

She had been sleeping on a friends couch for the last year.

3 days after I showed up, The person she was staying with attempted to sexually assault my mother. She bolted out of the front door and told me to grab my things and go. We started down the road and that's when she told me what had happened.

There we were. A mother and her boy with no place to go.

Fortunately, She did own a 1/4 acre of land, way up the volcano, in the jungle. Just land. No house. Just trees and grass. We made our way to Hilo and a local church was kind enough to give us a tent, blankets and some food.

That's where we lived for the next year, Until the lady across the street moved out of her "House" and we moved in. It wasn't so much a house, as it was a bunch of construction scraps nailed together. NO electricity, Running water, Nothing but, at least it was a roof. It was a HUGE step up.

Now that I'm back in the Northwest, I couldn't imagine what it's like to try and survive that way in this area! The temperature can go from 20F degrees in the winter to 100F degrees in the summer!

My Mom passed away a few years ago and ever since then, I've wanted to do something to help others in need and honor her memory.

We came up with a solution, after being inspired by a guy in California, Who had built a couple shelters for the homeless, using bits found in dumpsters.

We construct portable sleeping spaces that are well insulated, with larger tires for easy off road access and a thousand times more comfortable than a tent!

After our first shelter was built, We started having people come to us, asking for help! The only problem is, The need for these far outweighs our budget! In order to continue to provide people with a dry, warm place to sleep, We need YOUR HELP!  Please give what you can so we can continue to provide our services!

It costs roughly $650 dollars to construct each unit. All donation made go directly towards the construction of the shelters, as well as tools, delivery of the units, licensing fees and we are also trying to save up for property.

Our long term goal is, to raise enough money to buy an RV park to turn into a community for those in need. We would offer a place to live, a paid job,(For those who can work) and education in minimalist living, as well as drug counseling. In the area where we are based out of, The Long Beach Peninsula, We don't have a single Homeless shelter or warming center, for those on the streets. The need for these is enormous!!! If we don't reach our goal with this campaign, All money raised will still go towards construction of the shelters.  Even if you can't help us financially, Please help us spread the word and share this page with your friends and family! Thank you very much! If you have any questions, You can find us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/PortableHomelessShelters. Feel free to message us anytime!

She bolted out of the front door and told me to grab my things and go. We started down the road and that's when she told me what had happened.There we were. A mother and her boy with no place to go.Fortunately, She did own a 1/4 acre of land, way up the volcano, in the jungle. Just land. No house. Just trees and grass. We made our way to Hilo and a local church was kind enough to give us a tent, blankets and some food.That's where we lived for the next year, Until the lady across the street moved out of her "House" and we moved in. It wasn't so much a house, as it was a bunch of construction scraps nailed together. NO electricity, Running water, Nothing but, at least it was a roof. It was a HUGE step up.Now that I'm back in the Northwest, I couldn't imagine what it's like to try and survive that way in this area! The temperature can go from 20F degrees in the winter to 100F degrees in the summer!My Mom passed away a few years ago and ever since then, I've wanted to do something to help others in need and honor her memory.We came up with a solution, after being inspired by a guy in California, Who had built a couple shelters for the homeless, using bits found in dumpsters.We construct portable sleeping spaces that are well insulated, with larger tires for easy off road access and a thousand times more comfortable than a tent!After our first shelter was built, We started having people come to us, asking for help! The only problem is, The need for these far outweighs our budget! In order to continue to provide people with a dry, warm place to sleep, We need YOUR HELP!  Please give what you can so we can continue to provide our services! It costs roughly $650 dollars to construct each unit. All donation made go directly towards the construction of the shelters, as well as tools, delivery of the units, licensing fees and we are also trying to save up for property.Our long term goal is, to raise enough money to buy an RV park to turn into a community for those in need. We would offer a place to live, a paid job,(For those who can work) and education in minimalist living, as well as drug counseling. In the area where we are based out of, The Long Beach Peninsula, We don't have a single Homeless shelter or warming center, for those on the streets. The need for these is enormous!!! If we don't reach our goal with this campaign, All money raised will still go towards construction of the shelters.  Even if you can't help us financially, Please help us spread the word and share this page with your friends and family! Thank you very much! If you have any questions, You can find us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/PortableHomelessShelters. Feel free to message us anytime!

story: As young women growing up in Trenton, New Jersey  we are faced with many obstacles but together we have united to create an opportunity for young women who have similar dreams and goals as we do. Prom Scholar is project that  is dedicated to assisting a senior girl graduating and going to college finance her prom needs while raising funds for her first year of college. This is the first launch of this project and two aspiring young women Kenya Bullock and Shana Langley have been selected to participate in this campaign. With the help of me  Designer Shahedah Williams and Hair stylist Greona Boisseau. We will be giving these two amazing young women the ultimate prom experience and create a scholarship opportunity.
