story:
Short Summary

We are a group of language teachers, language learners, IT professionals and entrepreneurs who have developed a very promising platform for language educators and their students. MyLAMPA (My Lesson & Activity Management, Planning & Access) addresses a need by appealing to smaller and medium-sized language schools and freelance teachers worldwide - it is a super-powerful lesson planner, an intuitive resource cataloging system, an invaluable management tool and a mobile learning app - it is the evolution of lesson planning and language learning management.

We have been developing this platform for several years on our own time, with our own money and with significant personal sacrifices. We have recently decided to launch MyLAMPA as a social enterprise, but we are at the "end of our collective financial ropes" so we need a little help!

Not only will MyLAMPA transform the way teachers, language schools and learners manage learning and teaching, with your help we will have a significant positive impact on important education initiatives around the globe and we will get our users directly involved in promoting that change.

Your contribution will help us reach our goal and it will help you to get directly involved yourself. This is an opportunity for you to make a difference with us!

What We Need & What You Get

To guarantee success, we need to raise $40,000.00. Every single contributor who helps us reach that goal, no matter how small the gift is, will have the opportunity to vote for the recipients of our annual donations.

The money that we are raising is needed to complete development of the platform; to establish a self-perpetuating, world-wide professional network of teachers and schools; to complete development of learning apps; and to enhance the user experience. If we are able to accomplish all of this by the end of the year, we will have the user base that we need in order to build a sustainable and impactful social enterprise.

If you do decide to help us "get out of the gate", we would like to give you a say in how future donations will be issued. For every incremental donation of $5.00, you will have one vote when it comes time to evaluate projects and decide where to send our first donations. All contributors of $25.00 or more will also be listed on our supporters page and get a link to their website. Anyone who donates $50.00 or more will get a Certificate of Thanks to hang on their wall. Contributors of $100.00 or more will also receive free MyLAMPA student licenses at the rate of 1 per $5.00 increment. A Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum Sponsor, or WOW! status will be conferred on anyone contributing $250.00, $500.00, $750.00, $1,000.00 or $1,500.00 respectively. The larger the sponsor, the more prominently they will be displayed on the mylampa.com website.

If we do not meet our $40,000.00 goal, we will not be able to reach as many teachers, sell as many student licences or raise as much money to support schools in need. This will endanger the project. If we raise some money but fall short of our goal, we will use the funds to distribute the platform on social media and to make as many technical enhancements as possible so as to make the most of it.

The Impact

If you can read this, you're not alone! According to the British Council, there will be more than 1.9 billion active English language learners by 2020.  But MyLAMPA is not restricted to English learners; it is for any student of any language attending smaller language schools or studying with private tutors.

We assume that every full-time language teacher will successfully invite 30 of his or her students. Based on this assumption, we will be able to donate $30.00 for each and every language teacher using the platform. Our goal in 2017 is 1,000 teachers. This would enable us to donate $1,000.00 to 30 different schools or projects that need it - just imagine the impact that will have!

We hope to quadruple the number of MyLAMPA users in the second year and to have a continuing and expanding positive global impact on language teaching and learning and on providing education opportunities. 

So, aside from improving the quality of services in language schools, saving teachers' time and helping them teach better, we will make a real difference by funding important projects aimed at helping to improve education for those who need it.

Risks & Challenges

One of the risks connected with the social aspect of the project is that the money we collect and donate could be mismanaged. To alleviate this risk, we will work with established charitable organizations in the beginning. We would also like you and the platform's users to help us by voting on potential donation recipients.

On the user side, there is always the risk that we will not be successful in launching the platform widely enough to meet our financial goals. However, we already have roughly 8,000 followers on LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/in/semullen/) and Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/LAMPASystems/?ref=br_rs) who we are contacting directly. We also already have approximately 400 registered teacher users and we plan to take advantage of social media advertising and all the free publicity that we can find so that we can recruit many more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this project with everyone you know by email, on Facebook, on LinkedIn, on Twitter, by word of mouth, or by any other means and ask them to share it as well. Anyone who contributes an amount, however small, and/or spreads the word increases our chances.  The more we raise, the bigger the impact we can all have together.

If you represent a language school or if you are a teacher, please start using the platform! Your participation will lead us to the achievement of our goals. (http://mylampa.com)

If you are a language student, please tell your teacher or school about this great opportunity for them to get a free system and to help out.
story_txt:
Short Summary
We are a group of language teachers, language learners, IT professionals and entrepreneurs who have developed a very promising platform for language educators and their students. MyLAMPA (My Lesson & Activity Management, Planning & Access) addresses a need by appealing to smaller and medium-sized language schools and freelance teachers worldwide - it is a super-powerful lesson planner, an intuitive resource cataloging system, an invaluable management tool and a mobile learning app - it is the evolution of lesson planning and language learning management.

We have been developing this platform for several years on our own time, with our own money and with significant personal sacrifices. We have recently decided to launch MyLAMPA as a social enterprise, but we are at the "end of our collective financial ropes" so we need a little help!

story:
20 Indigenous Youth, 20 Short Films, 20 Bright Futures

By donating to this campaign, you directly support our youth participants, instructors and the Knowledge Keepers Documentary program.

The Program includes:

  • ScreenWriting:  Overcoming racism, reclaiming Identity through stories, spoken word, short film script. 
  • Directing/Camera: Leadership, technology and expressing your voice. 
  • Producing: Realizing potential, confidence, business of film and technology. 
  • Editing: Technology for employment, pride in completion. 

The Short Film Program: Changing the narrative, breaking a cycle of silence and providing the tools, education and opportunity to excel with the outcome of employment. 

The Knowledge Keepers Documentary Program:  Each youth participant spends a year with an Elder to create, shoot and deliver a series of documentary short films. The program empowers, teaches and inspires our participants.  We believe the gathering of stories and teaching of the Elders plays an important role in healing intergenerational trauma.

 

 

Crowdfunded Future Indigenous Filmmakers!

Our WFI youth particpants understand the value of delivering material they are proud of, and promotes the benefits of education to achieve employment. Through positive feedback by industry mentors, they develop key skills, training and successes they have never experienced before. We have seen their transformation, shedding the ties that bind them through racism, discrimination and abuse, blossoming into confident and empowered people, proud of their culture and unafraid to integrate into career opportunities. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help Weengushk Film Institute get the word out! The more money we raise, the greater the impact we will have on Indigenous youth. Please share our information on social media and use #ReelIndigenous, #TruthYouthReconciliation and #CulturalAppreciation and ask people to donate. 

 

Miigwetch, 

Shirley Cheechoo and the entire WFI Team

 

Learn more about WFI: https://www.weengushk.com

Like and Share our Page on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/weengushkfilm/

Follow Us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/weengushk

Check out our YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKYO9mAB8hjlz_vUvFjVbIw

story:
Breakdown and use of funds: Total $50,000

  • $25,000: Set aside for future school projects. These funds will go directly to public schools in the Chicagoland area to help them get a jump start on their funding needs for projects. Types of projects that would be supported include, but are not limited to, use of green energy technologies, arts & theater programs, school technology upgrades.
  • $13,000: New website functionalities. Bridging the gap between donors and schools does not stop at the creation of a platform to showcase the projects. These funds will be put to use in adding new functionalities to our platform, ones that incentivize donors to contribute and to make it easier to share their contribution with their own personal networks.  
  • $6,000: Project marketing and awareness. It’s important for us to be able to get the word out on the projects that are displayed on our platform. This $6k would be put toward a geo-oriented targeted marketing campaign focusing on Chicago. This would include ad placements on the “L” trains in Chicago.   
  • $6,000: UI & UX Web Development: Our platform has to be easy-to-use, for both schools and donors, so a significant portion of the funds will go toward improving the user experience design and user interface design.

 

OUR STORY

A recent college graduate/military veteran and his lifelong friend from the finance industry, united in their vision to improve the American education system. Brian and Mike believe that regardless of the financial condition of a school or its district, school administrators should have the opportunity to be transparent about opportunities that would improve the learning environment for students, and likewise, members of the public should be able to easily find these projects and support them if they wish to do so. By partnering with public schools at the administrative level, schools can fundraise for improvement projects of a larger scale, projects that can create efficiency and have a bigger impact on students, teachers and members of the community.

After seeing a public school in disrepair, and learning that it had been in that condition for over two years, Mike approached Brian to start a website that connects public school projects with members of the community (and the country) that care about education and want to make a positive impact on the ground level. Brian, fresh out of the military and pursuing a bachelor’s degree, saw this as an opportunity to truly help people, and give back to communities across the country. They got to work.

 

INTRODUCING HOWDOWE, INC.

Started in 2015, HowDoWe, Inc., is an organization dedicated to improving the value of a public education by providing public schools with the ability to spread awareness about, and raise funds for, capital projects that improve the learning environment for students. We believe that as federal, state and local governments work toward balanced budgets, communities and businesses alike should still be able to support the education of today’s students. We also understand that donors should have a choice in the types of projects they feel should be funded, and should rest assured that their money goes to the cause of their choosing.

    Our easy to use platform, HowDoWe.org, allows school administrators to make an online profile, and post projects to their school profile to receive funding. Individuals, small businesses, and corporate backers can visit the website and make donations to the schools and projects of their choosing. After a donation is made, backers receive a receipt via email that can be used as a reference on their individual tax returns for potential deduction (depending on their individual tax-related circumstances). Once the project funding deadline is reached, schools receive the funds that have been collected on their profile and can begin work on the project. Backers are kept up to date on the progress of these projects to see how their m oney is being put into action. HowDoWe only charges a small transaction fee of 8% (8 cents on the dollar) per donation, which is used to cover operations and administrative expenses.

    Check out the schools and improvement projects on our platform here!

      No other fundraising platform provides this level of exclusivity for school administrators, and simplicity for donors seeking to improve and support public education projects. By aligning with schools on the administrative level, we are able to coordinate on capital projects of a larger scale, ones that can have a drastic impact on the students and the community. For example, with more energy efficient facilities, budget pressures can be reduced at the state and local level, and funds can be re-allocated to other areas in need of assistance. By improving the learning environment for students, teachers are empowered, student GPA and graduation rates could rise, and crime rates could decline. And on the whole, the community could flourish with an improved education system, tax dollars could be applied more efficiently, property values could rise, and so on.

      We have made amazing progress over the past year building our online platform, aligning with public schools in Chicago and attracting groups of backers to rally in support of our cause. But as we launch with our first group of schools, we are in great need of funds to make improvements to our website, and ultimately support a rapid increase in the number of backers and schools using our platform. The money collected here would allow us to expand our reach, attract new schools and donors, and allow us to keep our transaction fee as low as possible. 

      Half of all funds raised on IndieGoGo will be set aside for new school projects that are added to our platform. In other words, half of all funds raised here go directly to schools! By having money to help schools get started, they are attracted schools to the platform, as it gives them the much-needed jump-start to get their projects funded. It also allows us to give more options to the backers, as we want them to be able to find projects with which they can identify. The remaining funds will go toward our website, adding new functionalities to make it easier for both donors and schools to sign up and share project information. 

      Perk: We understand that backers that support us in our efforts to improve our platform also care deeply the advancement of America's public education, and that deserves recognition. So every backer that gives $75 or more will have their choice to have their names displayed in a special recognition section on our website, howdowe.org, listed as a supporter. At this stage in our business, $75 dollars can go a long way for us, and we want to make sure that the people that support HowDoWe, and public education, get the recognition they deserve. 

       

      THE FOUNDERS

      Michael Anderson- President & Co-Founder
      Michael Anderson is President and Co-Founder of HowDoWe, Inc. Mike’s background is in finance and marketing. Over the past four years, Mike has led the Corporate Access function of an investment bank and served as the Head of Marketing for an Investor Relations consulting firm in downtown Chicago. He holds a Master’s Degree in Business Administration from Loyola University Chicago’s Quinlan School of Business, as well as Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration with a focus in Finance and Management from Augustana College in Rock Island, Illinois.

      Brian Letzter- Vice President & Co-Founder
      Brian Letzter, Vice President, and Co-Founder, served more than three years in the United States Army as a Cavalry Scout. He has served one tour overseas in Iraq and was honorably discharged from service in 2013 at the rank of Specialist. Brian holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration with a focus in Entrepreneurship from Illinois State University. He saw HowDoWe as an opportunity to continue to serve others and apply his background in entrepreneurship.

       

      RISKS & CHALLENGES

      Provided that our primary goals are to partner with public schools to identify improvement projects and then to attract donors to support these projects, our risks/challenges can be broken down into two categories School-related risks and Donor-related risks.

      School-related risks:
      Larger public school programs, for good reason, have more stringent processes in place that dictate how fundraisers are to be conducted. Luckily, thus far in our interactions with schools, we have not found our processes to be in violation of any of these guidelines. It is possible that we may run into school systems that may have fundraising protocols that contradict with our funding procedures. For instance, schools must have access to a school run bank account in order for donor funds to be properly delivered. Schools must be able to access these accounts to pay for the execution of the improvement project for which the funds were raised. If funds are not accessible to schools on an individual level, it can slow down the progress of the project, or even prevent us from being able to deliver the funds. Again, in our communications with schools, though, each seem to be open to the idea of creating new pathways to make sure that funds can be received and allocated to the school projects in an efficient manner. 

      Our platform is also designed so that all funds collected for a specific project are delivered to the school at the end of the fundraising timeline, even if the project was not fully funded. Schools, as they follow our project preparation instructions, create backup plans for the funds if the target amount is not reached. For example, if a school is trying to refurbish a library, and they do not reach their goals, their backup plan can be to use the funds to buy new books for the library. We realize that not all projects can be broken up into smaller pieces, and funded in parts if the full goal is not reached. As an example, large machinery like HVAC units might need to be paid for with the full funding amount. To combat this challenge, we work with each school individually to create sufficient back up plans that aligns with the benefits of the original project goals.

      Donor-related risks:
      Donors must always keep in mind that, although donations to qualified organizations like public schools and 501(c)3 nonprofits are recognized as being tax-deductible by the Internal Revenue Service, individual circumstances may apply and a qualified tax-professional should be consulted beforehand. HowDoWe oversees the delivery of funds from a donor’s credit/debit card to the bank accounts of the public schools, while only collecting a small transaction fee of 8% per donation. Donors are then presented with a receipt for the donation that may be referenced on their tax return. 

      As more public schools create profiles, and as more improvement projects are added to the platform, HowDoWe will have to work to continue to spread awareness and attract more donors to the website. To captivate the attention of donors at the onset, we will execute a large scale marketing campaign to attract media attention to our cause at the launch of the first posted school project. We’ve also developed a simple distribution system that makes students, their parents, and members of the local community aware of the details of the improvement projects being launched at the school, and invites them to be a part of making a positive impact on local-area students. In addition to these efforts, HowDoWe will maintain an active social media, news and blog presence to drive conversations on the issues of education reform, school funding, advancing the learning environment, and other related topics.

For instance, schools must have access to a school run bank account in order for donor funds to be properly delivered. Schools must be able to access these accounts to pay for the execution of the improvement project for which the funds were raised. If funds are not accessible to schools on an individual level, it can slow down the progress of the project, or even prevent us from being able to deliver the funds. Again, in our communications with schools, though, each seem to be open to the idea of creating new pathways to make sure that funds can be received and allocated to the school projects in an efficient manner. Our platform is also designed so that all funds collected for a specific project are delivered to the school at the end of the fundraising timeline, even if the project was not fully funded. Schools, as they follow our project preparation instructions, create backup plans for the funds if the target amount is not reached. For example, if a school is trying to refurbish a library, and they do not reach their goals, their backup plan can be to use the funds to buy new books for the library. We realize that not all projects can be broken up into smaller pieces, and funded in parts if the full goal is not reached. As an example, large machinery like HVAC units might need to be paid for with the full funding amount. To combat this challenge, we work with each school individually to create sufficient back up plans that aligns with the benefits of the original project goals.Donor-related risks:Donors must always keep in mind that, although donations to qualified organizations like public schools and 501(c)3 nonprofits are recognized as being tax-deductible by the Internal Revenue Service, individual circumstances may apply and a qualified tax-professional should be consulted beforehand. HowDoWe oversees the delivery of funds from a donor’s credit/debit card to the bank accounts of the public schools, while only collecting a small transaction fee of 8% per donation. Donors are then presented with a receipt for the donation that may be referenced on their tax return. As more public schools create profiles, and as more improvement projects are added to the platform, HowDoWe will have to work to continue to spread awareness and attract more donors to the website. To captivate the attention of donors at the onset, we will execute a large scale marketing campaign to attract media attention to our cause at the launch of the first posted school project. We’ve also developed a simple distribution system that makes students, their parents, and members of the local community aware of the details of the improvement projects being launched at the school, and invites them to be a part of making a positive impact on local-area students. In addition to these efforts, HowDoWe will maintain an active social media, news and blog presence to drive conversations on the issues of education reform, school funding, advancing the learning environment, and other related topics.

story:
Prior to the inception of TradeAids.com, there was no platform or tool for industry to reach out to help the trade school teacher with acquiring much-needed materials and supplies.  HEADLINE NEWS: Even our public school system (grades 1-12) has 77% of all schools reaching out to crowd funding for their basic needs (according to donorschoose.org, a site dedicated to public school teachers grades 1-12).

 

TradeAids.com is on a mission.  A very passionate mission. By giving Trade School lab classes the attention that University lab classes get, the Trade Aids website will make a trade school education as exciting an opportunity as 4-year university degree programs.

 

There is a problem: A major industry concern is the ongoing (10 years+) shortage of trained tradespeople. An even greater shortfall is projected for the future. The YouTube news report below helps explain.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1xZn9fSpAjs

 

During the 2018 President’s State of the union speech the President said -

“As tax cuts create new jobs, let us invest in workforce development and job training. Let us open great vocational schools so our future workers can learn a craft and realize their full potential. And let us support working families by supporting paid family leave.”

 

There is a solution to this problem and Trade Aids is going to play a large role in making it happen. To date I have personally invested over $20,000 of my own money getting this mission started.  With your financial help of just one third of what I've spent, TradeAids.com can become self-sustaining.

 

IMPORTANT NOTE ON OUR FUNDING GOAL: If our fund raising goal isn't met within 60 days, this crowd funding page will automatically be deactivated by IndieGoGo. By meeting the goal this crowd-funding site can stay up and we can continue soliciting more needs as they arise.  This will also allow time for the completion of our IRS 501(c)3 Non-Profit Organization application. Trade Aids is on the way to 501(c)3 status, but needs to hang on financially until that happens.

 

Please consider helping Trade Aids reach this critical goal. Will you help?

 

This entire mission is about the end goal.  The players to make this happen are out there.  You're one of them. Please donate if you can. However if you can't and you believe in our mission, there is another critical way to help. We need to convince industry (contractors, wholesalers, manufacturers) that trade schools classrooms are a place where people can find hope, realize dreams, and build careers. This next generation of tradespeople will play a large role in rebuilding America. All this from the materials that industry is currently throwing away or has lying around in the corner of a building somewhere.   

 

Because Trade School lab classes will have everything needed for *every* student to practice their craft, graduates will be true skilled craftspeople. Industry involvement by contractors, wholesalers and manufacturers will make that happen. Unfortunately, the picture below depicts a common scenario.  Our goal is to have better craftspeople, not graduates skilled at taking notes.

 

I have taught Trade Classes many times over the course of my career.  I've seen the smiles on the faces of students who get to practice their craft in lab class, and I've seen them graduate.  I've also seen the looks on the faces of the students who didn't get to practice during lab classes because of material shortages.  Those students often will not even stay at their lab stations.  Their frustration levels are high. Our goal is more smiling faces and more graduates.

 

Trade Aids will lead the way connecting industry (manufacturers, wholesalers, and contractors) with trade schools. This will result in excitement, pride, and personal satisfaction as students transition into skilled craftspeople.

 

I started out in a Trade School myself.  Right out of high school.  That makes this mission very close to my heart.  I know what great Trade Schools (i.e. great educators with the materials they need) can do for people’s lives.  After working with my hands at the craft for 8 years I returned to a four year engineering school. I now design equipment and assist with equipment selections as a profession.  However I never lost that empathy for the student who wants to learn and is excited about it, but doesn't have the materials. 

 

My passion took me so far as to attempt to start a school from the ground up, for the disadvantaged youth on a Caribbean island. It was grass-roots and with no money, but it was a work of passion. I literally begged contractors for old equipment, materials, and old tools. In the end, I couldn't get enough support on that small island and the program died.

 

Assumption clarification on the issue of school supplies

 People think that public schools have the supplies they need.  The truth is that even in the public school system teachers often spend their own money for classroom needs.  Most public schools are underfunded and short on the materials necessary to adequately help students learn.  Trade schools are no different.  Until now, no one has picked up the mission.  We have, we will. 

 

Trade Aids wants this to be a different kind of crowd-funding site. We want to fund Trade Schools through donations of materials *directly* so that students have everything needed to learn their craft. Currently, industry has everything trade school teachers and students need.  Unfortunately, the common trend is to simply throw it away in their company dumpsters. Right now the immediate need is financial help getting the TradeAids.com system of material donation running smoothly. We would love for you to be a part of the Trade Aids vision.

story:
Meet Kanza Vina

Kanza is a young transgender who is now dedicating herself in an organization for young waria (young transgenders) in Jabodetabek (Jakarta, Bogor, Depok, Tangerang, and Bekasi), which advocate young transgenders attain their rights and fight the stigma, violence, and discrimination that have been done to them by state or non-state actors. 

She walked her past life in hardship by becoming a sex worker. She had to face the gangsters, some of them are law enforcement, and the pressure of society and her close ones which made her mentally oppressed. Her past experience drives her to keep fighting for the rights of people that have the same experience with her. She determined herself to make a better condition for young transgenders by helping them acquire some life-skills that could be useful and make them more acceptable in society. 

She joined Sanggar SWARA (Organization that advocates human rights for young transgender in Jabodetabek) after she participated in a program, held by sanggar SWARA, called Transchool. She was one of the finalists in 2011. Since then she started to understand that transgenders also have the same rights with the other citizens, including rights to be free from stigma, violence, and discrimination in everything. 

Now Kanza Vina fills up Program Manager position in Sanggar SWARA and also Chair of the committee of TRANSCHOOL 2016. This positions feeds her passion on empowerment of young transgenders in Indonesia, especially in Jakarta, Bogor, Depok, Tangerang, and Bekasi. 

In 26 August 2016, she represented Indonesia LGBTIQ Forum to receive an award from a reputable journalist alliance, Independent Journalist Alliance (AJI). In her speech, she told the audience about the bitterness that she had been through which subsequently motivated her to fight for justice in this country. 

Transchool is an alternative school for young transgender women in indonesia to create many more high achieving young transgender like Kanza Vina in Indonesia.

The government of Indonesia is now formulating a regulation to criminalize LGBTI in Indonesia, So transchool can be an activity that can bring the light in this phase of the nation's crackdown that is faced by LGBTI community, particularly transgender community in Indonesia. 

 

TRANSCHOOL

This project requires at least  US $30,000 for the activities that cause great impact on young transgender women’s life in Indonesia (5% for Indiegogo campaign fee)

You can download our proposal here

Transchool is an alternate school for young transwomen that combining the in and out class, internship, as described below;

Vision: Transwomen Community are independent, healthy, empowered in the context of human rights, gender equity, and sexuality to the creation of the community's understanding of diversity.

Mission: Reduced stigma, violence and discrimination on young transwomen Jakarta, Bogor, Depok, and Tanggerang area.

Goals: Improve the bargaining position of young transwomen in the Jabodetabek areas in advocating for their rights as citizens of Indonesia.

Objectives:

  1. Increasing capacity of young transwomen in the Jabodetabek area in the field of sexuality, advocacy, legal and human rights.
  2. Increasing solidarity and collectivity young transwomen in the Jabodetabek area.
  3. Increasing understanding of problems related to network young transwomen in Jabodetabek area.
  4. Increasing the capacity of Sanggar SWARA to empowering the community.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We really appreciate any kind of support that you give for the success of this project, because no matter how small your contribution, it matters for the better future of young transgender community life in Indonesia, especially in Jabodetabek (Jakarta, Bogor, Depok, Tangerang, Bekasi) and the other regions.

Even if you are unable to contribute financially, there are other ways in which you can help further support Indonesia Young Transgender Women (Waria):

  1. Help us share this campaign to your colleague and network so they know that they can contribute for this event. (please use the Indiegogo SHARE tools)
  2. Get along with us to support the campaign against any kind of stigma, violence, and discrimination and criminalization that threatened LGBTI community in Indonesia
  3. Use hashtags #sanggarSWARA #TRANSCHOOL2016 #WariaIndonesia #TransgenderIndonesia #LGBTIndonesia #TDORID2016 in every social media.

 

​About Sanggar SWARA

Sanggar SWARA is implementary of Transchool, a member based association that has been acknowledged by the Government of Indonesia as an NGO which focuses on advocacy for young transwoman in Jakarta, Bogor, Depok, Tanggerang, and Bekasi (Jabodetabek) areas.

Sanggar SWARA was formed in June 2006 as a sub-program of Srikandi Sejati Foundation with a focus on reproductive health issues related to HIV and AIDS. Over time, Sanggar SWARA realize the reality in the grass root that the needs of transwomen adolescents are different needs from adult Transwoman. Young Transwoman community faced the problem not only issues related to health issues and HIV and AIDS, but also includes issues of sexuality, self-acceptance, stigma, violence, discrimination and human rights.

Vision of Sanggar SWARA is:

"Community transwomen are independent, healthy, empowered within the framework of human rights, gender equity, and sexuality to establishment of the public's understanding of diversity".

Sanggar SWARA missions are:

  1. Increase the capacity of SWARA organizations to be more empowered, independent and sustainable.
  2. Increasing community empowerment in realizing the right to health in general as well as sexual and reproductive health in particular.
  3. Strengthen the network, support, and cooperation between SWARA with relevant stakeholders.
  4. Promote the elimination of stigma and discrimination against transwoman community.
  5. Support the efforts of education on health, gender, sexuality, and human rights to the transwomen community and society.

Sanggar SWARA has goal to "Availability of the platform for young transwomen in order to increase their potential, knowledge, and understanding of sexuality from the perspective of human rights and gender equality".

Sanggar SWARA activities include; Assistance and Outreach, Training and Empowerment (Transchool, Training PE / peer education, Training Gender and Human Rights, Monthly Discussion Routinely, and Discussion in the Hotspot), Edutainment, Networking and Advocacy, Publications IEC materials, Economic Empowerment, Make Up and dance team training, and SWARA’s Cooperative.

Activities under this campaign is specifically related to Transchool which is part of the Strategic Plan 2016-2017 of Sanggar SWARA developed in March 2016 involving all personnel of Sanggar SWARA.

story:
(English / Español)

MUSICAUSTRAL 2017 – Latin American roots music camp

After having successfully done, with the help of some of you, the 1st edition of Musicaustral in January 2016, we continue our mission to create musical encounters with recognized professional musicians to support creativity and empower young minds. Working to provide access to all social classes and cultural backgrounds in order to promote diversity; we combine high education with artistic and cultural activities, healthy life habits and recreation in contact with nature.

The 2nd edition, taking place the 13th of January 2017, is designed for young musicians, aged 18 to 25, to develop and/or deepen their Latin-American musical identity during a 10-day immersion in Frutillar, Chile. We keep working hard with public and private institutions from Canada and Chile to double student’s participation and increase the amount of grants available so that any talent can participate no matter his/her financial situation. 

We will be always grateful for your help supporting us taking this amazing opportunity to as many as young talents possible. 

OUR  MISSION 
•    Develop close working networks between local and recognized international musicians. 
•    Present the global reality of a musical career, and empower young practitioners to develop and establish a professional beginning.
•    Guide the development of life habits to support a sustainable career. 
•    Implement activities to promote the development of Latin American roots music in all social classes.
•    Create activities that integrate the local community in order to promote creativity and cultural development.   
•    Work in collaboration with local institutions to promote the cultural and touristic development of the local region and the country.


A unique aspect of Musicaustral is the daily practice of yoga. An ancient and systematic science that includes breathing exercises, stretches, postures, concentration, relaxation and healthy meals aiming to provide tools to reduce stress and support a healthy career at the emotional and physical level. 

WHERE THE MONEY IS USED

The budget is already 39% funded, the rest of the budget will be covered by the kind donation of private institutions and public grants. Every dollar that you pledge will go towards three major elements:

Participant and Staff Meals     $2,750 
Local Transportation     $1,250 
Instruments / Teaching Material     $1,000 


We are creating a tradition for the enrichment of young musicians, as well as for the international and local community involved: musical teachers, health practitioners, translators, cooks, and project/camp coordinators among others.  


THE IMPACT

In Latin America, there is a musical tendency towards pop, rock, tropical and classical music, leaving aside folkloric roots music. This results in a lack of knowledge about its richness and musical identity. Therefore, we want to catalyze a shift in the vision of Latin American youth and the way that they view folkloric music by creating an accessible tradition, which is fun and enriching for local and international students. While we generate bridges of professional development between Chile and the world, we also aim to change the international view of Latin American music. 


THE TEAM & FOUNDERS 

The Musicaustral team has a diverse background, Chile, Peru, Bolivia, Canada and Venezuela. We have all lived and experience different cultures and countries, which has settled a clear understanding about the impact of unity in diversity. Through the rich diversity found in Latin American roots music we want to empower young musicians minds to help them find their own musical roots. To expand their knowledge by its comprehensive rhythmic, and to dare to create intelligent musical fusions with other styles, those of their interest. 


Daniel Emden | www.danielemden.com: Founder, Artistic director, percussionist and composer
Fabiola Peña | www.yogalabnomad.com: Co-founder, Logistic Director and Yoga Instructor 
Hugo Larenas | www.hugolarenas.wordpress.com:  Guitar teacher  
Sebastien Pellerin:  Improvisation and Double bass teacher 
Willy Ríos | www.willyrios.com: Andean instruments teacher (charango, sikus y quena)
Pedro Díaz  | www.pedrodiaz.ca: Interpretation and voice 
Nicolas Emden | www.nicolasemden.com: Vocal coaching and interpretation

Ángel Parra Orrego | www.angelparraorrego.com: Invited artist for master class & final concert. Chilean guitarist and grandson of Violeta Parra


HOW YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE | YOUR PERKS
We’ve put together an exciting set of perks for you to be an active part of our mission by learning, creating and enjoying similar activities and goodies! 

We encourage you to donate the “EDUCATION package” to young minds interested in music, that could be your soon, your nephew, or friends’ daughter!

 

 

MUSICAUSTRAL – Un campamento de música popular latinoamericana 

Después de haber logrado con la ayuda de muchos de ustedes la primera edición del Campamento Musicaustral en enero 2016, continuamos nuestra misión de crear encuentros musicales con reconocidos músicos profesionales para el desarrollo creativo, artístico y profesional, y la autonomía de jóvenes músicos.

La 2da edición, a realizarse el 13 de enero del 2017, esta dirigida a jóvenes músicos entre 18 y 25 años de edad, para el desarrollo y perfeccionamiento de la música popular latinoamericana durante una inmersión de 10 días, en Frutillar, Chile. Seguimos trabajando con instituciones públicas y privadas de Canadá y Chile para aumentar la participación de los estudiantes y las becas disponibles para que todo el que tenga talento pueda participar sin importar su realidad económica, y así no dejar para se pierdan talentos.

Les estaremos siempre agradecidos por apoyarnos en llevar esta maravillosa oportunidad a la mayoría de jóvenes talentos en Latinoamérica.

NUESTRA MISION 

•    Desarrollar vínculos entre músicos locales y destacados músicos internacionales 

•    Presentar la realidad global de la carrera del músico profesional, y entregar a los jóvenes músicos emergentes herramientas para iniciar una carrera musical sustentable. 

•    Guiar en el desarrollo de hábitos de vida que aportan a una carrera saludable a través de la práctica del yoga y la alimentación sana.

•    Promover la buena convivencia y respeto, dentro de un ambiente promovedor del trabajo colaborativo, que incentiva a la creatividad y el convertir ideas en proyectos por medio de la música.

•    Crear actividades de integración con la comunidad local que potencien la creatividad y desarrollo cultural de los participantes de forma sana y ecológica.

•    Trabajar en colaboración con las instituciones locales promoviendo el desarrollo artístico-cultural y turístico de la región y del país.

Uno de los aspectos importantes de Musicaustral es la práctica diaria del yoga. Una ciencia antigua y sistemáticas que incluye ejercicios de respiración, posturas, concentración, relajación y comidas saludables, ofreciendo herramientas para reducir el stress y promover una carrera saludable a nivel físico y emocional. 

USO DEL DINERO

El 39% de los costos están cubiertos, el resto será cubierto a través del aporte de empresas privadas e instituciones públicas. Toda la contribución financiera recaudada a través de esta campaña será destinada a tres elementos esenciales:

Alimentación     $2,750 
Transporte local     $1,250 
Instrumentos / Material de enseñanza     $1,000 

Estamos creando una tradición para el enriquecimiento de músicos jóvenes, y también para la comunidad local e internacional que está involucrada: profesores de música, profesionales de la salud, intérpretes, cocineros, y coordinadores de proyecto, entre otros.

EL IMPACTO

En Latinoamérica hay una tendencia musical hacia el pop, rock, música tropical y clásica, dejando a un lado la música de raíz folklórica. Esto hace que no se conozca y aprecie su alta riqueza, generando una falta de identidad musical.  
Nosotros deseamos cambiar la visión de los jóvenes latinoamericanos hacia la música folclórica, creando una tradición accesible, entretenida y enriquecedora. Mientras generamos puentes de desarrollo profesional entre Chile y el mundo, estaremos también cambiando la mentalidad internacional hacia la música latinoamericana. 

EL EQUIPO

El equipo de Musicaustral proviene de diversas culturas: Chile, Perú, Bolivia, Canadá y Venezuela. Aportando con sus experiencias y comprensión al impacto positivo de la unión en la diversidad.

A través de la diversidad que se encuentra en la música de raíz latinoamericana queremos enriquecer a músicos jóvenes para ayudarles a encontrar sus propias raíces musicales, y a su vez, crear fusiones inteligentes con otros estilos de su interés, sea lo clásico, pop, rock, etc. 

Daniel Emden | www.danielemden.com: Fundador, Director artístico, percusionista y compositor

Fabiola Peña | www.yogalabnomad.com: Co-fundadora, Logística e Instructora de Yoga

Hugo Larenas | www.hugolarenas.wordpress.com:  Profesor de Guitarra

Sebastien Pellerin:  Profesor de contrabajo e improvisación

Willy Ríos | www.willyrios.com: Profesor de instrumentos andinos (charango, sicus y quena)

Pedro Díaz  | www.pedrodiaz.ca: Profesor de interpretación y voz

Nicolas Emden | www.nicolasemden.com: Coaching vocal e interpretación

Ángel Parra Orrego | www.angelparraorrego.com: Artista invitado para master classes y concierto final. 

COMO CONTRIBUIR | TU RETRIBUCIÓN
Hemos reunido un conjunto interesante de retribuciones para que participes activamente en nuestra misión aprendiendo, creando y disfrutando de actividades y cosas muy entretenidas! 

Te invitamos a contribuir especialmente con el "paquete EDUCACIÓN", así puedes también “regalarle” aprendizaje musical a tus seres cercanos, hijos, sobrinos, ahijados o amigos!

OTRAS MANERAS DE APOYARNOS
•    Publicar y compartir en Facebook e Instagram
•    Hablar con tus amigos sobre el proyecto y animarles a visitar nuestro sitio web
•    Enviar un correo electrónico o re-enviar a tus conocidos los correos que estaremos enviando
•    Compartir con empresas o instituciones que deseen apoyar un proyecto de educación artístico-cultural
•    ¡Participa!
story_txt: (English / Español)MUSICAUSTRAL 2017 – Latin American roots music campAfter having successfully done, with the help of some of you, the 1st edition of Musicaustral in January 2016, we continue our mission to create musical encounters with recognized professional musicians to support creativity and empower young minds. Working to provide access to all social classes and cultural backgrounds in order to promote diversity; we combine high education with artistic and cultural activities, healthy life habits and recreation in contact with nature.The 2nd edition, taking place the 13th of January 2017, is designed for young musicians, aged 18 to 25, to develop and/or deepen their Latin-American musical identity during a 10-day immersion in Frutillar, Chile. We keep working hard with public and private institutions from Canada and Chile to double student’s participation and increase the amount of grants available so that any talent can participate no matter his/her financial situation. We will be always grateful for your help supporting us taking this amazing opportunity to as many as young talents possible. OUR  MISSION •    Develop close working networks between local and recognized international musicians. •    Present the global reality of a musical career, and empower young practitioners to develop and establish a professional beginning.•    Guide the development of life habits to support a sustainable career. •    Implement activities to promote the development of Latin American roots music in all social classes.•    Create activities that integrate the local community in order to promote creativity and cultural development.   •    Work in collaboration with local institutions to promote the cultural and touristic development of the local region and the country.A unique aspect of Musicaustral is the daily practice of yoga. An ancient and systematic science that includes breathing exercises, stretches, postures, concentration, relaxation and healthy meals aiming to provide tools to reduce stress and support a healthy career at the emotional and physical level. WHERE THE MONEY IS USEDThe budget is already 39% funded, the rest of the budget will be covered by the kind donation of private institutions and public grants. Every dollar that you pledge will go towards three major elements:Participant and Staff Meals     $2,750 Local Transportation     $1,250 Instruments / Teaching Material     $1,000 We are creating a tradition for the enrichment of young musicians, as well as for the international and local community involved: musical teachers, health practitioners, translators, cooks, and project/camp coordinators among others.  THE IMPACTIn Latin America, there is a musical tendency towards pop, rock, tropical and classical music, leaving aside folkloric roots music. This results in a lack of knowledge about its richness and musical identity. Therefore, we want to catalyze a shift in the vision of Latin American youth and the way that they view folkloric music by creating an accessible tradition, which is fun and enriching for local and international students. While we generate bridges of professional development between Chile and the world, we also aim to change the international view of Latin American music. THE TEAM & FOUNDERS The Musicaustral team has a diverse background, Chile, Peru, Bolivia, Canada and Venezuela. We have all lived and experience different cultures and countries, which has settled a clear understanding about the impact of unity in diversity. Through the rich diversity found in Latin American roots music we want to empower young musicians minds to help them find their own musical roots. To expand their knowledge by its comprehensive rhythmic, and to dare to create intelligent musical fusions with other styles, those of their interest. Daniel Emden | www.danielemden.com: Founder, Artistic director, percussionist and composerFabiola Peña | www.yogalabnomad.com: Co-founder, Logistic Director and Yoga Instructor Hugo Larenas | www.hugolarenas.wordpress.com:  Guitar teacher  Sebastien Pellerin:  Improvisation and Double bass teacher Willy Ríos | www.willyrios.com: Andean instruments teacher (charango, sikus y quena)Pedro Díaz  | www.pedrodiaz.ca: Interpretation and voice Nicolas Emden | www.nicolasemden.com: Vocal coaching and interpretationÁngel Parra Orrego | www.angelparraorrego.com: Invited artist for master class & final concert. Chilean guitarist and grandson of Violeta ParraHOW YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE | YOUR PERKSWe’ve put together an exciting set of perks for you to be an active part of our mission by learning, creating and enjoying similar activities and goodies! We encourage you to donate the “EDUCATION package” to young minds interested in music, that could be your soon, your nephew, or friends’ daughter!  MUSICAUSTRAL – Un campamento de música popular latinoamericana Después de haber logrado con la ayuda de muchos de ustedes la primera edición del Campamento Musicaustral en enero 2016, continuamos nuestra misión de crear encuentros musicales con reconocidos músicos profesionales para el desarrollo creativo, artístico y profesional, y la autonomía de jóvenes músicos.La 2da edición, a realizarse el 13 de enero del 2017, esta dirigida a jóvenes músicos entre 18 y 25 años de edad, para el desarrollo y perfeccionamiento de la música popular latinoamericana durante una inmersión de 10 días, en Frutillar, Chile. Seguimos trabajando con instituciones públicas y privadas de Canadá y Chile para aumentar la participación de los estudiantes y las becas disponibles para que todo el que tenga talento pueda participar sin importar su realidad económica, y así no dejar para se pierdan talentos.Les estaremos siempre agradecidos por apoyarnos en llevar esta maravillosa oportunidad a la mayoría de jóvenes talentos en Latinoamérica.NUESTRA MISION •    Desarrollar vínculos entre músicos locales y destacados músicos internacionales •    Presentar la realidad global de la carrera del músico profesional, y entregar a los jóvenes músicos emergentes herramientas para iniciar una carrera musical sustentable. •    Guiar en el desarrollo de hábitos de vida que aportan a una carrera saludable a través de la práctica del yoga y la alimentación sana.•    Promover la buena convivencia y respeto, dentro de un ambiente promovedor del trabajo colaborativo, que incentiva a la creatividad y el convertir ideas en proyectos por medio de la música.•    Crear actividades de integración con la comunidad local que potencien la creatividad y desarrollo cultural de los participantes de forma sana y ecológica.•    Trabajar en colaboración con las instituciones locales promoviendo el desarrollo artístico-cultural y turístico de la región y del país.Uno de los aspectos importantes de Musicaustral es la práctica diaria del yoga. Una ciencia antigua y sistemáticas que incluye ejercicios de respiración, posturas, concentración, relajación y comidas saludables, ofreciendo herramientas para reducir el stress y promover una carrera saludable a nivel físico y emocional. USO DEL DINEROEl 39% de los costos están cubiertos, el resto será cubierto a través del aporte de empresas privadas e instituciones públicas. Toda la contribución financiera recaudada a través de esta campaña será destinada a tres elementos esenciales:Alimentación     $2,750 Transporte local     $1,250 Instrumentos / Material de enseñanza     $1,000 Estamos creando una tradición para el enriquecimiento de músicos jóvenes, y también para la comunidad local e internacional que está involucrada: profesores de música, profesionales de la salud, intérpretes, cocineros, y coordinadores de proyecto, entre otros.EL IMPACTOEn Latinoamérica hay una tendencia musical hacia el pop, rock, música tropical y clásica, dejando a un lado la música de raíz folklórica. Esto hace que no se conozca y aprecie su alta riqueza, generando una falta de identidad musical.  Nosotros deseamos cambiar la visión de los jóvenes latinoamericanos hacia la música folclórica, creando una tradición accesible, entretenida y enriquecedora. Mientras generamos puentes de desarrollo profesional entre Chile y el mundo, estaremos también cambiando la mentalidad internacional hacia la música latinoamericana. EL EQUIPOEl equipo de Musicaustral proviene de diversas culturas: Chile, Perú, Bolivia, Canadá y Venezuela. Aportando con sus experiencias y comprensión al impacto positivo de la unión en la diversidad.A través de la diversidad que se encuentra en la música de raíz latinoamericana queremos enriquecer a músicos jóvenes para ayudarles a encontrar sus propias raíces musicales, y a su vez, crear fusiones inteligentes con otros estilos de su interés, sea lo clásico, pop, rock, etc. Daniel Emden | www.danielemden.com: Fundador, Director artístico, percusionista y compositorFabiola Peña | www.yogalabnomad.com: Co-fundadora, Logística e Instructora de YogaHugo Larenas | www.hugolarenas.wordpress.com:  Profesor de GuitarraSebastien Pellerin:  Profesor de contrabajo e improvisaciónWilly Ríos | www.willyrios.com: Profesor de instrumentos andinos (charango, sicus y quena)Pedro Díaz  | www.pedrodiaz.ca: Profesor de interpretación y vozNicolas Emden | www.nicolasemden.com: Coaching vocal e interpretaciónÁngel Parra Orrego | www.angelparraorrego.com: Artista invitado para master classes y concierto final. COMO CONTRIBUIR | TU RETRIBUCIÓNHemos reunido un conjunto interesante de retribuciones para que participes activamente en nuestra misión aprendiendo, creando y disfrutando de actividades y cosas muy entretenidas! Te invitamos a contribuir especialmente con el "paquete EDUCACIÓN", así puedes también “regalarle” aprendizaje musical a tus seres cercanos, hijos, sobrinos, ahijados o amigos!OTRAS MANERAS DE APOYARNOS•    Publicar y compartir en Facebook e Instagram•    Hablar con tus amigos sobre el proyecto y animarles a visitar nuestro sitio web•    Enviar un correo electrónico o re-enviar a tus conocidos los correos que estaremos enviando•    Compartir con empresas o instituciones que deseen apoyar un proyecto de educación artístico-cultural•    ¡Participa!

story:
The Future of Healing -- "Chi, The Sixth Sense"

 

It started with focusing on the writing of a 3-volume book, “The Pull of the Path / The Dao of Transformation.” While doing this we realized that there was an overriding theme with a life of its own that was seeking expression. Since then the project has morphed into something that has its own momentum.

So we have developed an online multi-media platform with texts and audio and galleries, regular blog posts and social media integration, and upcoming instructional videos about dealing with specific ailments, ThePullofThePath.com

At this moment it serves as a launching pad essentially focused on producing “Chi, The Sixth Sense | Vol 1” of the “The Pull of the Path / The Dao of Transformation“ in which we describe the basic concepts needed to understand how to unshackle ourselves from our learned behavior. 

 

Who we are & what we aim for

We, at the Pull of the Path project, are dedicated to the exploration of our human existence, using our body as the ultimate tool.  What we are focused on is enhancing the process of allowing the innate intelligence within our bodies, down to the tiniest cell, to surface and flower.

As a result we have been forced to look at the debilitating effects that the deep imprint of our learned behavior has on our health, well-being and longevity.

To this end we explore different therapeutic approaches from around the world and the underlying principles involved; in what way they enhance or detract from allowing this natural intelligence to surface – including diverse meditation methods; psychological therapies; body techniques like Chi Gung and Tai Chi, Yoga and massage; Acupuncture; shamanism, etc.

 

 

The initiator

Dr. Daniel Santos, USA, is a former Chairman of the New Mexico State Board of Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine. For over 40 years he has been immersed in the study and practice of Acupuncture, Chinese Medicine and various traditions of movement therapy. His training and life experience has given him unique qualifications to understand and communicate how to realign the body and its innate healing mechanisms with the outside world to improve one’s physical well-being and psychological health. He is also the author of 3 books translated into 7 languages. Complete bio, here.

. . .

. . .

 

The Goal

We are launching a crowd-funding campaign, reaching out to friends, like-minded beings, and enthusiasts. If you are so motivated we would be like to invite you to help and support our goal and to spread this information and inspiration.

Now our project is focused on the publication of the 3 volume book “The Pull of the Path / The Dao of Transformation”. We are currently raising funds to publish Volume One “Chi, The Sixth Sense”. This book is set in various exotic locations and culture backgrounds. Written in an easily understandable form it outlines the basic concepts we work with at The Pull of the Path Project. In this volume we introduce some of the main characters— each one of them presenting a different way to access body consciousness to end up with a more comprehensive and integrated view.

The 3 volumes are composed like spirals, each time going deeper. In volume 2 we will go back through the underlying concepts in more depth and start to understand their applications. In this volume body practices and training are detailed. In volume 3, along with another reiteration of the basic concepts, we amplify and focus on the title of the book, “The Pull of the Path / The Dao of Transformation”: how to engage and flow with the evolutionary force that is pulling us on our specific individual path to develop health and well-being.

This book is at the epicenter of our project. We will create a limited deluxe edition of "The Pull of the Path | Vol 1 | Chi, The Sixth Sense" printed on special paper, hand-bound (numbered & signed) as part of this crowd-sourcing campaign.​ Additionally we will produce a regular softcover print edition and an Audio CD containing the complete VOL 1 set of "TPOTP | Chi, The Sixth Sense", read by Dr Daniel Santos. (These products will shipped once available.)

 

(Prototype pictures of Deluxe Edition -- handbound, special paper)

. . .

Additionally we are now offering free regular online sketches, excerpts, audio recordings, regular blog posts & related 3rd party material:

  • The Pull of the Path Vol I Excerpts. Excerpts contain the key ideas of a chapter.
  • The Pull of the Path Vol I Sketches. Sketches try to catch the spirit & atmosphere of a chapter.
  • The Pull of the Path Vol I Audio recordings -- readings by Dr Daniel Santos of excerpts, sketches and some blog posts.
  • Blog posts provide inspiration to explore the spiral that is The Pull of the Path project.
  • Related 3rd party material: links to recommended websites, videos, books, interviews, etc.
  • In the future we will also offer instructional videos for specific ailments.

. . .

We feel extremely grateful for any kind of financial support that you can give to help get this information and inspiration out there.

Or… you could just help us by circulating this information among those whom you think would be interested.

Or even just like our Facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/thepullofthepath/ 

Thanks—The Pull of the Path Project
