story:
TEACHING SPACE AND TIME

MAKE THEM MAD is currently a one-page website describing my first encounter with spatiotemporal training, and what has come out of it. Even making that site much later, I did not realize what I had done. However, the story is true to the facts. Back then, I only had a barely suitable toy, and I wanted to be with my child doing no-matter-what.

The picture shows how the pattern of triangles transforms into the pattern of spirals. A four-year-old can do this.

MAKE THEM MAD is ready to become an online service teaching parents to teach their kids the two-dimensional spatiotemporal patterns. Since you did not navigate away from this page yet, you probably would like to ask why I want kids to learn such a terrifying stuff. Look, nobody else teaches spatiotemporal patterns, and hardly anybody lives off them.

The second my rhetorical assumption is wrong. Not only we all live off spatiotemporal patterns: We are them. Those who don't understand this, suffer the consequences. The first assumption, however, is correct. Schools do not teach spatiotemporal patterns. They don't even teach two-dimensional patterns, so grab the opportunity.

WHAT ARE SPATIOTEMPORAL PATTERNS

Click to see the spatiotemporal pattern. A four-years-old can do it.

Spatiotemporal patterns are the patterns changing and repeating themselves not only in space, but also in time.

The visible pattern on textile is flat and spatial. Making such textile, the loom follows a three-dimensional spatiotemporal pattern. The workers, who run the loom, follow another one (or, at least, their manager thinks they do). Following those Chinese workers, we would notice that they take regular smoke breaks, and they smoke. They also visit the factory canteen, and they chew. I am not going to follow those workers to the bathroom or to the place they call home, but if you think about the farmers growing the food for those workers to eat, and about the factory with its suppliers and wholesalers, you will start seeing our world as a mesh of spatiotemporal patterns.

WHY TEACH SPATIOTEMPORAL PATTERNS

First, they are well worth learning.

Next, the spatiotemporal patterns are unsurpassed frustrators. Even the number of the meaningful patterns on a 10x10 board is big enough to systematically challenge a child and raise a problem solver. Then, for every spatial pattern, there are the scores of spatiotemporal patterns. Youtube video on this page demonstrates 6 ways to build one very common spatial pattern (the same as in MAKE THEM MAD). If a chosen way is too hard, there are easier ways.

Another reason: elementary math is a bunch of spatiotemporal patterns, mostly two-dimensional. They can early, quickly and painlessly teach the art of handling quantities using the positional notation.

The picture shows the same familiar toy teaching numeracy. You can watch spatiotemporal patterns of counting in positional notation with different bases here and here.

The MAKE THEM MAD part is for the ages from 30 months to 4 years. Depending on the available time and on the teacher's ambitions, it can teach the essential skills like handling the pieces and navigating the space, or extend to advanced math concepts like symmetries and affine transformations.

STEREO ARITHMETIC

Stereo arithmetic, what I like to refer to as SHNUMBERS, is arithmetic without the Hindu-Arabic numerals and "math facts". An interactive demonstration STEREO LEARNING shows how it works. You don't need to watch the whole course. This campaign is limited to the pages from 01 to 14 (including the 7 green pages covering long addition, so the total count of the pages is 21).

For over 30 years, I have known and used shnumbers as a booster. The scholastic method of teaching arithmetic is inhuman. Big numbers and long addition take several hours to learn. I taught them to save the children from being tortured with mechanically separated math at schools. For example, kids don't need to learn one-digit "facts" adding one-digit numbers. They can learn them adding 10-digit numbers.

With my American child, I had used shnumbers as a remedy. I have made another website to tell this story too.

With enough resources, I hope to develop an online SHNUMBERS school. SHNUMBER ONE will be the first installment covering quantity and elementary operations, positional systems, long addition, long subtraction and many less demanding issues like, for example, the number spaces. The age span is from 4 to 5 years.

What do the objects on the picture have in common? How would you define this commonality? That's where math and math hating start.

It's not as easy as it may seem. I found that even the educated parents are woefully unprepared to learn a better method to teach numeracy. Guess, most of us wouldn't survive an elementary school one more time. I certainly wouldn't.

One more problem out of thousands: toys. Without toys, stereo arithmetic is more burden than fun. I am ashamed even to call for volunteers because I can't suggest a good toy set to use. The one I have been using is, frankly, a waste of money, but I could not find anything better.

Schoolchildren and parents may play MAKE THEM MAD and SHNUMBERS on computer. Preschoolers should not miss any opportunity to develop their hands and vision.

WHY TEACH ARITHMETIC EARLY

The most important reason for me is: because kids can learn it. It's use it or loose it. I don't rely on school, and not only because school comes way too late. US school's teaching is not an intellectual treat. They garnish it with tons of artificial sweeteners, but every bit of it tells the teacher believes you are stupid and every step requires blind obedience.

The educators killed math, drained it's blood, pushed the body through the sieve, ground the soft tissues, packed the pink substance by weight and stuck on the bureaucratic labels. They fail math. They are drifting away from it, occasionally introducing a higher degree of separation with a new set of labels.

The children who knows the core of what the teachers teach don't have to suffer from school's attitude. I can dethrone the school as the ultimate source of every wisdom. I can explain: the school teaches the bare minimum, that's why the teacher's expectations are so low. You must learn what they teach just to know what everybody else knows. Do what they want and learn on. The real knowledge is not in the classroom. I paid high price to understand this.

Learning numeracy head-on is much more fun. Kids grow proud of their achievements. The boring parts like memorizing the elementary additions become improvements, not prerequisites. The first operations set the metanarrative for the whole arithmetic: the positional notation is tricky to use, but it empowers those who mastered it.

  6  9  7 10 11 15 14 13 12  8
  9 12 10 13 14 18 17 16 15 11
  7 10  8 11 12 16 15 14 13  9
  5  8  6  9 10 14 13 12 11  7
  3  6  4  7  8 12 11 10  9  5
  1  4  2  5  6 10  9  8  7  3
  8 11  9 12 13 17 16 15 14 10
  2  5  3  6  7 11 10  9  8  4
  4  7  5  8  9 13 12 11 10  6
  0  3  1  4  5  9  8  7  6  2

4-year-old stereolearners know how to to navigate two-dimensional space by numbers. They learn "math facts" using charts of addition. The chart above looks like a wreck, but it gives correct answers. Start from the left column and the bottom row to find them.

Leaving out the other reasons, let me give you the least expected one. The world speaks to our children in the language of big numbers. If they don't understand, they learn not to listen. Numeracy is enabling, even more so than literacy. Children who are familiar with big numbers become different learners. They watch different videos and read different books. As soon as they are allowed to look and to listen, they quickly accumulate rich and diverse knowledge.

WHAT'S NEXT

MAKE THEM MAD and SHNUMBER ONE are not even the tip of the iceberg. The tip is SIX PROJECTS: the collection of the websites disclosing various aspects of spatiotemporal pedagogy. I already mentioned some of them. The others are FIREPEGS, CODEPEGS and DEFENSIVE MATH.

FIREPEGS is a prototype software, which allows to build spatiotemporal patterns meshed with each other and run them in real time. This entertaining, educating and problem solving activity can be challenging for the students of any age. FIREPEGS teaches space, time and causality. In plain English, it's all about what kicks what, where and when. That's the foundation of science and engineering.

CODEPEGS is about coding spatiotemporal patterns, and it's not a toy business in any sense. On the contrary, the pattern teach the hardest in this art, the knowledge and skills sorely deficient in today's mass programming culture.

Bigger kids can play with this contraption. I call it the Mount of Addition. Please check with DEFENSIVE MATH to get some idea of what else I teach.

The iceberg comprises the materials, which I, with my perfectionism, can only hope to prepare for publishing sometime. After almost 4 years of working on them privately, the projects outgrew my capacity. The little girl from MAKE THEM MAD is now approaching her 7th birthday zeroing in on long division. Following SHNUMBER ONE are SHNUMBER TWO and SHNUMBER THREE. I am living them every day, and often I can't even keep a diary.

 

Positional notation itself is a treasure chest for learning. It requires to understand all the operations, including exponentiation (I do teach it, and I do not limit the kids to the decimal base). It has all the elementary algebra (I do teach it). Decimal fractions are just around the corner. Combinatorics is here, and we can represent positional notation as a tree. Algorithms and flowcharts come in handy. I am not just naming the topics, I am teaching them. I must do it because stereo arithmetic is too easy. During Summer vacations, I could afford two lessons a day, and I am hungry for something else to teach.

TAKE UP A TOY

A pattern-building toys are sold with the charts of the patterns to copy. I don't think the little girl from MAKE THEM MAD would have built much of anything even when she was 3 years old. I was sitting with her making the spatial patterns temporal, feeding them piece by piece and deciding which piece could be swallowed next.

Following my directions, the little girl on the picture could build this complex pattern.

The fact that early spatiotemporal training leads directly to shnumbers was not immediately obvious to me. I was so baffled, I even posted questions to philosophy newsgroups. It took over two years of searching, contemplating and modeling to understand that the underlying logic in both activities must be the same.

And it's not that I was unfamiliar with spatiotemporal patterns as such. I have been fascinated with them since, at around 14, I got ahold of the school oscilloscope. For many years, I was struggling with spatiotemporal patterns as a computer hardware and software developer, yet only recently, in STEREOLEARNING, I had dared to demonstrate: the question is not how 4-year olds can learn big numbers, but how can they not to learn them.

Questioning my thinking is possible but not productive. Early development is one in a lifetime opportunity. A day without learning is wasted, so get a toy and try. There is nothing to lose because kids thrive on parent's attention. If math was hard for you, it does not have to be hard for your children, but success rate is not an issue yet. If some students will not get us much as I expect, they will be much better off at school anyway.

Six Projects Corp is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit looking for volunteers willing to expose themselves and their children to spatiotemporal training, and then to stereo arithmetic, which quickly leads to the numbers and facts we all learned at schools. Please contact me if you are interested in participating. Please check with MAKE THEM MAD, ROBOPEGS, SHNUMBERS and STEREOLEARNING to make up your mind.

WHO I AM

Once I was officially recognized as a promising mathematician. They taught me accordingly, but I became a computer engineer. After 12 years in hardware software co-design, I started writing for computer press. For 3 years I have served as the editor-in-chief of a major computer weekly magazine. In 1999 I took a job in the US, where I suffered a harrowing and completely unexpected personal catastrophe: Two of my American children went to schools and learned to hate math. I am teaching my last child to prevent another disaster. MAKE THEM MAD and SHNUMBER ONE grew from this lessons.

If you spotted something seriously wrong with my English, please excuse me and let me know. Thank you very much!
story_txt:
TEACHING SPACE AND TIMEMAKE THEM MAD is currently a one-page website describing my first encounter with spatiotemporal training, and what has come out of it. Even making that site much later, I did not realize what I had done. However, the story is true to the facts. Back then, I only had a barely suitable toy, and I wanted to be with my child doing no-matter-what.The picture shows how the pattern of triangles transforms into the pattern of spirals. A four-year-old can do this.MAKE THEM MAD is ready to become an online service teaching parents to teach their kids the two-dimensional spatiotemporal patterns. Since you did not navigate away from this page yet, you probably would like to ask why I want kids to learn such a terrifying stuff. Look, nobody else teaches spatiotemporal patterns, and hardly anybody lives off them.The second my rhetorical assumption is wrong. Not only we all live off spatiotemporal patterns: We are them. Those who don't understand this, suffer the consequences. The first assumption, however, is correct. Schools do not teach spatiotemporal patterns. They don't even teach two-dimensional patterns, so grab the opportunity.
WHAT ARE SPATIOTEMPORAL PATTERNS

Click to see the spatiotemporal pattern. A four-years-old can do it.
Spatiotemporal patterns are the patterns changing and repeating themselves not only in space, but also in time.
The visible pattern on textile is flat and spatial. Making such textile, the loom follows a three-dimensional spatiotemporal pattern. The workers, who run the loom, follow another one (or, at least, their manager thinks they do). Following those Chinese workers, we would notice that they take regular smoke breaks, and they smoke. They also visit the factory canteen, and they chew. I am not going to follow those workers to the bathroom or to the place they call home, but if you think about the farmers growing the food for those workers to eat, and about the factory with its suppliers and wholesalers, you will start seeing our world as a mesh of spatiotemporal patterns.
WHY TEACH SPATIOTEMPORAL PATTERNSFirst, they are well worth learning.Next, the spatiotemporal patterns are unsurpassed frustrators. Even the number of the meaningful patterns on a 10x10 board is big enough to systematically challenge a child and raise a problem solver. Then, for every spatial pattern, there are the scores of spatiotemporal patterns. Youtube video on this page demonstrates 6 ways to build one very common spatial pattern (the same as in MAKE THEM MAD). If a chosen way is too hard, there are easier ways.Another reason: elementary math is a bunch of spatiotemporal patterns, mostly two-dimensional. They can early, quickly and painlessly teach the art of handling quantities using the positional notation.The picture shows the same familiar toy teaching numeracy. You can watch spatiotemporal patterns of counting in positional notation with different bases here and here.The MAKE THEM MAD part is for the ages from 30 months to 4 years. Depending on the available time and on the teacher's ambitions, it can teach the essential skills like handling the pieces and navigating the space, or extend to advanced math concepts like symmetries and affine transformations.STEREO ARITHMETICStereo arithmetic, what I like to refer to as SHNUMBERS, is arithmetic without the Hindu-Arabic numerals and "math facts". An interactive demonstration STEREO LEARNING shows how it works. You don't need to watch the whole course. This campaign is limited to the pages from 01 to 14 (including the 7 green pages covering long addition, so the total count of the pages is 21).For over 30 years, I have known and used shnumbers as a booster. The scholastic method of teaching arithmetic is inhuman. Big numbers and long addition take several hours to learn. I taught them to save the children from being tortured with mechanically separated math at schools. For example, kids don't need to learn one-digit "facts" adding one-digit numbers. They can learn them adding 10-digit numbers.With my American child, I had used shnumbers as a remedy. I have made  another website to tell this story too.With enough resources, I hope to develop an online SHNUMBERS school. SHNUMBER ONE will be the first installment covering quantity and elementary operations, positional systems, long addition, long subtraction and many less demanding issues like, for example, the number spaces. The age span is from 4 to 5 years.What do the objects on the picture have in common? How would you define this commonality? That's where math and math hating start.It's not as easy as it may seem. I found that even the educated parents are woefully unprepared to learn a better method to teach numeracy. Guess, most of us wouldn't survive an elementary school one more time. I certainly wouldn't.One more problem out of thousands: toys. Without toys, stereo arithmetic is more burden than fun. I am ashamed even to call for volunteers because I can't suggest a good toy set to use. The one I have been using is, frankly, a waste of money, but I could not find anything better.Schoolchildren and parents may play MAKE THEM MAD and SHNUMBERS on computer. Preschoolers should not miss any opportunity to develop their hands and vision.WHY TEACH ARITHMETIC EARLYThe most important reason for me is: because kids can learn it. It's use it or loose it. I don't rely on school, and not only because school comes way too late. US school's teaching is not an intellectual treat. They garnish it with tons of artificial sweeteners, but every bit of it tells the teacher believes you are stupid and every step requires blind obedience.The educators killed math, drained it's blood, pushed the body through the sieve, ground the soft tissues, packed the pink substance by weight and stuck on the bureaucratic labels. They fail math. They are drifting away from it, occasionally introducing a higher degree of separation with a new set of labels.The children who knows the core of what the teachers teach don't have to suffer from school's attitude. I can dethrone the school as the ultimate source of every wisdom. I can explain: the school teaches the bare minimum, that's why the teacher's expectations are so low. You must learn what they teach just to know what everybody else knows. Do what they want and learn on. The real knowledge is not in the classroom. I paid high price to understand this.Learning numeracy head-on is much more fun. Kids grow proud of their achievements. The boring parts like memorizing the elementary additions become improvements, not prerequisites. The first operations set the metanarrative for the whole arithmetic: the positional notation is tricky to use, but it empowers those who mastered it.  6  9  7 10 11 15 14 13 12  8  9 12 10 13 14 18 17 16 15 11  7 10  8 11 12 16 15 14 13  9  5  8  6  9 10 14 13 12 11  7  3  6  4  7  8 12 11 10  9  5  1  4  2  5  6 10  9  8  7  3  8 11  9 12 13 17 16 15 14 10  2  5  3  6  7 11 10  9  8  4  4  7  5  8  9 13 12 11 10  6  0  3  1  4  5  9  8  7  6  24-year-old stereolearners know how to to navigate two-dimensional space by numbers. story:
Why is the FSRL program crucial?  There are over 1.1 million people in Haiti with disabilities —  but there are as yet no Haitian OTs or PTs who graduated from a Haitian university with a professional degree.

There are good programs for rehabilitation technicians in Haiti, and there are about 50 Haitian physical therapists who received their education in the Dominican Republic.    There are many foreign volunteers who come for brief periods of time.
 But the heart of the professions is absent: Haitian therapists providing appropriate care for Haitian people with disabilities.

TIMES ARE CHANGING!
HOWEVER, the times, they are a'changing in Haiti!  There is now a government ministry charged with developing inclusion for persons with disabilities (BSEIPH).  A law requiring universal access for government buildings has been passed!  Another university in Haiti, UNIFA, has started a master's degree program for PTs, There are professional associations for PTs and even for OTs, brand new!  It is an exciting time to be in Haiti, to catch the wave of progress. 

FSRL IS IN THE FIRST WAVE OF PROFESSIONAL EDUCATION!
I am the acting dean of the Faculté des Sciences de Réhabilitation de Léogâne, FSRL.  Our first students have completed their freshman year and are heading into therapy-specific courses in the year ahead.
 We already have an opportunity to hire a Haitian dean, which would make one of our dreams come true.  Having the right person leading the administration of this program is crucial.  Haitian therapy for Haitians and by Haitians is the goal.

WHAT WE NEED: 

  • We will need $50,000 US during the academic year ahead, to pay our operating expenses. For this campaign, during the month of August 2016, we hope to raise the first $20,000 of that amount.  We can do it!  Because...

WHAT WE HAVE;

  • We already HAVE a MATCHING GRANT of $10,000 US, from Dr. Virginia Shiller, Yale psychologist, in honor of her mother's generous nature.
A MOTHER'S LEGACY


Anna Marie Walter Faulstich, who passed away in February 2016 at the age of 94, was a humble, frugal, kind and thoughtful woman. Mrs. Faulstich earned a bachelor’s degree in mathematics and had a life-long love of music. A devout Catholic woman, she was very concerned about the needs of others. She expressed the wish that savings she was able to leave as an inheritance not only benefit her eight children and 15 grandchildren, but also be used to aid those in need.

All funds up to $10,000 will be matched, dollar for dollar, by Dr. Virginia Shiller.  $100 becomes $200, and $500 becomes $1000!

Dr. Shiller hopes that her mother's generosity will inspire a similar outpouring of gifts!


Check out the NEWS UPDATE!   We have just received 2 gifts of scholarships for entering students!

Here is a statement from one of our donors about here experience in Haiti and her motivation for her gift.

Maureen Jesuthasan, parishoner at St. Paul and the Redeemer parish in
Chicago, has given funds for a scholarship in the name of her
grandmother, Mary Elizabeth O'Dowd.  Here is her explanation for her
inspiration, in her own words:"
"My first night in Haiti was spent at FSIL\FSRL, which in my opinion was an oasis among the chaos that is Port Au Prince. While touring your school, I happened across the syllabus for First Year FSRL students; the document outlined a well structured & intense curriculum that truly impressed me.  The next morning our group left for Tom Gateau; this is where I found the inspiration for funding a FSRL scholarship. Upon arriving at our destination, I met several young men just hanging out alongside the main road; these men later joined us in our walk to St. Patrick's church. One of the men, was the Son of the land owner that hosts St. Patrick's Church and school. After a beautiful day of worship and fellowship, I had the privilege of resuming my initial conversation with this young man.
During our time, he shared that due to the authenticity of the day, it made him think about his future. He shared that the vision that he had for his future could only come from hard work.  I then asked him what his vision for his future looked like and he looked at me and replied, "......wonderful."

And that is how the idea of establishing a scholarship was born.  As I traveled throughout Haiti, I could not help but notice the number of people that I saw with nowhere to go (i.e. school, work, etc.). I also learned that it very common for people to end their education upon the conclusion of the 6th grade....It is my belief that instead of large endowments to the country, Haiti can only be "saved" by investing in one person at a time."

MEET SOME OF OUR INCOMING FACULTY MEMBERS, AND HEAR WHY THEY ARE VOLUNTEERING TO TEACH A COURSE IN THE COMING YEAR!

Claudia Medeiros, PT, DPT

Keiser University, Miami, FL, faculty

I have always looked for opportunities to serve the profession of physical therapy beyond the boundaries of the United States and I am very grateful for the opportunity presented by FSRL. Being a guest faculty for two weeks has allowed me embrace challenges that have enriched me personally and in my role as  physical therapy educator. It has sure widened my professional horizons and l look forward to teaching again in Léogâne next year!


Sarah Kauk, DPT

University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill alumna

Sarah Cline, PT, DPT

Medical U. of South Carolina alumna


Mme R.E Cross, BSc, MSCP, dip Humanitarian Assistance. 

University of Teesside - England Great Britain alumna

Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine - graduate student

15 years into my clinical career as a MSK physiotherapist I volunteered to work in Haiti post earth quake 2010. 

As a result of that experience I can't think of a better way to improve rehabilitation for the Haitian people but to train Haitian physiotherapists in Haiti, to the highest international standard, set by the WCPT.

To this end I have redirected my life. 

I spent the last six years changing my career, increasing my training through further degrees and diplomas, visiting the country, refining my French and learning my Kreyol, in order to become responsibly qualified to be an educator on the first Haitian Physiotherapy Degree training programme.


Autumn Marshall, MS, OTR/L

Gannon University, Erie, Pennsylvania alumna

I have chosen to help teach at FSRL as I have a heart and passion for training nationals in Haiti to be therapists. Over the last 9 years I have seen the great need this country has for therapists and FSRL is the first school to offer this specific type and level of training! I feel blessed to get to play a small part in teaching. 


Linda Robinson MS, PT

University of Indianapolis alumna

Ever since my first trip to Haiti as part of a medical missions team, I realized their great need for Haitian therapists. I was able to help many people on my trips there each year with an emphasis on training the Haitians to care for themselves. While having teams come in to provide care is beneficial for the short term, it is not a long term solution to their health care needs. My dream from that first trip was to develop Haitian therapists, so I have looked over the last 5 years for ways to be involved in that process. I am looking forward to getting started!!


Renee Brown, PT, PhD

Belmont University

Professor and chair, Belmont School of Physical Therapy

David Morrisette, PT, PhD, OCS, ATC

Fellow, American Academy of Orthopaedic Physical Therapists

Medical University of South Carolina faculty


Teresa Plummer, PhD, OTR/L, ATP, CEAS, CAPS

Assistant Professor,School of Occupational Therapy, Belmont University

I visited FSRL in November and had the opportunity to teach a brief inter-disciplinary class with my fellow faculty members Sabrina Sullenberger and Sara Camp. I was immediately struck by the sense of eagerness and enthusiasm each student demonstrated. As I traveled about the county that week it was so apparent that there is such a tremendous need for trained therapists in Haiti. I am honored and privileged to be invited to contribute in any and every way I can to advance the profession of occupational therapy in Haiti. In so doing, we advance compassion, humanity and grace.


Russell Woodman PT, MS, DPT, FSOM, MCTA, OCS 

Quinnipiac University Professor Emeritus -

Diagnostic Imaging


Wadson Michel, MSW

I attended Binghamton University, Syracuse University and Lesley University. 

 I decided to accept this challenge, to write and present a course at FSRL in the first OT and PT bachelor’s programs in Haiti, because I strongly agree that higher education is fundamental to foster sustainable development in Haiti. We are equipping the dedicated OT & PT students with advanced tools and best practices to promote effective humanistic care!

JulieBooth, PT, DPT, PCS
Quinnipiac University, Hamden, Connecticut
I am honored to have been asked to assist with the development of the PT curriculum at FSRL.  Approximately 6 years ago I went to Haiti for my first time as a volunteer PT.  During this trip I realized how dire the need was for local Haitian healthcare providers. The system of providing outside volunteers was not sustainable for the needs of the people of Haiti.  I am so excited for the continuing opportunity to be involved in the development of the programs and to teach at FSRL. The students are absolutely amazing and so genuinely interested in learning and passionate about their futures as occupational or physical therapists.  I know as I teach in the program I will be learning as much as the students.

years into my clinical career as a MSK physiotherapist I volunteered to work in
Haiti post earth quake 2010. 
As a
result of that experience I can't think of a better way to improve
rehabilitation for the Haitian people but to train Haitian physiotherapists in
Haiti, to the highest international standard, set by the WCPT.
To
this end I have redirected my life. 

I
spent the last six years changing my career, increasing my training through
further degrees and diplomas, visiting the country, refining my French and
learning my Kreyol, in order to become responsibly qualified to be an educator
on the first Haitian Physiotherapy Degree training programme. 



Autumn
Marshall, MS, OTR/L
Gannon
University, Erie, Pennsylvania alumna

I
have chosen to help teach at FSRL as I have a heart and passion for training
nationals in Haiti to be therapists. Over the last 9 years I have seen the
great need this country has for therapists and FSRL is the first school to
offer this specific type and level of training! I feel blessed to get to
play a small part in teaching. 

Linda
Robinson MS, PT


University
of Indianapolis alumna



Ever
since my first trip to Haiti as part of a medical missions team, I realized
their great need for Haitian therapists. I was able to help many people on my
trips there each year with an emphasis on training the Haitians to care for
themselves. While having teams come in to provide care is beneficial for the
short term, it is not a long term solution to their health care needs. My dream
from that first trip was to develop Haitian therapists, so I have looked over
the last 5 years for ways to be involved in that process. I am looking forward
to getting started!!

Renee Brown, PT, PhD


Belmont University 
Professor and chair, Belmont School of Physical Therapy
David Morrisette,
PT, PhD, OCS, ATC
Fellow, American
Academy of Orthopaedic Physical Therapists
Medical University
of South Carolina faculty

Teresa Plummer,
PhD, OTR/L, ATP, CEAS, CAPS



Assistant Professor,School of Occupational Therapy, Belmont University
I
 visited FSRL in November and had the opportunity to teach a brief 
inter-disciplinary class with my fellow faculty members Sabrina 
Sullenberger
and Sara Camp. I was immediately struck by the sense of eagerness and 
enthusiasm each student demonstrated. As I traveled about the county 
that week it was so apparent that there is such a tremendous need for 
trained therapists in Haiti. I am honored and privileged
to be invited to contribute in any and every way I can to advance the 
profession of occupational therapy in Haiti. In so doing, we advance 
compassion, humanity and grace.
 Russell Woodman PT, MS, DPT, FSOM, MCTA, OCS  
Quinnipiac University Professor Emeritus -
Diagnostic Imaging


Wadson Michel, MSW
I attended Binghamton University, Syracuse University and Lesley University. 





 I decided to accept this challenge, to 
write and present a course at FSRL in the first OT and PT bachelor’s 
programs in Haiti, because I strongly agree that higher education is 
fundamental to foster sustainable development in Haiti.
We are equipping the dedicated OT & PT students with advanced tools 
and best practices to promote effective humanistic care!

JulieBooth, PT, DPT, PCSQuinnipiac University, Hamden, ConnecticutI am honored to have been asked to assist with the development of the PT curriculum at FSRL.  Approximately 6 years ago I went to Haiti for my first time as a volunteer PT.  During this trip I realized how dire the need was for local Haitian healthcare providers. The system of providing outside volunteers was not sustainable for the needs of the people of Haiti.  I am so excited for the continuing opportunity to be involved in the development of the programs and to teach at FSRL. The students are absolutely amazing and so genuinely interested in learning and passionate about their futures as occupational or physical therapists.  I know as I teach in the program I will be learning as much as the students.

story:
Short Summary

RevelNation Enterprises Inc. is a budding IT, Production, and Media company launching a comprehensive streaming platform featuring niche communities, REVELU & REVELONE. 

REVELU is an educational and entertainment streaming community featuring dedicated channels to every school, college, and university throughout the world. PLAYU is our version of Tik Tok and WhatsApp combined which we are using as an enrollment integration for students, faculty, and alumni into REVELU. PLAYU is scheduled to launch in December of 2020. REVELU is scheduled to launch in January of 2021. 

REVELONE is an educational and entertainment streaming community featuring dedicated channels to all first responders such as hospitals, EMS, police, and fire stations bridging the media communication gap with local, state, and federal agencies. REVELONE is scheduled to launch in April of 2021. 

RevelNation Enterprises Inc. has partnered with Infinancial Corporation (www.infinac.com), a seasoned IT company with accredited testimonials from IBM, Mercedes Benz, and Caterpillar just to name a few. In order to best collaborate with their vast network of IT developers, RevelNation Enterprises Inc. is upgrading key components of its infrastructure. 

 

Assets:

  • www.revelnationinc.com
  • www.revelll.com
  • www.infinac.com
  • www.revelu.live
  • www.revelone.live
  • www.reveleye.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

RevelNation Enterprises Inc. is seeking $75,000 for infrastructure, specifically for the following items:

  • 10 new state of the art computers 
  • streaming and development studio 
  • operational expenses

RevelNation Enterprises Inc. is offering the following in return: 

  • access to our beta platforms (NDA & non-circumvent required)
  • beta advisory board recognition via our website (www.revelnationinc.com)
  • brand ambassador recognition via our website and media
  • RevelNation swag package (t-shirt & hat) for contribution of $50+

RevelNation Enterprises Inc. will dedicate 100% of all funds towards the items listed above, regardless of amount raised.

 

The Impact

Having recently met with the White House correspondent responsible for economic development and remote education for all Native American Indian reservations, we are certain REVELU is a gamechanger for every tribe across North America. Furthermore, after interviewing dozens of students, parents, faculty, and coaches throughout the United States, the demand for our supply is clearly overwhelming. We excel in providing remote education, scholastic resources, media, and production centered around campus content more than any other entity to date.   

After meeting with upper brass of the US Navy from the Pentagon, RevelNation Enterprises Inc. will be providing a dedicated channel on REVELNATION STREAMING enhancing their research and development, acquisitions, and recruitment throughout the United States.

RevelNation Enterprises Inc. is uniquely solving the media communication gap within niche communities on dedicated secure streaming platforms. Our provisional patents, trademarks, and intellectual properties are ahead of the global IT curve. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Covid-19 has presented unforeseen challenges to every educational institution abroad. REVELU is the antidote for such challenges. Although REVELU has been in development previous to Covid-19, the need for REVELU has grown exponentially. Our only risk is future competition. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • interview via a video recorded zoom call providing feedback of our REVELU platform. 
  • like & follow us on social media:
    • www.facebook.com/REVELNATIONINC
    • www.instagram/REVELNATIONINC
    • www.linkedin.com/REVELNATION
    • www.youtube.com/REVELNATIONENTERPRISESINC
  • share our campaign on your social media as well as within Indegogo!

story:
SUMMARY

Everyone likes to play games! And so do your trainees. So, why not use games for your training assignments to get the best results?

Welcome to James.Games! The world’s most engaging knowledge testing platform. We massively increase trainee engagement and content retention by brilliantly mixing the brain-boosting power of games with training content.

Once on the platform, your trainees play short mini-games that are easy and engaging. It allows them to concentrate fully on the question which appears after they played the game for a few moments. After answering the question correctly they earn points and badges, and then the game continues. This entire experience lasts less than 10 minutes and the results are amazing!

Our training method allows all participants to record the content more easily. At the same time, James.Games keeps all trainees highly motivated throughout the training process. This way you can make everyone enthusiastic about the material in advance, strengthen the content during the training or test the newly acquired knowledge afterwards.

Play Games

James.Games is extremely effective for trainings with regularly updated content or boring subjects. Think of topics such as sales, products, safety, languages, security awareness, compliance or customer service. 

We make knowledge retention fun and lasting longer... One game at a time!

HOW IT WORKS

Create Content:

Fast Authoring

Create and assign unlimited knowledge tests with ease and speed. All you need to do is to build the content and hit the invite button to enhance the effectiveness of your training.

The platform will automatically send a unique URL to all participants and publish the games (this literally only takes a few minutes). No technical skills are needed.

Play Games

Easy Branding

Easily create branded training assignments and deliver an individualized user experience for your trainees. You can personalize automated email templates and billboards with your own logo as well as select a sector-related game background.

The best part? Trainees select their favourite game and desired language themselves!

Engage Participants:

Training can and must be, fun and magical. And that is exactly what we do! Our games promote fun, self-esteem and colleagues interaction. Once published, trainees engage, not because they are forced to, but because they want to.

Training participants can start playing immediately on all devices without installing anything!

 

People ♡ Games

People love Games and thanks to the built-in game mechanisms, our platform has an enormous motivating effect on learning and practising new things. With the press of a button, engaging training assignments are delivered across all devices.

Play Games

Analyse Results:

Our powerful analytics engine provides real-time insights at the global level, the team level and the individual level. The game dashboard allows you to monitor strengths and proactively respond to issues as learners play.

 

 

Cost Effective

The power of games let us measurably improve knowledge retention and course accomplishment rates up to 90%. By also reducing the training development and deployment time by 80%, we make every training program very cost-effective!

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Right now, we have come on Indiegogo, for help raising the funds that we need for operations and further product development. Our funding goal through this crowdfunding campaign is 50000 Euros, which will put us in a solid place financially.

Every contribution, no matter how little, will bring us closer to our goal. To thank-you, we have come up with some excellent perks and incentives, please check the rewards section for more information.

Play Games

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you would not be able to help now, or in the future, there are other ways you can assist or contribute.

Message It Forward - This is when somebody sends you an important message and you forward it to any of your contacts who you think might be interested. Tell people to help spread the words about our campaign.

Endorse Us - Share our campaign. Copy & Paste our campaign link above to your: Facebook, Tweet It (Twitter), Pin It (Pinterest), Picture It (Instagram), Blog It (Blogger/WordPress/Tumblr...), or Link It (Linkedin). Social Media is a key marketing technique and will be a vital factor in the fulfilment of these aspirations.

If you have any questions or inquiries, don't hesitate to get in touch! Thank you for your time reading and participating.

Play Games

 

WE THANK YOU!

story:
MuRatopia and New Innovation Economy-Network University of the Green World, Public Money System, and Green Business Program 

May the worlds be calm and peaceful in the future.

Mozi said: He who rules a large state does not attack small states: he who rules a large house does not molest small houses. The strong does not plunder the weak. The honoured does not demean the humble. The clever does not deceive the stupid. This is beneficial to Heaven above, beneficial to the spirits in the middle sphere, and beneficial to the people below. Being beneficial to these three it is beneficial to all. Mozi, Book 7: Will of Heaven I

A novel scientific theoretical view is needed to deeply understand a new economy “MuRatopia” and monetary public system development.The aim of this new forthcoming book and documentary film “The New Future of Money” is to propose a novel approach empirically grounded on a new scientific economic foundation analysis to unravel the way public monetary economy works and sustainable futures for global national economies.

Partnering with Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi, Ph.D [UC Berkeley] inspired me [Ssemakula Peter Luyima] to become an insatiable learner with great interest to study a new MuRatopian economy, influenced by Professor Yamaguchi’s research work in public money system and forward thinking future.

As a researcher, entrepreneur, participatory leadership community development activist and system design thinker, my aim in collaborating with Professor Yamaguchi is to support his pioneer works by taking an explicit “integrated scientific approach” of how we can study the proposed new MuRatopian economy design of a public money system from the current debt money system.


Professor. Kaoru Yamaguchi, Ph.D, analyzed Congressman Dennis Kucinich's N.E.E.D. act accurately and presented his findings to US Congressional Briefing (July 26th, 2011) on the workings of the public money system. 

Joe Bongiovanni of EconomicStability.org interviews Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi at the American Monetary Reform Conference in Chicago (2010)



Listen to Congressman Dennis Kucinich explaining The Key to Economic Recovery


Part of the reason for writing this book project and working on documentary film, I am dedicated to help advance MuRatopian Economy as an alternative to produce better results through best scientific economic research methodologies for  global public money system communities, business democracy (self-management) and innovation.

Our MuRatopia concept was influenced by the global movement for a new economy, new social design system and curiosity driven research program.

Guided by the futuristic economic ideas of Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi, innovative and creative curiosity driven research, I contacted him to introduce the general concept of MuRatopia in my new forthcoming book: The New Future of Money. He gladly accepted to write a Foreword for the book project.

Passionate about a new economic theory and global development, we have deployed an agenda encompassing a contemporary array of subjects including but not limited to:

Foundations of public money system and evolutionary economics, knowledge and learning in social-economic life, development and innovation technologies, transformation of industrial organizations and economic systems, experimental structural dynamics in economics, system dynamics modeling of socio-economic systems, evolution of the governance structures of firms and other organizations, launching Network University of the Green World, and public money policy proposals in the transformational process of economic life. In short, our starting point is an “integrative economic research science” of new economy and self-management views.

More important, “documentary film” in addition to the book project is an essential key, i.e., as an integrative and/or communicative pictorial link to understand and re-examine the premise of various global economic problems based on both our collaborative works. The conventional meaning adhering to various traditional monetary policies may be more or less obsolete, to be replaced with more current ones vis-à-vis contemporary academic trends.

These attempts are not limited to the field of economic sciences, including business management sciences, but also include social science in general. In that way, understanding the social profiles of complex science may then be within our reach.

In the meantime, contemporary society appears to be evolving into a newly emerging phase, chiefly characterized by an information and communication technology (ICT) mode of production and a service work network system replacing the earlier established factory system with a new one that is suited to actual observations.

In the face of these changes we are urgently compelled to explore a set of new properties for a new socio/economic system by implementing new ideas. We thus are keen to the above mentioned throughout our collaborative works with Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi. We are also encouraged to share new, broader spectrum for establishing a specific method positively integrated in advancing Network University of the Green world-as global mission and an educational project in strategy for public money system and Green Business programs for a better, sustainable and inclusive global solutions.


A New Scientific Economic Research Project and Alternative Approach

In my forthcoming book The New Future of Money and documentary film, we introduce the MuRatopian new economic theory and creative technological development throughout three development approaches:

1.  As a new economy that could lead to a rethinking of the theoretical foundations of our current economic theory. MuRatopian economics is a new movement that is expected to develop interest among the general public and financial practionners. This research leads to a novel approach of a new scientific economy, structural dynamics and global public money system communities. Remarkably, we show that Creative driven Intelligence research approach can be used for studying the scientific national development projects of innovating innovation via creative technological platform research systems.

2.  We study the global economic system and its dynamics, systemic dysfunctions and current problems in order for you to deeply understand the new proposed economic theory as an evolutionary process in the ecosystems of concepts and capabilities. Our goals will be to make better economic system and technological progress and to provide scientific economic methods that support correct theory and better decision-making in formulating many alternative plans to address critical sociological, financial, and environmental issues.

Creativity Driven Intelligence Research Platform


3.  Finally we analyze how the monetary scientific economy works in order to explain the current economic crisis, and advocating for an alternative new economy theory MuRatopian. This new theory draws on the previous findings of Professor Karou Yamaguchi, and demonstrates for the readers how the debt money system can destabilize and then freeze our global economy, which requires monetary reform and public money system to function properly. 

Combining that analysis with MuRatopian Scientific Economy concept, Ssemakula Luyima Peter shows how a “New Economy” can be formed, that can remove the chief cause of both booms and depressions and income inequality!

Visit http://www.muratopianeconomy.tk/  for more information about The New Future of Money.


WHY THIS PRE-ORDER CAMPAIGN IS SO CRITICAL 

So much effort and labor of love has gone into making The New Future of Money a unique and beautiful book: it is an 6x9 inches black-colors, hardcover book with approximately 560 pages. This comes together with a documentary film!!

Our $50,000 fundraising goal will help us to cover:

  • Book publication with Celebrity Press Publishing http://www.celebritybrandingagency.com/ (The New Future of Money publication,15000 print books)
  • TV 7 to 10 minute interview directed by 3x Emmy Award Winning Director, Nick Nanthon. A guest on “Success Today with Bob Guiney” AS Seen on….ABC, NBC, and Fox.
  • Media training calls with professional Television Producer
  • Red Carpet Party
  • Professional PHOTO SHOOT
  • Marketing Coaching Programs
  • Four online press releases commemorating appearance on “Success Today with Bob Guiney.”
  • The New Future of Money Documentary by Celebrity Films Production

Your participation in this campaign not only will be rewarded but will help build awareness about a new scientific economic research, and start the involvement of academic and global community researches in this new branch of economics. We would like hundreds of people to actively be involved in this new emerging field of MuRatopian (self-organization) public money economies and Green Business Program, with introduction of global MuRatopian Institutes and conferences devoted to this new economics.  

The benefit to you, as a devoted The New Future of Money Campaign supporter(s), is that specially tailored rewards will be offered to you for supporting the pioneer efforts of a new scientific economic paradigm. Furthermore, you will be part of a The New Future of Money documentary film to be produced to show how this new MuRatopian economics can deal with complex global problems that other conventional approaches can't even touch. 

Thank you in advance for helping us make this book and upcoming documentary film a reality

The Impact

The impact of The New Future of Money book and documentary film project is as broad as your soul, as profound as your understanding, as high as your dreams, as bright as your vision, as tangible as your persistence.

A marvelous book and documentary film project advanced on behalf of the MuRatopia Institute Awija Island Japan, the first Network University of The Green World strategies and partnerships for Networking people around the world to learn anywhere and anytime, with annual summer meetings for global village human communications in Awaji Island, Japan.


                         MuRatopia Institute based in Awaji Island, Japan

The Best thought on Green Business Worldwide representing all the different types of institutions-government, private sector, entrepreneurs, SMEs, universities, corporate business, technology and research centres.

Three Networks We are building:

1.  Networking people around the world for learning anywhere and anytime, with annual summer meetings for global-village human communications in Awaji Island, Japan.

2.  Networking five interrelated fields of study: Mind, Model, Nature, Technology and Economy

3.  Networking present and future generations for a Green World (by Green we symbolize Sustainability).

Network (2) and (3) are synthesized to form a new field of study: Future Oriented Complexity and Adaptation Studies (FOCAS), which is combined with (1) to establish the "Network University of the Green World for FOCAS".

Before the imperative for sustainable growth and MuRatopian Market Economy Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi initiated Green Program explained below, with advices from sustainability scholars and specialists around the world, at the Doshisha Business School, Doshisha University, Kyoto, Japan, in 2009.

The program was very successful for the first 3 years, and the program received a world-wide recognition as a sustainable alternative MBA Program.

It is our hope that this sustainable Green Business Program with the Campaign support of The New Future of Money book and documentary film will market the re-establishment of the Green Business Program worldwide, together with the implementation of the Public Money System, according to Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi Public Money System and Sustainability is inseparable.






Green Business Program is expected to gain different dimensions of impact as strategic enabler, sustainable development change maker, as a platform for business democracy (self-management) public money system communities, employment creation transformation and thought leadership.

The New Future of Money and documentary film will be presented for nomination of the Quill Awards 2016 together with my mentor's Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi's "Public Money" book.



                                PERKS

New Future of Money 325 ml Classic White Mug $18.40 + Shipping

Wake up to the smell of freshly-brewed coffee. Sip hot chocolate on a frosty night. Share tea with a friend.

This form fitting case covers the back and corners of your iPhone 5/5S with an impact resistant, flexible plastic shell, while still providing access to all ports and buttons. Designed for the iPhone 5 and iPhone 5S, this sleek and lightweight case is the perfect way to show off your support for The New Future of Money Project.

Stainless Steel 441 ml New Future of Money Mug $27.56 +Shipping

Our New Future of Money travel mugs are made of double-walled stainless steel that will keep your coffee piping hot through a busy morning or long commute. They are not only durable, but are also easy to clean. The comfort-grip handle with thumb rest is perfect for keeping hold of your precious cup of coffee while on the train or in the car. So, this is a must-have The New Future of Money Mug.

New Future of Money Art, Hand Nails Stickers $23.02 + shipping


Extend fashion to your fingertips with New Future of Money Art! Worn by fashion forward celebrities, these salon quality nail coverings add instant glamour to your outfit. New Future of Money nails can be easily applied in-home or at your local New Future of Money salon. Turn your fingers into a fashion statement in support of New Future of Money!

New Future of Money Pen-Urban $5.70 + shipping

Even with fancy modern technology, we all still like to scribble down those notes with a good old-fashioned pen. So our answer to the modern pen is a New Future of Money pen! With New Future of Money pen, you'll never be rummaging for a boring pen again.


New Future of Money mouse pad- $12.70 + shipping

New Future of Money mouse pad for home or office! Decorate your desk with New Future of Money mouse pad that looks great and protect your mouse from scratches and debris.


New Future of Money Leather Strap W Wrist Watches $86.15 + shipping

New Future of Money Watch features a polished and matte steel finish for a sporty and rugged look. Designed with the modern man in mind, this watch is constructed with a black rubber strap and a striking protector cap.


 

The New Future of Money iPad Air Cover $52.27

Keep your iPad Air safe while looking sleek with a thin and lightweight custom cover. The New Future of Money cover attaches to your iPad with magnets to protect your screen, and a clever wake/sleep magnet turns your iPad on when it opens and off when it closes. You can even fold the cover into a triangular stand to support the iPad in various viewing angles. For all over protection, pair your cover with a matching New Future of Money case!

-

New Future of Money Commuter Laptop Messenger Bag $134 + shipping

Upgrade your daily commute with a New Future of Money laptop bag! Made in San Francisco with a focus on sustainability and durability, this laptop bag stands up to daily wear and tear. With a pocket for everything from a laptop to a journal, this work bag will become an essential.

·  Water resistant, extra durable construction.

·  Holds up to 15" laptop (sleeve included).

·  Two large front pockets and rear organisational pocket.

·  Magnetic silencers, Velcro, and clip flap fasteners.

·  Made with a sustainability focus in San Francisco, CA.

·  Dimensions 27.9 cm h x 40 cm w x 12 cm d (11" h x 15.75" w x 4.75" d).

New Future of Money Thermo (0.3L), Smoked Pearl $46.00 + shipping

Make sure your drinks are not too hot, not too cold but just right with SIGG New Future of Money Thermo bottles. They keep your hot liquids perfectly warm for up to eight hours. So cosy up for with these quality thermos bottles, and sip your tea or coffee in peace.

·  Thermo bottle size: 0.3L (19.8 cm tall x 7.1 cm diameter).

·  Made from top quality stainless steel that is both odour and taste neutral.

·  Designed to keep your cold liquids cold and hot liquids hot for up to eight hours.

·  Include a removable tea filter.

·  100% BPA free (exceeds FDA requirements for nontoxic and non-leaching products).

·  Phthalates free.

·  Reusable aluminium water bottle is coated with metallic non-toxic paint and comes with the standard SIGG Black Screw Top.

·  No Weird Taste: Non-toxic baked-on inner-lining does not impart odours or tastes.

·  Light-weight but Strong: Weighs no more than a plastic water bottle.

·  Leak-proof: Seamless construction made from a single piece of pure aluminium.

·  Cool Designs: SIGG bottles are as good to look at as they are to drink from. Baked on powder coat finish lasts for years. Quality designs are printed using the latest UV technology, and will not fade after washing.

·  Recyclable: SIGG bottles are pure aluminium and recyclable when they finally require replacement.

·  Hand wash only. Not recommended for dishwasher.

·  Sleek Swiss design.

The New Future of Money iPhone / iPad case $79.77


The New Future of Money iPad Case is an ultra-thin plastic case that protects the back and sides of your iPad without adding bulk.

·  Printed in the USA.

·  Designed for the Apple iPad 2/3/4 and iPad with Retina display.

The New Future of Money SIGG Water Bottle $46.00 + shipping

Drink more water. Your skin, hair, body, and mind will thank you. And with quality The New Future of Money SIGG water bottles, even your sense of style will thank you too. Hydration never looked so good!

The aluminium SIGG Traveller (1.0-litre) screw top bottle minimises taste-retention and residue build up thanks to an aluminium lining that ensures a clean, crisp sip every time. Its sturdy extruded aluminium design means you'll be using it for years to come. Why toss out yet another plastic bottle, or let plastic chemicals leach into your water, when you could use a stylish, timeless The New Future of Money SIGG bottle instead?

·  Bottle size: 1.0L (20.3 cm tall x 8.3 cm diameter).

·  100% BPA free (exceeds FDA requirements for nontoxic and non-leaching products).

·  Reusable aluminium water bottle is coated with metallic non-toxic paint and comes with the standard SIGG Black Screw Top.

·  No Weird Taste: Non-toxic baked-on inner-lining does not impart odours or tastes.

·  Light-weight but Strong: Weighs no more than a plastic water bottle.

·  Leak-proof: Seamless construction made from a single piece of pure aluminium.

·  Cool Designs: SIGG bottles are as good to look at as they are to drink from. Baked on powder coat finish lasts for years. Quality designs are printed using the latest UV technology, and will not fade after washing.

·  Recyclable: SIGG bottles are pure aluminium and recyclable when they finally require replacement.

·  Hand wash only. Not recommended for dishwasher.

·  Made in Switzerland.

·  Designer Tip: To ensure the highest quality print, please note that this product’s customisable design area measures 25.3 cm x 14.9 cm.

The New Future of Money dog leads $27.57 + shipping

Walk your favourite canine with New Future of Money dog lead!

  1. Dimensions: .75" w x 72" l.
  2. Metal hook to attach to collar or harness.
  3. Comes in durable, machine-washable, heavy-duty black nylon webbing.
New Future of Money Round (Large) Wall Clock $35.23 + shipping


Keep an eye on the time with a New Future of Money round wall clock. Featured in two sizes, this wall clock is vibrantly printed with the AcryliPrint®HD process. A timeless treasure for your walls.
1.2 sizes: 8" diameter (medium) or 10.75" diameter (large).
2. One AA battery required (not included).

The New Future of Money Notebook $15.27 + shipping


Stay organised with New Future of Money notebook! Keep track of all those important notes and reminders.

  1. Size: 16.5 cm x 22. 2 cm (6.5" x 8.75")
  2. 80 black & white lined pages
  3. Lay-flat spiral binding



DESIGN STRATEGY AND INNOVATION, NEW ECONOMY

I have been looking always for a way to leverage and integrate the creative education and the analytical in strategy, research, investigating, strategic facilitation and structural dynamics thinking for innovation and sustainable development, as a solution to the current mounting economic and other catastrophic problems taking down humanity.

Inspired by the multidisciplinary integral thinking of Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi of the New MuRatopian Economy, the monetary science   thinking of Stephen Zarlenga of American Monetary Institute, the works of Nobel Laureate Dr. Jerome Karle, the Future oriented thinking approach of Prof. Kaoru Yamaguchi which all are integrated in my work to help offer solutions advanced in five inseparable fields of studies:

1. Wisdom and Self-Awareness Studies

2. Future-Oriented Methodological studies

3. Human nature interrelated studies

4. Human technology interface studies

5. Inter-human Networking Studies

MuRatopian design thinking fosters creativity, cross-sector collaboration and sustainable global innovation.

The approach not only puts a bridge between the current paradigm and the creative futuristic mind, but questioning our status quo and gets us back to questioning and seeking answers to our present global problems, impulsing reinvention of eco-systems, our education system and the design of optimal solutions and purpose oriented, self-management organizations.

A universal method for complex problems solving and multiple stakeholders management, MuRatopian design thinking offers a structured guide for creative experimentation and works on a whole set of values for critical thinking, human-centered design, participatory leadership, multidisciplinary, cross-sector collaboration and entrepreneurship  

It sets the fundamental competencies for the new economy of self-management design, creating an impact transversally on all areas for superior value creation.

MuRatopian design thinking develops:

1. Observation skills for ambiguous and unstructured problems

2. Empathic, qualitatively superior FOCAS research

3. Creating confidence in idea, scenario generation, prototyping

4. Business democracy, visual thinking, futurization

5. Public money administration design of strategy, process, service, product, program, campaign, movement, seminars, etc. 

FAQ

How can I order The New Future of Money book project and products?

You can order right here on the indiegogo page. People who back the book project and documentary film get to receive our products on whole sale price and save a bunch on the future retail prices.

Can I purchase The New Future of Money products in retail stores?

We are hopeful that The New Future of Money book/documentary film project and products will be wildly successful with our indiegogo launch—and hence enhance the chances of large retailers. Our plan is to have The New Future of Money products become a stable product in all major retailers in 2016.

Can I market your products?

You can definitely and order our New Future of Money products at reduced price as you would like- the more the better in support of our upcoming documentary and book promotion tours.

When are your products expected to ship?

We expect it will take us three months from the time the indiegogo programs ends until we are able to complete all shipments. The first shipment will be out within 60 days.

HELP US HELP YOU!

Don't think you can be part of the The New Future of Money exciting new economy community? Think again, because there are many ways you can help us, even without pledging for a product.

  1. Share The New Future of Money with your friends, family, and relatives. Get the word out and be a part of our referral competition.
  2. Pledge the supporter perks to get updates, book promotions and documentary film.
story_txt:
MuRatopia and New Innovation Economy-Network University of the Green World, Public Money System, and Green Business Program 



May the worlds be calm and peaceful in the
future.
Mozi
said: He who rules a large state does not attack small states: he who rules a
large house does not molest small houses. The strong does not plunder the weak.
The honoured does not demean the humble. The clever does not deceive the
stupid. This is beneficial to Heaven above, beneficial to the spirits in the
middle sphere, and beneficial to the people below. Being beneficial to these
three it is beneficial to all. Mozi, Book 7: Will of Heaven I
A novel
scientific theoretical view is needed to deeply understand a new economy “MuRatopia” and monetary
public system development.The
aim of this new forthcoming book and documentary film “The New Future
of Money” is to propose a novel approach empirically grounded on a
new scientific economic foundation analysis to unravel the way public monetary
economy works and sustainable futures for global national economies.
Partnering
with Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi, Ph.D [UC Berkeley] inspired me [Ssemakula Peter Luyima] to become an insatiable learner with great interest to study
a new MuRatopian economy, influenced by Professor Yamaguchi’s research work in
public money system and forward thinking future.
As a researcher, entrepreneur, participatory leadership community
development activist and system design thinker, my aim in collaborating with
Professor Yamaguchi is to support his pioneer works by taking an explicit “integrated scientific approach” of how we can
study the proposed new MuRatopian economy design of a public money system from
the current debt money system.





Professor. Kaoru Yamaguchi, Ph.D, analyzed Congressman Dennis Kucinich's
N.E.E.D. act accurately and presented his findings to US Congressional Briefing (July 26th, 2011) on the workings of the public money system. 
Joe Bongiovanni of EconomicStability.org interviews Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi at the American Monetary Reform Conference in Chicago (2010)




Listen to Congressman Dennis Kucinich explaining The Key to Economic Recovery


Part
of the reason for writing this book project and working on documentary film, I am dedicated to help advance
MuRatopian Economy as an alternative to produce better results through best scientific
economic research methodologies for  global public money system communities, business democracy (self-management) and
innovation.




Our MuRatopia concept was influenced by the global movement for a new
economy, new social design system and curiosity driven research program.
Guided by the futuristic economic ideas of Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi,
innovative and creative curiosity driven research, I contacted him to introduce
the general concept of MuRatopia in my new forthcoming book: The New Future of
Money. He gladly accepted to write a Foreword for the book project.
Passionate about a new economic theory and global development, we have
deployed an agenda encompassing a contemporary array of subjects including but
not limited to:
Foundations of public money system and evolutionary economics, knowledge
and learning in social-economic life, development and innovation technologies,
transformation of industrial organizations and economic systems, experimental
structural dynamics in economics, system dynamics modeling of socio-economic
systems, evolution of the governance structures of firms and other
organizations, launching Network University of the Green World, and public
money policy proposals in the transformational process of economic life. In
short, our starting point is an “integrative economic research science” of new economy and self-management views.
More important, “documentary film” in addition to the book project is an essential key, i.e., as an
integrative and/or communicative pictorial link to understand and re-examine
the premise of various global economic problems based on both our collaborative
works. The conventional meaning adhering to various traditional monetary
policies may be more or less obsolete, to be replaced with more current ones
vis-à-vis contemporary academic trends.
These attempts are not limited to the field of economic sciences,
including business management sciences, but also include social science in
general. In that way, understanding the social profiles of complex science may
then be within our reach.
In the meantime, contemporary society appears to be evolving into a
newly emerging phase, chiefly characterized by an information and communication
technology (ICT) mode of production and a service work network system replacing
the earlier established factory system with a new one that is suited to actual
observations.

In the face of these
changes we are urgently compelled to explore a set of new properties for a new
socio/economic system by implementing new ideas. We thus are keen to the above
mentioned throughout our collaborative works with Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi. We
are also encouraged to share new, broader spectrum for establishing a specific
method positively integrated in advancing Network University of the Green
world-as global mission and an educational project in strategy for public
money system and Green Business programs for a better, sustainable and
inclusive global solutions.




A
New Scientific Economic Research Project and Alternative Approach
In my forthcoming book The New Future of Money and documentary film, we introduce the
MuRatopian new economic theory and creative technological development
throughout three development approaches:
1.  As a
new economy that could lead to a rethinking of the theoretical foundations of
our current economic theory. MuRatopian economics is a new movement that is
expected to develop interest among the general public and financial practionners.
This research leads to a novel approach of a new scientific economy, structural
dynamics and global public money system communities. Remarkably, we show that Creative
driven Intelligence research approach can be used for studying the scientific
national development projects of innovating innovation via creative technological
platform research systems. 
2.  We
study the global economic system and its dynamics, systemic dysfunctions and
current problems in order for you to deeply understand the new proposed
economic theory as an evolutionary process in the ecosystems of concepts and
capabilities. Our goals will be to make better economic system and
technological progress and to provide scientific economic methods that support correct
theory and better decision-making in formulating many alternative plans to
address critical sociological, financial, and environmental issues.
Creativity Driven Intelligence Research Platform



3.  Finally
we analyze how the monetary scientific economy works in order to explain the current economic crisis, and advocating for an alternative
new economy theory MuRatopian. This new theory draws on the previous findings
of Professor Karou Yamaguchi, and demonstrates for the readers how the debt
money system can destabilize and then freeze our global economy, which requires
monetary reform and public money system to function properly. 
Combining that analysis with
MuRatopian Scientific Economy concept, Ssemakula Luyima Peter shows how a “New Economy” can be formed,
that can remove the chief cause of both booms and depressions and income
inequality!
Visit http://www.muratopianeconomy.tk/  for more information about The New Future of Money.


WHY THIS PRE-ORDER CAMPAIGN IS SO CRITICAL 




So much effort and labor of love has
gone into making The New Future of Money
a unique and beautiful book: it is an 6x9 inches black-colors, hardcover book with approximately 560 pages. This comes together with a documentary film!!
Our $50,000 fundraising goal will
help us to cover:



Book publication
with Celebrity Press Publishing http://www.celebritybrandingagency.com/
(The New Future of Money publication,15000 print books)


TV 7 to 10 minute
interview directed by 3x Emmy Award Winning Director, Nick Nanthon. A guest on “Success Today with
Bob Guiney” AS Seen on….ABC, NBC, and Fox.


Media training
calls with professional Television Producer


Red Carpet Party


Professional PHOTO SHOOT


Marketing Coaching
Programs


Four online press
releases commemorating appearance on “Success Today with Bob Guiney.”


The New Future of Money Documentary by
Celebrity Films Production


Your participation in this campaign not only will be rewarded
but will help build awareness about a new scientific economic research, and
start the involvement of academic and global community researches in this new
branch of economics. We would like hundreds of people to actively be involved
in this new emerging field of MuRatopian (self-organization) public money economies and Green Business Program,
with introduction of global MuRatopian Institutes and conferences devoted to
this new economics.  
The benefit to you, as a devoted The New Future of Money
Campaign supporter(s), is that specially tailored rewards will be offered to
you for supporting the pioneer efforts of a new scientific economic paradigm.
Furthermore, you will be part of a The New Future of Money documentary film to
be produced to show how this new MuRatopian economics can deal with complex
global problems that other conventional approaches can't even touch. Thank you in advance for helping us make this book and upcoming documentary film a realityThe Impact 
The impact of The New Future of
Money book and documentary film project is as broad as your soul, as profound
as your understanding, as high as your dreams, as bright as your vision, as
tangible as your persistence.
A marvelous book and documentary film project advanced on behalf of the
MuRatopia Institute Awija Island Japan, the first Network University of The
Green World strategies and partnerships for Networking people around the world to learn anywhere and anytime, with annual summer meetings for global
village human communications in Awaji Island, Japan.                          MuRatopia Institute based in Awaji Island, Japan
The Best thought on Green
Business Worldwide representing all the different types of institutions-government,
private sector, entrepreneurs, SMEs, universities, corporate business, technology
and research centres.
Three Networks We are building:
1. 
Networking
people around the world for learning anywhere and anytime, with annual summer
meetings for global-village human communications in Awaji Island, Japan.
2. 
Networking
five interrelated fields of study: Mind, Model, Nature, Technology and Economy
3. 
Networking
present and future generations for a Green World (by Green we symbolize
Sustainability).
Network (2) and
(3) are synthesized to form a new field of study: Future Oriented Complexity
and Adaptation Studies (FOCAS), which is combined with (1) to establish the
"Network University of the Green World for FOCAS". 
Before the imperative
for sustainable growth and MuRatopian Market Economy Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi
initiated Green Program explained below, with advices from sustainability
scholars and specialists around the world, at the Doshisha Business School,
Doshisha University, Kyoto, Japan, in 2009.
The program was
very successful for the first 3 years, and the program received a world-wide
recognition as a sustainable alternative MBA Program.
It is our hope that
this sustainable Green Business Program with the Campaign support of The New Future of Money book and
documentary film will market the re-establishment of the Green Business Program
worldwide, together with the implementation of the Public Money System,
according to Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi Public Money System and Sustainability
is inseparable.














Green Business Program is expected to gain different dimensions of impact as strategic enabler, sustainable development change maker, as a platform for business democracy (self-management) public money system communities, employment creation transformation and thought leadership.The New Future of Money and documentary film will be presented for nomination of the Quill Awards 2016 together with my mentor's Professor Kaoru Yamaguchi's "Public Money" book.

Mug $18.40 + Shipping
 

Wake up to the smell of freshly-brewed coffee. Sip hot chocolate on a frosty night. Share tea with a friend.
iPhone 5/5S, The New Future of Money iPhone 5 Case $46.12 per case + shipping

iPhone with The New Future of Money iPhone 5 Case. This form fitting case

flexible plastic shell, while still providing access to all ports and buttons. Designed
for the iPhone 5 and iPhone 5S, this sleek and lightweight case is the perfect
way to show off your support for The New Future of Money Project.
Stainless
Steel 441 ml New Future of Money Mug $27.56 +Shipping

Our New Future of Money travel mugs are made of double-walled stainless steel
that will keep your coffee piping hot through a busy morning or long commute. They
are not only durable, but are also easy to clean. The comfort-grip handle with
thumb rest is perfect for keeping hold of your precious cup of coffee while on
the train or in the car. So, this is a must-have The New Future of Money Mug.
New
Future of Money Art, Hand Nails Stickers $23.02 + shipping



Extend fashion to your fingertips with New Future of Money Art! Worn by
fashion forward celebrities, these salon quality nail coverings add instant
glamour to your outfit. New Future of Money nails can be easily applied in-home
or at your local New Future of Money salon. Turn your fingers into a fashion
statement in support of New Future of Money!
New Future of Money Pen-Urban $5.70 + shipping

New Future of Money mouse pad- $12.70 + shipping

New Future of Money Leather Strap W Wrist Watches $86.15 + shipping

constructed with a black rubber strap and a striking protector cap.
 

The New Future of Money iPad Air Cover $52.27

stand to support the iPad in various viewing angles. For all over protection,
pair your cover with a matching New Future of Money case!
